  8566                                  ; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8567                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8568                                  
  8569                                  _$SET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR:
  8570 00000F90 E81F00                  	CALL	RECSET
  8571 00000F93 FA                      	CLI				; Watch out!!!!! Folks sometimes use
  8572 00000F94 268917                  	MOV	[ES:BX],DX		;   this for hardware ints (like timer).
  8573 00000F97 268C5F02                	MOV	[ES:BX+2],DS
  8574 00000F9B FB                      	STI
  8575                                  					; M004, M068 - Start
  8576                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8577 00000F9C 36F606[8600]04          	test	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; 4
  8578                                  					; Q: was the previous call an int 21h
  8579                                  					;    exec call

  8582                                  	;retn				; N: return
  8583                                  	; 15/12/2022
  8584 00000FA2 740D                    	jz	short siv_2
  8585                                  siv_1:	
  8586 00000FA4 36803E[8500]00          	cmp	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0 ; Q: is count 0
  8587 00000FAA 7505                    	jnz	short siv_2		 ; N: done 
  8588                                  	; 20/09/2023
  8589 00000FAC 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]
  8590                                  	;mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],1 ; Y: set it to 1 to indicate to dos
  8591                                  					 ; dispatcher to turn A20 Off before
  8592                                  					 ; returning to user.
  8593                                  siv_2:
  8594                                  	; 07/12/2022
  8595 00000FB1 C3                      	retn				; M004, M068 - End
  8596                                  	
  8597                                  RECSET:

  8602 00000FBA D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1

  8605                                  ;	BREAK <$Char_Oper - hack on paths, switches so that xenix can look like PCDOS>
  8606                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8607                                  
  8608                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8609                                  ;
  8610                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8611                                  ;
  8612                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8613                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8614                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8615                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8616                                  ;			Always returns available
  8617                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8618                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8619                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8620                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8621                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8622                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8623                                  ;
  8624                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8625                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8626                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8627                                  
  8628                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8629                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8630                                  
  8631                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8632                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8633                                  
  8634                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8635                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8636 00000FBD 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8637 00000FBF B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8638 00000FC1 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8639 00000FC3 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8640 00000FC5 B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8641 00000FC7 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8642 00000FC9 C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8643                                  
  8644                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8645                                  ; value to return
  8646                                  
  8647                                  chop_1:
  8648 00000FCA E8AAF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8649 00000FCD 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8650 00000FD0 C3                      	retn
  8651                                  
  8652                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  8653                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
  8654                                  	;push	ss
  8655                                  	;pop	ds
  8656                                  	;cmp	al,1
  8657                                  	;jb	short chop_1
  8658                                  	;jz	short chop_2
  8659                                  	;cmp	al,3
  8660                                  	;jb	short chop_3
  8661                                  	;jz	short chop_5

  8678                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8679                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8680                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8681                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8682                                  ;
  8683                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8684                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8685                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8686                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8687                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8688                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8689                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8690                                  
  8691                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8692                                  
  8693                                  _$GetExtendedError:
  8694 00000FD1 16                      	push	ss
  8695 00000FD2 1F                      	pop	ds
  8696 00000FD3 A1[2403]                	MOV	AX,[EXTERR]
  8697 00000FD6 C43E[2803]              	LES	DI,[EXTERRPT]
  8698 00000FDA 8B1E[2603]              	MOV	BX,[EXTERR_ACTION]	; BL = Action, BH = Class
  8699 00000FDE 8A2E[2303]              	MOV	CH,[EXTERR_LOCUS]
  8700 00000FE2 E892F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8701                                  	;mov	[si+0Ah],di
  8702 00000FE5 897C0A                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DI],DI
  8703                                  
  8704                                  	; 09/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  8705                                  	;;mov	[si+10h],es
  8706                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_ES],ES
  8707                                  	;;mov	[si+2],bx

  8740                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>

  8743                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8744                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location

  8747                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)

  9293                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9294                                  ;
  9295                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9296                                  ;
  9297                                  ;   Modification history:
  9298                                  ;
  9299                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9300                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9301                                  ;
  9302                                  
  9303                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9304                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9305                                  ; Inputs:
  9306                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9307                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9308                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9309                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9310                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9311                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9312                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9313                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9314                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9315                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9316                                  ; Function:
  9317                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9318                                  ; Returns:
  9319                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9320                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9321                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9322                                  
  9323                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9324                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9325                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9326                                  
  9327                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9328 000012EA E81842                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9329 000012ED 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9330 000012EE E886F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9331                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9332 000012F1 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9333 000012F4 C3                      	retn
  9334                                  
  9335                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9336                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9337                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9338                                  
  9339                                  set_exerr_locus_unk:

  9341 000012F6 B001                    	mov     al,1		; errLOC_Unk

  9343 000012F8 36A2[2303]                      mov	[ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],al
  9344 000012FC 58                              pop	ax
  9345 000012FD C3                              retn

  9379                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9380                                  ;
  9381                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9382                                  ;
  9383                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9384                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9385                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9386                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9387                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9388                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9389                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9390                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9391                                  ;	USES	all
  9392                                  ;
  9393                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9394                                  ;
  9395                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9396                                  ;
  9397                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9398                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9399                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9400                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9401                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9402                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9403                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9404                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9405                                  ;	USES	all
  9406                                  ;
  9407                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9408                                  ;
  9409                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9410                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51E2h
  9411                                  
  9412                                  _$SLEAZEFUNC:
  9413                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9414 0000130D B200                    	MOV	DL,0
  9415                                  _$SLEAZEFUNCDL:
  9416 0000130F 16                      	push	ss
  9417 00001310 1F                      	pop	ds
  9418                                  	
  9419 00001311 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
  9420 00001313 E8A75D                  	call	GETTHISDRV		; Get CDS structure
  9421                                  SET_AL_RET:
  9422                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  9423                                  	;;mov	al, 0Fh
  9424                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error	;AC000;
  9425                                  	
  9426                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 3.3
  9427 00001316 7229                    	JC	short BADSLDRIVE
  9428                                  
  9429 00001318 E8C01F                  	call	DISK_INFO
  9430                                  	;JC	short SET_AL_RET	; User FAILed to I 24
  9431 0000131B 7224                    	jc	short BADSLDRIVE
  9432 0000131D 8826[9805]              	MOV	[FATBYTE],AH	; FAT (MEDIA) ID byte
  9433                                  
  9434                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9435                                  	;;;
  9436 00001321 30E4                    	xor     ah, ah		; AH = 0
  9437                                  				; AL = sectors per cluster
  9438 00001323 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9439 00001324 E81A05                  	call    TestNet
  9440 00001327 5F                      	pop     di
  9441 00001328 7205                    	jc      short sleazefunc1
  9442 0000132A 51                      	push    cx		; bytes per sector
  9443 0000132B E8386E                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  9444 0000132E 59                      	pop     cx		; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  9445                                  				; dx = number of clusters (modified)
  9446                                  				; if bytes per cluster > 16384
  9447                                  				;    bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated parm sign)
  9448                                  sleazefunc1:
  9449                                  	;;;
  9450                                  
  9451                                  ; NOTE THAT A FIXED MEMORY CELL IS USED --> THIS CALL IS NOT
  9452                                  ; RE-ENTRANT. USERS BETTER GET THE ID BYTE BEFORE THEY MAKE THE
  9453                                  ; CALL AGAIN
  9454                                  
  9455                                  	;MOV	DI,FATBYTE
  9456                                  	; 10/01/2024 
  9457                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; AL has sectors/cluster
  9458 0000132F E845F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9459                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  9460                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9461                                  	;mov	[si+2],di
  9462 00001332 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  9463 00001335 895C06                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],BX
  9464                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],DI
  9465                                  	; 10/01/2024
  9466 00001338 C74402[9805]            	MOV	word [SI+user_env.user_BX],FATBYTE
  9467                                  	
  9468                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],ss
  9469 0000133D 8C540E                  	MOV     [SI+user_env.user_DS],SS ; stash correct pointer
  9470                                  
  9471 00001340 C3                      	retn
  9472                                  
  9473                                  BADSLDRIVE:
  9474 00001341 E94BF3                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR

 10089                                  setend:
 10090                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10091                                  ;
 10092                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10093                                  	inc	bx
 10094                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10095                                  ;
 10096                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10097                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10098                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10099                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10100                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10101                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10102                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10103                                  ;
 10104                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10105                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10106                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10107                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10108                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10109                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10110                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10111                                  ;
 10112                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10113                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10114                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10115                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10116                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10117                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10118                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10119                                  ;
 10120                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10121                                  
 10122                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10123                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10124                                  ;	  clusters down
 10125                                  
 10126                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10127                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10128                                  
 10129                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10130                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10131                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10132                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10133                                  
 10134                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10135                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10136                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10137                                  
 10138                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10139                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10140                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10141                                  
 10142                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10143                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10144                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10145                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10146                                  	shr	dx,1
 10147                                  
 10148                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10149                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10150                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10151                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10152                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10153                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10154                                  					; number of clusters.
 10155                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10156                                  
 10157                                  	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
 10158                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10159                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10160                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10161                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10162                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10163                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10164                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10165                                  
 10166                                  setend_fat12:
 10167                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10168                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10169                                  
 10170                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10171                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10172                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10173                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10174                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10175                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10176                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10177                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10178                                  
 10179                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10180                                  
 10181                                  setend_fat16:
 10182                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10183                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10184                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10185                                  
 10186                                  setend_faterr:
 10187                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10188                                  
 10189                                  setend_fat:
 10190                                  
 10191                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10192                                  
 10193                                  ;	end M008
 10194                                  
 10195

 10202                                  					; Init so first ALLOC starts at
 10203                                  					; begining of FAT

 10205                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 10206                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; current count is invalid.
 10207                                  
 10208                                  	retn

 10682                                  
 10683                                  	;entry	SETMEM
 10684                                  
 10685                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10686                                  	; cx = 0
 10687                                  
 10688                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10689                                  ; Inputs:
 10690                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10691                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10692                                  ; Function:
 10693                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10694                                  ;	specified segment.
 10695                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10696                                  ; Outputs:
 10697                                  ;	DS = DX
 10698                                  ;	ES = DX
 10699                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10700                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10701                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10702                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10703                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10704                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10705                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10706                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10707                                  
 10708                                  SETMEM:
 10709                                  	;XOR	CX,CX
 10710                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10711                                  	; cx = 0
 10712 000016DD 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 10713 000016DF 8EC2                    	MOV	ES,DX
 10714                                  	;mov	si,88h
 10715 000016E1 BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate
 10716                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10717 000016E4 BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10718                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10719                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10720 000016E7 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10721 000016E9 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10722 000016EB 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10723 000016EF 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10724 000016F1 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10725 000016F4 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10726 000016F6 B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10727                                  HAVDIF:
 10728 000016F9 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10729 000016FC BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10730 000016FF 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10731 00001701 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10732 00001703 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10733 00001705 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10734                                  
 10735                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10736                                  	;
 10737                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10738                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10739                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10740                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10741                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10742                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10743                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10744                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10745                                  	; into the PSP.
 10746                                  	;
 10747                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10748                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10749                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10750                                  	; for all cases.
 10751                                  	;
 10752                                  
 10753                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10754                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10755                                  
 10756 00001707 A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10757 0000170A 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10758                                  
 10759                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10760 0000170E 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10761                                  					;    memory left
 10762 00001711 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10763                                  					;    OK
 10764                                  					; N: 
 10765                                  
 10766 00001713 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10767 00001719 C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10768                                  addr_ok:
 10769                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10770 0000171F C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10771                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10772 00001725 C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10773                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10774 0000172A C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10775                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10776 00001730 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10777                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10778 00001735 C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10779                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10780 0000173B 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10781                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10782 0000173F C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10783                                  ;
 10784                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10785                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10786                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10787                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10788                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10789                                  ;
 10790                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10791 00001745 C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10792                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10793 0000174B C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10794                                  
 10795                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10796                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10797                                  
 10798                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10799                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10800 00001751 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10801                                  
 10802 00001758 C3                      	retn
 10803

 10806                                  ;BREAK <$GSetMediaID -- get set media ID>
 10807                                  
 10808                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10809                                  ; Inputs:
 10810                                  ;	BL= drive number as defined in IOCTL
 10811                                  ;	AL= 0 get media ID
 10812                                  ;	    1 set media ID
 10813                                  ;	DS:DX= buffer containing information
 10814                                  ;		DW  0  info level (set on input)
 10815                                  ;		DD  ?  serial #
 10816                                  ;		DB  11 dup(?)  volume id
 10817                                  ;		DB   8 dup(?)  file system type
 10818                                  ; Function:
 10819                                  ;	Get or set media ID
 10820                                  ; Returns:
 10821                                  ;	carry clear, DS:DX is filled
 10822                                  ;	carry set, error
 10823                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10824                                  
 10825                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10826                                  
 10827                                  ; 14/01/2024
 10828                                  %if 0
 10829                                  
 10830                                  _$GSetMediaID:
 10831                                  	; RAWIO - GET_MEDIA_ID
 10832                                  	mov	cx,0866h	      ;AN000;MS.; assume get for IOCTL
 10833                                  	cmp	al,0		      ;AN001;MS.; get ?
 10834                                  	je	short doioctl 	      ;AN000;MS.; yes

 10929                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10930                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10931                                  ;
 10932                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10933                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10934                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10935                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10936                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10937                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10938                                  
 10939                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10940                                  
 10941                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10942                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10943                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10944                                  StrCmp:
 10945 000017A7 56                      	push	si
 10946 000017A8 57                      	push	di
 10947 000017A9 50                      	push	ax
 10948                                  Cmplp:
 10949 000017AA AC                      	LODSB
 10950 000017AB E8903E                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10951 000017AE E8E23E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10952 000017B1 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10953 000017B3 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10954 000017B6 47                      	INC	DI
 10955 000017B7 E8843E                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10956 000017BA E8D63E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10957 000017BD 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10958 000017BF 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 10959                                  
 10960 000017C1 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10961 000017C3 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 10962                                  PopRet:
 10963 000017C5 58                      	pop	ax
 10964 000017C6 5F                      	pop	di
 10965 000017C7 5E                      	pop	si
 10966 000017C8 C3                      	retn
 10967                                  
 10968                                  ;Break <STRCPY - copy ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI>

 10971                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 10972                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 10973                                  ;	characters.
 10974                                  ;
 10975                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 10976                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 10977                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string
 10978                                  ;		DS:SI point byte after nul byte at end of source string
 10979                                  ;   Registers modified: SI,DI
 10980                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10981

 10983 000017C9 50                      	push	ax
 10984                                  CPYLoop:

 11076                                  ;Break	<Idle - wait for a specified amount of time>
 11077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11078                                  ;
 11079                                  ;   Idle - when retrying an operation due to a lock/sharing violation,
 11080                                  ;   	   we spin until RetryLoop is exhausted.
 11081                                  ;
 11082                                  ;   Inputs:	RetryLoop is the number of times we spin
 11083                                  ;   Outputs:	Wait
 11084                                  ;   Registers modified: none

 11108                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11110                                  ;
 11111                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11112                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11113                                  ;
 11114                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11115                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11116                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11117                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11118                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11119                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11120                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11121                                  
 11122                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11123 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11124 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11125 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11126 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11127 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11128 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11129                                  endstruc
 11130                                  
 11131                                  TableDispatch:
 11132 00001816 55                      	PUSH	BP
 11133 00001817 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP
 11134 00001819 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save BX
 11135                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+6]
 11136 0000181A 8B5E06                  	MOV	BX,[BP+TFrame.Tab]	; get pointer to table
 11137 0000181D 2E8A1F                  	MOV	BL,[CS:BX]		; maximum index
 11138                                  	;cmp	[bp+4],bl
 11139 00001820 385E04                  	CMP	[BP+TFrame.Index],BL	; table error?
 11140 00001823 7317                    	JAE	short TableError	; yes
 11141                                  	;mov	bl,[bp+4]
 11142 00001825 8A5E04                  	MOV	BL,[BP+TFrame.Index]	; get desired table index
 11143 00001828 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH			; convert to word
 11144 0000182A D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1			; convert to word pointer
 11145 0000182C 43                      	INC	BX			; point past first length byte
 11146                                  	; 17/08/2018
 11147                                  	;add	bx,[bp+6]
 11148 0000182D 035E06                  	ADD	BX,[BP+TFrame.Tab]	; get real offset
 11149 00001830 2E8B1F                  	MOV	BX,[CS:BX]		; get contents of table entry
 11150                                  	;mov	[bp+6],bx
 11151 00001833 895E06                  	MOV	[BP+TFrame.Tab],BX	; put table entry into return address
 11152 00001836 5B                      	POP	BX			; restore BX
 11153 00001837 5D                      	POP	BP			; restore BP
 11154 00001838 83C404                  	ADD	SP,4			; clean off Index and our return addr
 11155 0000183B C3                      	retn				; do operation
 11156                                  TableError:

 11158 0000183D 5D                      	POP	BP			; restore BP
 11159 0000183E C20600                  	RETN	6			; clean off Index, Table and RetAddr

 11322                                  ;
 11323                                  ;   Inputs:	Same input as $OPEN except CL = mode
 11324                                  ;   Outputs:	same output as $OPEN
 11325                                  ;
 11326                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11327                                  
 11328                                  ;hkn; NOTE! SS MUST HAVE BEEN SET UP TO DOSDATA BY THE TIME THESE
 11329                                  ;hkn; NLS FUNCTIONS ARE CALLED!!! THERE FORE WE WILL USE SS OVERRIDES
 11330                                  ;hkn; IN ORDER TO ACCESS DOS DATA VARIABLES!
 11331                                  
 11332                                  NLS_OPEN:
 11333                                  ;	MOV	BL,[CPSWFLAG]	 ; disable code page matching logic
 11334                                  ;	MOV	BYTE [CPSWFLAG],0
 11335                                  ;	PUSH	BX		 ; save current state
 11336                                  
 11337 0000189E 88C8                    	MOV	AL,CL		 ; set up correct interface for $OPEN
 11338 000018A0 E8605C                  	call	_$OPEN
 11339                                  
 11340                                  ;	POP	BX		 ; restore current state
 11341                                  ;	MOV	[CPSWFLAG],BL
 11342                                  
 11343 000018A3 C3                      	RETN
 11344                                  
 11345                                  ;Break	<NLS_LSEEK - do $LSEEK for NLSFUNC>
 11346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11347                                  ;   DOS 3.3   6/10/86
 11348                                  ;   NLS_LSEEK	- call $LSEEK for NLSFUNC
 11349                                  ;
 11350                                  ;   Inputs:	BP = open mode
 11351                                  ;   Outputs:	same output as $LSEEK
 11352                                  ;
 11353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11354                                  
 11355                                  ; 16/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11356                                  
 11357                                  NLS_LSEEK:
 11358 000018A4 36FF36[8405]            	PUSH	word [SS:USER_SP] ; save user stack
 11359 000018A9 36FF36[8605]            	PUSH	word [SS:USER_SS]
 11360 000018AE E81000                  	CALL	Fake_User_Stack
 11361 000018B1 89E8                    	MOV	AX,BP		; set up correct interface for $LSEEK
 11362 000018B3 E8FA55                  	call	_$LSEEK
 11363 000018B6 368F06[8605]            	POP	word [SS:USER_SS] ; restore user stack
 11364 000018BB 368F06[8405]            	POP	word [SS:USER_SP]
 11365 000018C0 C3                      	RETN
 11366                                  
 11367                                  ;Break	<Fake_User_Stack - save user stack>

 11378 000018CB 36A3[8605]              	MOV	[SS:USER_SS],AX
 11379 000018CF C3                      	RETN

 11438                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11439                                  
 11440                                  ;Break	<MSG_RETRIEVAL- get beginning addr of system and parser messages>
 11441                                  
 11442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11443                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11444                                  ;
 11445                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11446                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11447                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11448                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11449                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11450                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11451                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11452                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11453                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11454                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11455                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11456                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11457                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11458                                  
 11459                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11460                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11461                                  
 11462                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11463                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11464                                  
 11465                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11466                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11467                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11468                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11469                                  ;;
 11470                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11471                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11472                                  ;;
 11473                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11474                                  ;;	push	ds
 11475                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11476                                  ;;
 11477                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11478                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11479                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11480                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11481                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11482                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11483                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11484                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 11485                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 11486                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11487                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 11488                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11489                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11490                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11491                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11492                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11493                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;
 11494                                  ;;	LES	DI,DWORD PTR DS:[SI]	     ;AN000;;MS. get msg addr
 11495                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;
 11496                                  ;;	POP	SI			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11497                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11498                                  ;;
 11499                                  ;;	pop	ds
 11500                                  
 11501                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11502                                  
 11503                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11504                                  ;	retn	; 29/04/2019

 11562                                  ;============================================================================
 11563                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11564                                  ;============================================================================
 11565                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11566                                  
 11567                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11568                                  
 11569                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11570                                  
 11571                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11572                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11573                                  
 11574                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11575                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11576                                  ;
 11577                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11578                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11580                                  
 11581                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11582                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11583                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11584                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11585                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11586                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11587                                  
 11588                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11589                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11590                                  ;	iret
 11591                                  ;	push	cs
 11592                                  ;	call	$-2
 11593                                  ;%endmacro
 11594                                  
 11595                                  ; ---------------------------
 11596                                  
 11597                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11598                                  %if 0
 11599                                  
 11600                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11601                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11602                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11603                                  ECritMEM:
 11604                                  ECritSFT:
 11605                                  ;
 11606                                  ECritDisk:
 11607                                  
 11608                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11609                                  
 11610                                  	pushf
 11611                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11612                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11613                                  
 11614                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11615                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11616                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11617                                  ;
 11618                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11619                                  ;	iret ; *
 11620                                  
 11621                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11622                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11623                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11624                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11625                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11626                                  ;	iret	
 11627                                  
 11628                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11629                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11630                                  	push	cs ; *
 11631                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11632                                  	
 11633                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11634                                  	PUSH    AX
 11635                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11636                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11637                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11638                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11639                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11640                                  	POP     AX
 11641                                  	retn
 11642                                  
 11643                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11644                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11645                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11646                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11647                                  	iret
 11648                                  
 11649                                  ECritDisk_2:
 11650                                  	;;popff ; *
 11651                                  	;;retn
 11652                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_3 ; *
 11653                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2: ; *
 11654                                  ;	iret
 11655                                  	
 11656                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11657                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11658                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_3
 11659                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2:
 11660                                  	;iret
 11661

 11901 00001915 368A0E[A110]            	mov	cl,[ss:IsWin386]
 11902 0000191A E305                    	jcxz	ECritDisk2
 11903 0000191C 59                      	pop	cx
 11904 0000191D CD2A                    	int	2Ah		; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11905                                  				; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11906 0000191F 58                      	pop	ax
 11907 00001920 C3                      	retn
 11908                                  
 11909                                  ECritDisk2:
 11910 00001921 06                      	push	es
 11911                                  	;mov	cx,0
 11912                                  	; 15/01/2024
 11913                                  	; cx = 0
 11914 00001922 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 11915 00001924 9C                      	pushf			; simulate INT 2Ah
 11916 00001925 26FF1EA800              	call	far [es:00A8h]	; call far (INT 2Ah vector)
 11917 0000192A 07                      	pop	es
 11918 0000192B 59                      	pop	cx
 11919 0000192C 58                      	pop	ax
 11920 0000192D C3                      	retn
