 12056                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 12057                                  ;
 12058                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 12059                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 12060                                  
 12061                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12062                                  ;
 12063                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12064                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 12065                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 12066                                  ;	$RawConIO
 12067                                  ;	$RawConInput
 12068                                  ;	RAWOUT
 12069                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 12070                                  ;
 12071                                  
 12072                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12073                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12074                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12075                                  
 12076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12077                                  
 12078                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 12079                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 12080                                  
 12081                                  ;
 12082                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 12083                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 12084                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 12085                                  ;
 12086                                  
 12087                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12088                                  ;
 12089                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 12090                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 12091                                  ;	OUTT
 12092                                  ;	TAB
 12093                                  ;	BUFOUT
 12094                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 12095                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 12096                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 12097                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 12098                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 12099                                  ;
 12100                                  ;	Revision History:
 12101                                  ;
 12102                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 12103                                  
 12104                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12105                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12106                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12107                                  
 12108                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 12109                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 12110                                  
 12111                                  
 12112                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 12113                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 12114                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 12115                                  
 12116                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12117                                  ; 08/11/2022
 12118                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12119                                  
 12120                                  ;
 12121                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12122                                  ;
 12123                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12124                                  ;
 12125                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12126                                  ;
 12127                                  
 12128                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 12129                                  
 12130                                  ; Inputs:
 12131                                  ;	None
 12132                                  ; Function:
 12133                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 12134                                  ; Returns:
 12135                                  ;	AL = character
 12136                                  
 12137 00001963 1E                      	push	ds
 12138 00001964 56                      	push	si
 12139                                  INTEST:
 12140 00001965 E8F53D                  	call	STATCHK
 12141 00001968 753B                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12142                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12143                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12144 0000196A 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12145 00001970 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12146 00001972 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12147 00001974 E81D31                  	call	IOFUNC
 12148                                  no_sys_wait:
 12149                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12150 00001977 B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12151 00001979 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12152                                  
 12153                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12154                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12155                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12156                                  
 12157                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12158 0000197B 36803E[E20D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12159 00001981 751B                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12160                                  
 12161 00001983 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12162 00001984 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12163 00001985 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12164 00001986 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12165                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12166 00001987 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12167                                  
 12168                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12169                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12170                                  
 12171 00001988 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12172 00001989 1F                      	POP	DS
 12173                                  
 12174 0000198A B80000                  	MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12175 0000198D E89402                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12176                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12177 00001990 E803F2                  	call	READTIME
 12178 00001993 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12179 00001996 E88B02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12180                                  
 12181                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12182                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12183                                  ;	push	bx
 12184                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12185                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12186                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12187                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12188                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12189                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12190                                  ;	pop	bx
 12191                                  
 12192 00001999 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12193 0000199A 5A                      	POP	DX
 12194 0000199B 59                      	POP	CX
 12195 0000199C 5B                      	POP	BX
 12196 0000199D 58                      	POP	AX
 12197                                  NoUpdate:
 12198                                  
 12199                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12200 0000199E 36FF06[E20D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12201                                  
 12202                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12203 000019A3 EBC0                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12204                                  GET:
 12205 000019A5 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12206 000019A7 E8EA30                  	call	IOFUNC
 12207 000019AA 5E                      	POP	SI
 12208 000019AB 1F                      	POP	DS
 12209                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12210                                  
 12211                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12212                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12213 000019AC 36C606[E10D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12214                                  	;
 12215 000019B2 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12216 000019B4 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12217                                  
 12218                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12219                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12220                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12221 000019B6 36FE06[E10D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12222                                  noscan:
 12223 000019BB C3                      	retn
 12224                                  ;
 12225                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12226                                  ;
 12227                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12228                                  ;
 12229                                  ;
 12230                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12231                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12232                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12233                                  ;
 12234                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12235                                  ;
 12236                                  
 12237                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12238                                  
 12239 000019BC 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12240                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12241 000019BE AC                      	lodsb
 12242 000019BF 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12243 000019C1 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12244                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12245 000019C3 E88702                  	call	OUTT
 12246 000019C6 EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12247                                  
 12248                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12249                                  ;
 12250                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12251                                  ;
 12252                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12253                                  ;
 12254                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12255                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12256                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12257                                  ;
 12258                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12259                                  
 12260                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12261                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12262                                  
 12263                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12264                                  
 12265                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12266                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12267                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12268 000019C8 16                      	push	ss
 12269 000019C9 07                      	pop	es
 12270                                  
 12271 000019CA 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12272 000019CC 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12273 000019CE AD                      	lodsw
 12274                                  
 12275                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12276                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12277                                  
 12278 000019CF 08C0                            or	al,al
 12279 000019D1 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12280 000019D3 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12281 000019D5 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12282                                  
 12283                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12284                                  
 12285 000019D7 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12286 000019D9 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12287 000019DB 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12288 000019DE 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12289                                  
 12290                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12291                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12292                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12293                                  ;
 12294                                  
 12295                                  NOEDIT:	
 12296 000019E0 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12297                                  EDITON: 
 12298 000019E2 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12299 000019E4 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12300                                  
 12301                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12302                                  
 12303                                  NEWLIN: 
 12304 000019E5 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12305 000019E9 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12306                                  
 12307 000019ED 56                      	push	si
 12308 000019EE BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12309 000019F1 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12310 000019F6 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12311 000019F8 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12312 000019FA E866FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12313 000019FD 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12314 000019FF 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12315                                  
 12316                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12317                                  ;
 12318                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12319                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12320                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12321                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12322                                  
 12323                                  GETCH:
 12324 00001A01 E85FFF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12325                                  GOTCH:
 12326                                  ;
 12327                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12328                                  ; input queue.
 12329                                  ;
 12330 00001A04 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12331 00001A06 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12332                                  
 12333                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12334                                  
 12335                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12336                                  
 12337                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12338                                  
 12339                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12340                                  
 12341 00001A08 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12342 00001A0D 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12343                                  
 12344                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12345                                  
 12346 00001A0F 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12347                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12348                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12349 00001A11 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12350 00001A13 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12351                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12352                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12353 00001A15 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12354                                  
 12355                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12356                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12357                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12358                                  	;		
 12359                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12360                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12361                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12362                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12363                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12364                                  	;	
 12365                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12366                                  
 12367                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12368                                  	;
 12369                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12370                                  
 12371                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12372                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12373                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12374                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12375                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12376                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12377                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12378                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12379                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12380                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12381                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12382                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12383                                  	
 12384                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12385                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12386                                  
 12387                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12388                                  %if 0
 12389                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12390                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12391                                  ;	cursor
 12392                                  
 12393                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12394                                  
 12395                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12396                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12397                                  
 12398                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12399                                  	NOP
 12400                                  	NOP
 12401                                  
 12402                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12403                                  
 12404                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12405                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 12406                                  
 12407                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 12408                                  	NOP
 12409                                  	NOP
 12410                                  
 12411                                  %endif
 12412                                  
 12413                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12414                                  
 12415 00001A17 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12416 00001A19 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12417                                  
 12418                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12419                                  
 12420 00001A1B 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 12421 00001A1D 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12422                                  
 12423                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12424                                  
 12425                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 12426                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12427                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12428                                  
 12429                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 12430                                  
 12431                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12432                                  
 12433 00001A1F 2E3A06[950A]            	cmp	al,[cs:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12434 00001A24 7440                    	jz	short KILNEW
 12435                                  	
 12436                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 12437                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12438                                  
 12439                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 12440                                  
 12441                                  SAVCH:	
 12442 00001A26 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12443 00001A28 7317                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.

 12582                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12583                                  
 12584                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 12585                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct

 12588                                  KILNEW:

 12606                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line

 12611                                  BackSpace:

 12613 00001A86 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 12614 00001A88 E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup

 12616 00001A8E 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '

 12618 00001A92 3C09                            cmp	al,c_HT ; 9
 12619 00001A94 741B                    	jz	short BAKTAB	;Was a tab, fix up users display
 12620                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12621 00001A96 3C15                    	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h ; ctrl-U is a section symbol not ^U
 12622 00001A98 7407                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12623 00001A9A 3C14                           	CMP     AL,"T"-"@" ; 14h ; ctrl-T is a paragraphs symbol not ^T

 12644 00001ABB E30E                            jcxz	FIGTAB		;At start, do nothing

 12732                                  ;Get the next user char, and look ahead in template for a match

 12752 00001B38 7505                    	JNZ	SHORT FINDSETUP		; no, set up for scan

 12756                                  FINDSETUP:

 12758 00001B41 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;CX is number of chars to end of template
 12759 00001B43 7417                    	jz	short NOTFND	;At end of template
 12760 00001B45 49                              dec	cx		;Cannot point past end, limit search
 12761 00001B46 7414                            jz	short NOTFND	;If only one char in template, forget it

 12763 00001B49 1E                      	push	ds
 12764 00001B4A 07                      	pop	es
 12765 00001B4B 57                      	push	di
 12766 00001B4C 89F7                    	mov	di,si		;Template to ES:DI
 12767 00001B4E 47                      	inc	di
 12768 00001B4F F2AE                    	repne	scasb		;Look
 12769 00001B51 5F                      	pop	di
 12770 00001B52 07                      	pop	es
 12771 00001B53 7507                    	jnz	short NOTFND	;Didn't find the char
 12772 00001B55 F6D1                            not	cl		;Turn how far to go into how far we went

 12774 00001B59 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;Subtract current pos, result distance to skip
 12775                                  FINDOLD_RETN:

 12821                                  ;**	$RAW_CON_IO - Do Raw Console I/O
 12822                                  ;
 12823                                  ;	Input or output raw character from console, no echo
 12824                                  ;
 12825                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = -1 if input
 12826                                  ;		   =  output character if output
 12827                                  ;	EXIT	(AL) = input character if input
 12828                                  ;	USES	all
 12829                                  ;
 12830                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12831                                  ; 20/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 12832                                  
 12833                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12834                                  ; DOSCODE:541Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12835                                  
 12836                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12837                                  ; DOSCODE:5408h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12838                                  
 12839                                  _$RAW_CON_IO:			; System call 6
 12840                                  
 12841 00001B89 88D0                            MOV	AL,DL
 12842 00001B8B 3CFF                            CMP	AL,-1
 12843 00001B8D 7541                    	JNZ	SHORT RAWOUT ; 16/12/2022
 12844                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12845                                  	;jz	short rci1
 12846                                  	;jmp	short RAWOUT
 12847                                  	; 16/12/202
 12848                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12849                                  	;nop
 12850                                  rci1:
 12851                                  			; Get pointer to register save area
 12852 00001B8F 36C43E[8405]            	LES	DI,[SS:USER_SP] ; 12/03/2018
 12853 00001B94 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 12854                                      	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 12855 00001B96 E8B620                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 12856                                          ;JC	SHORT RET17
 12857 00001B99 72C0                            jc	short FINDOLD_RETN
 12858 00001B9B B401                    	MOV	AH,1
 12859 00001B9D E8F42E                  	CALL	IOFUNC
 12860 00001BA0 750B                    	JNZ	SHORT RESFLG
 12861 00001BA2 E88A3B                  	CALL	SPOOLINT
 12862                                  	;OR	BYTE [ES:DI+16H],40H
 12863 00001BA5 26804D1640              	OR	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],40H ; Set user's zero flag
 12864 00001BAA 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 12865                                  RET17:
 12866 00001BAC C3                      	RETN
 12867                                  
 12868                                  RESFLG:

 12870 00001BAD 26806516BF              	AND	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],0FFH-40H
 12871                                  				; Reset user's zero flag
 12872                                  ;RILP:
 12873                                  rci0:
 12874 00001BB2 E87A3B                       	CALL	SPOOLINT

 12877                                  ;
 12878                                  ;**	$Raw_CON_INPUT - Raw Console Input
 12879                                  ;
 12880                                  ;	Input raw character from console, no echo
 12881                                  ;
 12882                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 12883                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = character
 12884                                  ;	USES	all
 12885                                  ;
 12886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12887                                  ;
 12888                                  
 12889                                  ;rci0:	invoke	SPOOLINT
 12890                                  
 12891                                  	;entry	$RAW_CON_INPUT
 12892                                  
 12893                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12894                                  
 12895                                  ; DOSCODE:544Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12896                                  
 12897                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12898                                  
 12899                                  ; DOSCODE:5ACBh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 12900                                  
 12901                                  _$RAW_CON_INPUT:		; System call 7
 12902 00001BB5 53                      	push	bx

 12904                                  	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 12905 00001BB8 E89420                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 12909 00001BC0 E8D12E                  	CALL	IOFUNC

 12911                                  	;XOR	AH,AH
 12912                                          ;CALL	IOFUNC
 12913                                          ;RETN
 12914 00001BC3 7506                    	jnz	short rci5	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 12917 00001BC9 EBE7                    	JMP	short rci0
 12918                                  rci5:	
 12919 00001BCB 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH

 12921                                  	;RETN
 12922                                  	; 18/12/2022
 12923 00001BCD E9C42E                  	jmp	IOFUNC

 12925                                  ;       Output the character in AL to stdout
 12926                                  ;
 12927                                  	;entry	RAWOUT
 12928                                  RAWOUT:

 12930 00001BD1 BB0100                  	MOV     BX,1
 12931

 12933 00001BD4 E87820                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 13015 00001C17 74ED                    	JZ	SHORT ROLP
 13016                                  
 13017                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13018                                  ;SR;
 13019                                  ; IOFUNC now returns ax = 0ffffh if there was an I24 on a status call and
 13020                                  ;the user failed. We do not send a char if this happens. We however return
 13021                                  ;to the caller with carry clear because this DOS call does not return any
 13022                                  ;status. 
 13023                                  ;

 13063                                  
 13064                                  ;
 13065                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13066                                  ;
 13067                                  ; Inputs:
 13068                                  ;	AX=0 save the DEVCALL request packet
 13069                                  ;	  =1 restore the DEVCALL request packet
 13070                                  ; Function:
 13071                                  ;	save or restore the DEVCALL packet
 13072                                  ; Returns:
 13073                                  ;	none
 13074                                  ;
 13075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13076                                  ;
 13077                                  
 13078                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13079                                  ; DOSCODE:54B9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 13080                                  
 13081                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13082                                  ; DOSCODE:54A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 13083                                  
 13084                                  ; 12/05/2019
 13085                                  
 13086                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13087                                  	; DOSCODE:5B42h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 13088                                  
 13089                                  Save_Restore_Packet:

 13091 00001C25 06                      	PUSH	ES
 13092 00001C26 56                      	PUSH	SI
 13093 00001C27 57                      	PUSH	DI
 13094                                  
 13095                                  	; 16/12/2022

 13097                                  	; 09/09/2018

 13099 00001C2B BE[5A03]                	mov	si,DEVCALL
 13100                                  	;
 13101                                  	; 21/09/2023
 13102 00001C2E 09C0                    	or	ax,ax 
 13103                                  	;CMP	AX,0		; save packet
 13104 00001C30 7402                    	JZ	short save_packet ; 16/12/2022
 13105                                  	;je	short set_seg
 13106                                  
 13107                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13108                                  restore_packet:
 13109                                  ;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:Packet_Temp	;source
 13110                                  ;	MOV	DI,OFFSET DOSDATA:DEVCALL	;destination
 13111                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13112                                  	;mov	si,FAKE_STACK_2F ; DOS_TEMP ; Packed_Temp

 13114                                  	;
 13115                                  	;JMP	short set_seg
 13116                                  
 13117                                  	; 16/12/2022	
 13118                                  	; 09/09/2018
 13119 00001C32 87F7                    	xchg	si,di  ; DI = offset DEVCALL, SI = offset FAKE_STACK_2F
 13120

 13123                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13124                                  	cmp	ax,0		; save packet
 13125                                  	jz	short save_packet

 13127                                  	mov	di,DEVCALL 
 13128                                  	jmp	short set_seg
 13129                                  
 13130                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13131                                  save_packet:
 13132                                  ;	MOV	DI,OFFSET DOSDATA:Packet_Temp	;destination
 13133                                  ;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:DEVCALL	;source
 13134                                  	; 09/09/2018
 13135                                  	; MSDOS 3.3

 13142                                  %endif
 13143                                  
 13144                                  ; 16/12/2022

 13146                                  ;set_seg:
 13147                                  	; MSDOS 3.3

 13152                                  	;MOV	DS,AX
 13153                                  	;MOV	ES,AX

 13580                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple

 13582                                  ;					  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to

 13589                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_Position - set random record fields to current pos>
 13590                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13591                                  ;
 13592                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 13593                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 13594                                  ;	to that record
 13595                                  ;
 13596                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 13597                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 13598                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13599                                  ;
 13600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13601                                  ;
 13602                                  
 13603                                  _$GET_FCB_POSITION:
 13604 00001D68 E8ED04                  	call	GetExtended		; point to FCB
 13605 00001D6B E8BD04                  	call	GetExtent		; DX:AX is current record
 13606                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13607 00001D6E 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX 	; drop in low order piece
 13608                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13609 00001D71 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; drop in high order piece
 13610                                  	;cmp	word [si+0Eh],64
 13611 00001D74 837C0E40                	CMP	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],64
 13612 00001D78 7303                    	JAE	short GetFCBBye
 13613                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13614 00001D7A 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2+1],DH	; Set 4th byte only if record size < 64
 13615                                  GoodPath:	; 16/12/2022
 13616                                  GetFCBBye:
 13617 00001D7D E90CE9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13618                                  
 13619                                  ;Break <$FCB_Delete - remove several files that match the input FCB>
 13620                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13621                                  ;
 13622                                  ;**	$FCB_Delete - Delete from FCB Template
 13623                                  ;
 13624                                  ;	given an FCB, remove all directory entries in the current
 13625                                  ;	directory that have names that match the FCB's ?  marks.
 13626                                  ;
 13627                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = address of FCB
 13628                                  ;	EXIT	entries matching the FCB are deleted
 13629                                  ;		(al) = ff iff no entries were deleted
 13630                                  ;	USES	all
 13631                                  ;
 13632                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13633                                  ;
 13634                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13635

 13637                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13638 00001D80 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF 		; appropriate place 
 13639                                  
 13640 00001D83 E8AC53                  	call	TransFCB		; convert FCB to path
 13641 00001D86 7207                    	JC	short BadPath 		; signal no deletions
 13642                                  
 13643 00001D88 16                      	push	SS
 13644 00001D89 1F                      	pop	DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 13645                                  
 13646 00001D8A E8960D                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; wham

 13651                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_OK		; do a good return
 13652                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13653                                  ;	jmp	short GetFCBBye
 13654

 13656                                  	; Error code is in AX
 13657                                  
 13658 00001D8F E9FDE8                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; let someone else signal the error

 13664                                  ;	file in records (rounded up if partial).
 13665                                  ;
 13666                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX - point to a possible extended FCB

 13717 00001DBC 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI ; (**)		; get low order piece
 13718 00001DBE F7F3                    	DIV	BX			; wham

 13720 00001DC2 5A                      	POP	DX			; get high order dividend

 13729 00001DD1 08F6                    	OR	DH,DH

 13736 00001DD8 EBA3                    	jmp	short GoodPath

 13738                                  ;Break <$FCB_Close - close a file>
 13739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13740                                  ;
 13741                                  ;   $FCB_Close - given an FCB, look up the SFN and close it. Do not free it
 13742                                  ;	as the FCB may be used for further I/O
 13743                                  ;
 13744                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to FCB
 13745                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = FF if file was not found on disk
 13746                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13747                                  ;
 13748                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13749                                  ;
 13750                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13751                                  
 13752                                  _$FCB_CLOSE:		; System call 16
 13753

 13755 00001DDC E87904                  	call	GetExtended		; DS:SI point to real FCB
 13756 00001DDF 7403                    	JZ	short NoAttr		; not extended
 13757 00001DE1 8A44FF                  	MOV	AL,[SI-1]		; get attributes
 13758                                  NoAttr:

 13761 00001DE8 E8DB03                  	call	SFTFromFCB
 13762 00001DEB 72EB                    	JC	short GoodRet 		; MZ 16 Jan Assume death
 13763                                  
 13764                                  	; If the sharer is present, then the SFT is not regenable. Thus, 
 13765                                  	; there is no need to set the SFT's attribute.

 13768                                  	;;; done

 13773 00001DF3 50                      	PUSH	AX

 13781                                  	;mov	[es:di+4],al
 13782 00001DFD 26884504                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],AL ; attempted attribute for close
 13783                                  NoStash:
 13784

 13786                                  %if 0
 13787                                  	;mov	ax,[si+14h]

 13865                                  ;
 13866                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13867                                  ;
 13868                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 13869                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 13870                                  ;
 13871                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DX point to an FCB. The normal name field is the source
 13872                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 13873                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.
 13874                                  ;	EXIT	AL = 0 -> no error occurred and all files were renamed
 13875                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 13876                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found
 13877                                  ;	USES	ALL
 13878                                  ;
 13879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13880                                  ;
 13881                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13882                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13883                                  
 13884                                  _$FCB_RENAME:		; System call 23
 13885                                  
 13886 00001E46 E80F04                  	call	GetExtended		; get pointer to real FCB
 13887 00001E49 52                      	push	dx
 13888 00001E4A 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI] 		; get drive byte
 13889 00001E4C 83C610                  	ADD	SI,10h			; point to destination
 13890                                  
 13891                                  					; RenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13892 00001E4F BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF		; point to destination buffer
 13893 00001E52 FF34                    	push	word [SI]
 13894 00001E54 1E                      	push	ds
 13895                                  	;push	di			; save source pointer for TransFCB
 13896                                  	; 16/01/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix!)
 13897 00001E55 56                      	push	si
 13898 00001E56 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL			; drop in real drive
 13899 00001E58 89F2                    	MOV	DX,SI			; let TransFCB know where the FCB is
 13900 00001E5A E8D552                  	call	TransFCB		; munch this pathname
 13901 00001E5D 5E                      	pop	si
 13902 00001E5E 1F                      	pop	ds	
 13903 00001E5F 8F04                    	pop	WORD [SI]		; get path back
 13904 00001E61 5A                      	pop	dx			; Original FCB pointer
 13905 00001E62 72DF                    	JC	short fren90		; bad path -> error
 13906                                  
 13907                                  					; SS override for WFP_Start & Ren_WFP
 13908 00001E64 368B36[B205]            	MOV	SI,[ss:WFP_START]	; get pointer
 13909 00001E69 368936[B405]            	MOV	[ss:REN_WFP],SI		; stash it
 13910                                  
 13911                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13912 00001E6E BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate spot
 13913 00001E71 E8BE52                  	call	TransFCB		; wham
 13914                                  					; NOTE that this call is pointing
 13915                                  					;  back to the ORIGINAL FCB so
 13916                                  					;  SATTRIB gets set correctly
 13917 00001E74 72CD                    	JC	short fren90		; error
 13918                                  	;;;
 13919                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 13920                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13921 00001E76 36C606[7B12]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN], 67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67

 13934                                  ;fren90:	
 13935                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 13936                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13937                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 13938                                  
 13939                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 13940                                  ;
 13941                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 13942                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 13943                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 13944                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 13945                                  ;   usage.
 13946                                  ;
 13947                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 13948                                  ;
 13949                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 13950                                  ;
 13951                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13952                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 13953                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13954                                  ;	    }				    }
 13955                                  ;
 13956                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 13957                                  ;
 13958                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13959                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 13960                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13961                                  ;	    }				    }
 13962                                  ;
 13963                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 13964                                  ;
 13965                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13966                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 13967                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13968                                  ;
 13969                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 13970                                  ;
 13971                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13972                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 13973                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 13974                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13975                                  ;	    }
 13976                                  ;
 13977                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 13978                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 13979                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 13980                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 13981                                  ;   the local machine.
 13982                                  ;
 13983                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 13984                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 13985                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 13986                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 13987                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 13988                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 13989                                  ;
 13990                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 13991                                  ;
 13992                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 13993                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 13994                                  ;   regenerated.
 13995                                  ;
 13996                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 13997                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 13998                                  ;   information:
 13999                                  ;
 14000                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 14001                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 14002                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 14003                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 14004                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 14005                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 14006                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 14007                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 14008                                  ;
 14009                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 14010                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 14011                                  ;
 14012                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 14013                                  ;
 14014                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 14015                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 14016                                  ;
 14017                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 14018                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 14019                                  ;
 14020                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 14021                                  ;	always be present.
 14022                                  ;
 14023                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 14024                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 14025                                  ;
 14026                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 14027                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 14028                                  ;	proper OI record.
 14029                                  ;
 14030                                  ;   The test bits are:
 14031                                  ;
 14032                                  ;	00 -> local file
 14033                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 14034                                  ;	80 -> network
 14035                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 14036                                  
 14037                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 14038                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14039                                  ;
 14040                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 14041                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 14042                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 14043                                  ;
 14044                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 14045                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 14046                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 14047                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 14048                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 14049                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 14050                                  ;
 14051                                  ;
 14052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14053                                  ;
 14054

 14250                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14252                                  ;
 14253                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14254                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14255                                  ;   at 0.
 14256                                  ;
 14257                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14258                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14259                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14260                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14261                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14262                                  ;
 14263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 14265
