 16267                                  
 16268                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16269                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16270                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16271                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16272                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16273                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16274                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16275                                  ;
 16276                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16277                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16278                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16279                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16280                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16281                                  ;
 16282                                  ;	Modification history:
 16283                                  ;
 16284                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16285                                  
 16286                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16287                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16288                                  ;
 16289                                  ; Inputs:
 16290                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16291                                  ; Function:
 16292                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16293                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16294                                  ; Returns:
 16295                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16296                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16297                                  
 16298                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16299                                  
 16300                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16301 00002524 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16302 00002529 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16303 0000252E 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16304 00002530 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16305 00002533 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16306 00002535 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16307                                  NORMFCB4:
 16308 00002538 FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16309                                  
 16310 0000253A 16                      	push	ss
 16311 0000253B 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16312                                  
 16313 0000253C BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16314 0000253F E8F04B                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16315 00002542 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16316 00002544 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16317                                  
 16318                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16319                                  
 16320                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16321                                  dcf_errj:
 16322 00002545 E947E1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16323                                  
 16324                                  SearchIt:
 16325 00002548 16                      	push	ss
 16326 00002549 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16327 0000254A FF36[2C03]              	push	word [DMAADD]
 16328 0000254E FF36[2E03]              	push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16329 00002552 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16330 00002558 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16331                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16332                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16333                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16334 0000255C E88501                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16335 0000255F 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16336 00002563 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16337 00002567 7303                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16338 00002569 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16339                                  
 16340                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16341                                  
 16342                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16343                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16344 0000256A EBD9                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16345                                  
 16346                                  ; The search was successful (or the search-next). We store the information
 16347                                  ; into the user's FCB for continuation.
 16348                                  
 16349                                  SearchSet:
 16350 0000256C BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16351 0000256F C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]		; point to the FCB
 16352 00002573 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh		;
 16353 00002578 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB1
 16354 0000257A 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16355                                  NORMFCB1:
 16356 0000257D 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16357 0000257E 08DB                    	OR	BL,BL
 16358 00002580 7506                    	JNZ	short SearchDrv
 16359 00002582 8A1E[3603]              	MOV	BL,[CURDRV]
 16360 00002586 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 16361                                  SearchDrv:
 16362 00002588 AC                      	LODSB				; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16363 00002589 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; Search byte to BL, user byte to AL
 16364 0000258B 47                      	INC	DI
 16365                                  	;STOSB				; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16366                                  					;  at the start of the search info
 16367 0000258C B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16368 0000258F F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Rest of search cont info, SI -> entry
 16369 00002591 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; User drive byte back to BL, search
 16370                                  					;   byte to AL
 16371 00002593 AA                      	STOSB				; Search contin drive byte at end of
 16372                                  					;   contin info
 16373 00002594 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16374 00002598 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16375 0000259D 740D                    	JZ	short NORMFCB2
 16376 0000259F B0FF                    	MOV	AL,0FFh
 16377 000025A1 AA                      	STOSB
 16378 000025A2 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 16379                                  	;MOV	CX,5
 16380                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16381 000025A4 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 16382 000025A6 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 16383 000025A8 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 16384 000025AB AA                      	STOSB
 16385                                  NORMFCB2:
 16386 000025AC 88D8                    	MOV	AL,BL			; User Drive byte
 16387 000025AE AA                      	STOSB
 16388                                  	;MOV	CX,16			; 32 / 2 words of dir entry
 16389                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16390 000025AF B110                    	mov	cl,16
 16391 000025B1 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 16392 000025B3 E9D6E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 16393                                  
 16394                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16395                                  ;
 16396                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16397                                  ;
 16398                                  ; Inputs:
 16399                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16400                                  ; Function:
 16401                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16402                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16403                                  ; Returns:
 16404                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16406                                  
 16407                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16408 000025B6 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16409 000025BB 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16410 000025C0 36C606[6D05]00          	MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16411 000025C6 36C606[6C05]00          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16412                                  
 16413 000025CC 16                      	push	ss
 16414 000025CD 07                      	pop	es
 16415                                  
 16416 000025CE BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16417                                  
 16418 000025D1 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16419 000025D3 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16420 000025D6 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16421 000025D8 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16422 000025DB AC                      	LODSB
 16423                                  
 16424 000025DC 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16425 000025E0 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16426                                  NORMFCB6:
 16427 000025E5 AC                      	LODSB				; Get original user drive byte
 16428 000025E6 50                      	push	ax			; Put it on stack
 16429 000025E7 8A4414                  	MOV	AL,[SI+20]		; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16430 000025EA AA                      	STOSB				; Put in correct place
 16431 000025EB B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16432 000025EE F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Transfer in rest of search contin info
 16433                                  
 16434 000025F0 16                      	push	ss
 16435 000025F1 1F                      	pop	ds
 16436                                  
 16437 000025F2 FF36[2C03]              	push	word [DMAADD]
 16438 000025F6 FF36[2E03]              	push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16439 000025FA C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16440 00002600 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16441 00002604 E8200E                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16442 00002607 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16443 0000260B 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16444 0000260F 7203                    	JC	short SearchNoMore
 16445 00002611 E958FF                  	JMP	SearchSet		; Ok set return
 16446                                  
 16447                                  SearchNoMore:
 16448 00002614 C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]
 16449 00002618 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16450 0000261D 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB8
 16451 0000261F 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16452                                  NORMFCB8:
 16453 00002622 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16454 00002623 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16455                                  					;  at the right spot
 16456                                  ; error code is in AX
 16457                                  
 16458 00002626 E966E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR

 16460                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16461                                  
 16462                                  ; DOSCODE:5EE6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16463                                  
 16464                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16465                                  ;
 16466                                  ;   Procedure Name : $FIND_FIRST
 16467                                  ; 
 16468                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16469                                  ;	    MOV AH, FindFirst
 16470                                  ;	    LDS DX, name
 16471                                  ;	    MOV CX, attr
 16472                                  ;	    INT 21h
 16473                                  ;	; DMA address has datablock
 16474                                  ;
 16475                                  ;   Error Returns:
 16476                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 16477                                  ;	       = error_no_more_files
 16478                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16479                                  
 16480                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16481                                  	; DOSCODE:5ED2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16482                                  
 16483                                  _$FIND_FIRST:
 16484 00002629 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 16485 0000262B 36880E[6D05]            	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],CL		; Search attribute to correct loc
 16486                                  
 16487 00002630 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16488                                  
 16489 00002633 E8624B                  	call	TransPathSet		; convert the path
 16490 00002636 7305                    	JNC	short Find_it 		; no error, go and look
 16491                                  FindError:
 16492                                  	;mov	al,3
 16493 00002638 B003                    	mov	al, error_path_not_found ; error and map into one.
 16494                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16495                                  FF_errj:
 16496 0000263A E93DE0                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16497                                  Find_it:
 16498 0000263D 16                      	push	ss
 16499 0000263E 1F                      	pop	ds
 16500                                  
 16501 0000263F FF36[2C03]              	push	word [DMAADD]
 16502 00002643 FF36[2E03]              	push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16503 00002647 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16504 0000264D 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16505                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16506                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16507                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16508 00002651 E89000                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH 	; search
 16509 00002654 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16510 00002658 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16511                                  	
 16512                                  	; 16/12/2022
 16513                                  	;JNC	short FindSet 		; no error, transfer info
 16514 0000265C 72DC                    	jc	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16515                                  	;
 16516                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16517                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16518                                  ;FFF_errj:
 16519                                  	;jmp	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16520                                  
 16521                                  FindSet:
 16522 0000265E BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16523 00002661 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16524 00002665 B91500                  	MOV	CX,21
 16525 00002668 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB
 16526 0000266A 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Save pointer to start of entry
 16527                                  	;mov	al,[si+0Bh]
 16528 0000266B 8A440B                  	MOV	AL,[SI+dir_entry.dir_attr]
 16529 0000266E AA                      	STOSB
 16530                                  	;add	si,16h ; 22
 16531 0000266F 83C616                  	ADD	SI,dir_entry.dir_time
 16532 00002672 A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_time
 16533 00002673 A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_date
 16534 00002674 46                      	INC	SI
 16535 00002675 46                      	INC	SI			; Skip dir_first
 16536 00002676 A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_size (2 words)
 16537 00002677 A5                      	MOVSW
 16538 00002678 5E                      	POP	SI			; Point back to dir_name
 16539 00002679 E83500                   	CALL	PackName
 16540 0000267C E9F1DF                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; bye with no errors
 16541                                  
 16542                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16543                                  ;
 16544                                  ;   Procedure Name : $FIND_NEXT
 16545                                  ;
 16546                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16547                                  ;	; dma points at area returned by find_first
 16548                                  ;	    MOV AH, findnext
 16549                                  ;	    INT 21h
 16550                                  ;	; next entry is at dma
 16551                                  ;
 16552                                  ;   Error Returns:
 16553                                  ;	    AX = error_no_more_files
 16554                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 16557                                  _$FIND_NEXT:
 16558 0000267F 16                      	push	ss
 16559 00002680 07                      	pop	es
 16560

 16562

 16564                                  
 16565 00002689 B91500                  	MOV	CX,21
 16566 0000268C F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; Put the search continuation info
 16567                                  					;  in the right place
 16568 0000268E 16                      	push	ss
 16569 0000268F 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16570                                  	
 16571 00002690 FF36[2C03]              	push	word [DMAADD]
 16572 00002694 FF36[2E03]              	push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16573 00002698 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16574 0000269E 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16575 000026A2 E8820D                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16576 000026A5 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16577 000026A9 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16578 000026AD 73AF                    	JNC	short FindSet 		; No error, set info
 16579                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16580                                  	; 16/12/2022
 16581 000026AF EB89                    	jmp	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16582                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16583                                  	;jmp	short FFF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16584                                  
 16585                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16586                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16587                                  ;
 16588                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16589                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16590                                  ;
 16591                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:SI) = 11 character FCB or dir entry name
 16592                                  ;		(ES:DI) = destination area (13 bytes)
 16593                                  ;	EXIT	(ds:SI) and (es:DI) advanced
 16594                                  ;	USES	al, CX, SI, DI, Flags  (BUGBUG - not verified - jgl)
 16595                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16596                                  
 16597                                  PackName:
 16598                                  ;	Move over 8 characters to cover the name component, then trim it's
 16599                                  ;	trailing blanks.
 16600                                  
 16601 000026B1 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8			; Pack the name
 16602 000026B4 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; Move all of it
 16603                                  main_kill_tail:
 16604 000026B6 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16605 000026BB 7507                    	JNZ	short find_check_dot
 16606 000026BD 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16607 000026BE 41                      	INC	CX
 16608 000026BF 83F908                  	CMP	CX,8
 16609 000026C2 72F2                    	JB	short main_kill_tail
 16610                                  find_check_dot:
 16611                                  	;CMP	WORD [SI],(" " << 8) | " "
 16612 000026C4 813C2020                	cmp     word [si],2020h 
 16613 000026C8 7506                    	JNZ	short got_ext 		; Some chars in extension
 16614 000026CA 807C0220                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2]," "
 16615 000026CE 7410                    	JZ	short find_done		; No extension
 16616                                  got_ext:
 16617 000026D0 B02E                    	MOV	AL,"."	; 2Eh
 16618 000026D2 AA                      	STOSB
 16619                                  	;MOV	CX,3
 16620                                  	; 18/12/2022
 16621                                  	;mov	cl,3
 16622                                  	;REP	MOVSB
 16623 000026D3 A4                      	movsb
 16624 000026D4 A4                      	movsb
 16625 000026D5 A4                      	movsb
 16626                                  ext_kill_tail:
 16627 000026D6 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16628 000026DB 7503                    	JNZ	short find_done
 16629 000026DD 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16630 000026DE EBF6                    	JMP	short ext_kill_tail
 16631                                  find_done:
 16632 000026E0 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 16633 000026E2 AA                      	STOSB				; NUL terminate
 16634 000026E3 C3                      	retn
 16635                                  
 16636                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 16642                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16643 000026E4 36800E[1206]04          	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 16644                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 16645                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 16646                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16647                                  	;retn
 16648                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16649 000026EA E94E0C                  	jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST

 16654                                  ; 06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16655                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16656                                  
 16657                                  ; DOSCODE:5FB0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16658                                  
 16659                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 16660                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 16661                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 16662                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16663                                  ;
 16664                                  ;	$CURRENT_DIR  Written
 16665                                  ;	$RMDIR	  Written
 16666                                  ;	$CHDIR	  Written
 16667                                  ;	$MKDIR	  Written
 16668                                  ;
 16669                                  ;
 16670                                  ;	Modification history:
 16671                                  ;
 16672                                  ;	    Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16673                                  ;		 MZ 10 May 1983     CurrentDir implemented
 16674                                  ;		 MZ 11 May 1983     RmDir, ChDir, MkDir implemented
 16675                                  ;		 EE 19 Oct 1983     RmDir no longer allows you to delete a
 16676                                  ;				    current directory.
 16677                                  ;		 MZ 19 Jan 1983     Brain damaged applications rely on success
 16678                                  
 16679                                  ;	I_Need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to Current CDS
 16680                                  ;	I_Need	WFP_Start,WORD		; pointer to beginning of directory text
 16681                                  ;	I_Need	Curr_Dir_End,WORD	; offset to end of directory part
 16682                                  ;	I_Need	OpenBuf,128		; temp spot for translated name
 16683                                  ;	I_need	fSplice,BYTE		; TRUE => do splice
 16684                                  ;	I_Need	NoSetDir,BYTE		; TRUE => no exact match on splice
 16685                                  ;	I_Need	cMeta,BYTE
 16686                                  ;	I_Need	DrvErr,BYTE					;AN000;
 16687                                  
 16688                                  ;BREAK <$CURRENT_DIR - dump the current directory into user space>
 16689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16690                                  ;
 16691                                  ;   Procedure Name : $CURRENT_DIR
 16692                                  ;
 16693                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16694                                  ;		LDS	SI,area
 16695                                  ;		MOV	DL,drive
 16696                                  ;		INT	21h
 16697                                  ;	    ; DS:SI is a pointer to 64 byte area that contains drive
 16698                                  ;	    ; current directory.
 16699                                  ;   Error returns:
 16700                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_drive
 16701                                  ;
 16702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16703                                  
 16704                                  _$CURRENT_DIR:
 16705                                  	;06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16706                                  	;IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 2D4Eh
 16707 000026ED E813F2                  	call	ECritDisk

 16823                                  ;
 16824                                  ; Inputs:

 16892                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16893                                  
 16894                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 16895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16896                                  ;
 16897                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 16898                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 16899                                  ; several cases to consider:
 16900                                  ;
 16901                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 16902                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 16903                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 16904                                  ;	directory cluster.
 16905                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 16906                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 16907                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 16908                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 16909                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 16910                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 16911                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 16912                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 16913                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 16914                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 16915                                  ;
 16916                                  ; Inputs:
 16917                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 16918                                  ; Returns:
 16919                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 16920                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 16921                                  ;
 16922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16923                                  
 16924                                  _$CHDIR:
 16925 00002797 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 16926 0000279A 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 16927 0000279C E8F549                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 16928 0000279F 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 16929                                  ChDirErrP:
 16930                                  	;mov	al,3
 16931 000027A1 B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 16932                                  ChDirErr:
 16933                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!
 16934                                  	; 10/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16935 000027A3 EBC9                    	jmp	short chdir_errj
 16936                                  
 16937                                  ChDirCrack:
 16938 000027A5 803E[7A05]FF            	CMP	byte [CMETA],-1		; No meta chars allowed.
 16939 000027AA 75F5                    	JNZ	short ChDirErrP
 16940                                  
 16941                                  ; We cannot do a ChDir (yet) on a raw CDS. This is treated as a path not
 16942                                  ; found.
 16943                                  
 16944 000027AC C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 16945 000027B0 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1			;   if (ThisCDS == NULL)
 16946 000027B3 74EC                    	JZ	short ChDirErrP		;	error ();
 16947                                  
 16948                                  ; Find out if the directory exists.
 16949                                  
 16950 000027B5 E80110                  	call	DOS_CHDIR
 16951                                  	;Jc	short ChDirErr
 16952                                  	; 16/12/2022
 16953 000027B8 72B4                    	jc	short chdir_errj
 16954                                  ;
 16955                                  ; Get back CDS to see if a join as seen. Set the currency pointer (only if
 16956                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 16957                                  ;
 16958 000027BA C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 16959                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],2000h
 16960                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16961 000027BE 26F6454420              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_splice>>8
 16962                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 16963 000027C3 7425                    	JZ	short GotCDS
 16964                                  
 16965                                  ; The CDS was joined. Let's go back and grab the logical CDS.
 16966                                  
 16967 000027C5 06                      	push	es	
 16968 000027C6 57                      	push	di
 16969 000027C7 51                      	push	cx			; save CDS and cluster...
 16970 000027C8 E8ACDC                  	call	Get_User_Stack		; get original text
 16971                                  	
 16972                                  	;mov	di,[si+6]
 16973 000027CB 8B7C06                  	MOV	DI,[SI+user_env.user_DX]
 16974                                  	;mov	ds,[si+0Eh]
 16975 000027CE 8E5C0E                  	MOV	DS,[SI+user_env.user_DS]
 16976                                  	
 16977 000027D1 BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 16978 000027D4 87F7                    	XCHG	SI,DI
 16979 000027D6 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; do no splicing
 16980 000027D8 57                      	push	di
 16981 000027D9 E8C449                  	call	TransPathNoSet		; Munge path
 16982 000027DC 5E                      	pop	si
 16983                                  
 16984                                  ; There should NEVER be an error here.
 16985                                  
 16986                                  ;IF FALSE
 16987                                  ;	JNC SKipErr
 16988                                  ;	fmt <>,<>,<"$p: Internal CHDIR error\n">
 16989                                  ;SkipErr:
 16990                                  ;ENDIF
 16991 000027DD C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]		; get new CDS
 16992                                  	;mov	word [es:di+49h],-1
 16993 000027E1 26C74549FFFF            	MOV	word [ES:DI+curdir.ID],-1
 16994                                  					; no valid cluster here...
 16995 000027E7 59                      	pop	cx
 16996 000027E8 5F                      	pop	di
 16997 000027E9 07                      	pop	es

 16999                                  ; ES:DI point to the physical CDS, CX is the ID (local only)
 17000                                  
 17001                                  GotCDS:
 17002                                  
 17003                                  ; wfp_start points to the text. See if it is long enough
 17004                                  
 17005                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 17006                                  	;push	ss
 17007                                  	;pop	ds

 17018                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 17019                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 17020                                  	; 17/12/2022
 17021 000027EF 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8
 17022 000027F4 7512                    	JNZ	short SkipRecency
 17023                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17024                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],2000h
 17025                                  	; 17/12/2022
 17026 000027F6 26F6454420              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_splice>>8
 17027                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice 
 17028                                  					;PTM. for Join and Subst ;AN000;

 17031                                  setdirclus:

 17033 00002800 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX
 17034 00002804 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]		; get logical CDS
 17035                                  SkipRecency:

 17037 0000280B 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 17038                                  mkdir_ok:

 17140                                  
 17141                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17142                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17143                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17144                                  ;
 17145                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17146                                  ;
 17147                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17148                                  ;
 17149                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17150                                  ;
 17151                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17152                                  ;
 17153                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17154                                  ;
 17155                                  
 17156                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17157                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17158                                  ;
 17159                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17160                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17161                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17162                                  ;
 17163                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17164                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17165                                  ;
 17166                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17167                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17168                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17169                                  ;
 17170                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17171                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17172                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17173                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17174                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17175                                  ;	    in BX.
 17176                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17177                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17178                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17179                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17180                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17181                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17182                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17183                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17184                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17185                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17186                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17187                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17188                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17189                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17190                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17191                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17192                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17193                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17194                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17195                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17196                                  ;
 17197                                  ;   Error returns:
 17198                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17199                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17200                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17201                                  ;
 17202                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17203                                  ;
 17204                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17205                                  ;   than the above
 17206                                  ;
 17207                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17208                                  ;
 17209                                  ;
 17210                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17211                                  ;
 17212                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17213                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17214                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17215                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17216                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17217                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17218                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17219                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17220                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17221                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17222                                  ;
 17223                                  ;
 17224                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17225                                  ;
 17226                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17227                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17228                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17229                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17230                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17231                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17232                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17233                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17234                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17235                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17236                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17237                                  ;
 17238                                  ;
 17239                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17240                                  ;
 17241                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17242                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17243                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17244                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17245                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17246                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17247                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17248                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17249                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17250                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17251                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17252                                  ;
 17253                                  ;
 17254                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17255                                  ;
 17256                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17257                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17258                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17259                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17260                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17261                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17262                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17263                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17264                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17265                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17266                                  ;
 17267                                  ;
 17268                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17269                                  ;
 17270                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17271                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17272                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17273                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17274                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17275                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17276                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17277                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17278                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17279                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17280                                  ;
 17281                                  ;
 17282                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17283                                  ;
 17284                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17285                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17286                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17287                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17288                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17289                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17290                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17291                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17292                                  ;
 17293                                  ;
 17294                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17295                                  ;
 17296                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17297                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17298                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17299                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17300                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17301                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17302                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17303                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17304                                  ;
 17305                                  ;
 17306                                  ;   =================================================================
 17307                                  ;
 17308                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17309                                  ;
 17310                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17311                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17312                                  ;
 17313                                  ;   =================================================================
 17314                                  ;
 17315                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17316                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17317                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17318                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17319                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17320                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17321                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17322                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17323                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17324                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17325                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17326                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17327                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17328                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17329                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17330                                  ;
 17331                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17332                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17333                                  ;
 17334                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17335                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17336                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17337                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17338                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17339                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17340                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17341                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17342                                  ;
 17343                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17344                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17345                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17346                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17347                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17348                                  ;
 17349                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17350                                  	
 17351                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17352                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17353                                  
 17354                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17355                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17356                                  
 17357                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17358                                  	; DOSCODE:67F7h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17359

 17444                                  					;   device bit!! He can muck with the

 17555                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17556                                  ;
 17557                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17558                                  ;
 17559                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17560                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17561                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17562                                  ;
 17563                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17564                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17565                                  ;	call.
 17566                                  ;
 17567                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17568                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17569                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17570                                  ;
 17571                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17572                                  
 17573                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 17574                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 17575 0000291D E87943                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 17576 00002920 726F                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 17577                                  
 17578                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 17579                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 17580                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 17581 00002922 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 17582 00002927 7563                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 17583                                  
 17584 00002929 C606[2303]04            	mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17585                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 17586 0000292E 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 17587 00002932 EB0F                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 17588                                  
 17589                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 17590                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 17591 00002934 C606[2303]02            	mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 17592 00002939 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 17593 0000293C 754E                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 17594                                  
 17595 0000293E E88101                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 17596 00002941 7549                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 17597                                  
 17598                                  Do_GenIOCTL:
 17599                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 
 17600                                  					; Can device handle Generic IOCTL funcs
 17601                                  	; 09/09/2018
 17602                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],40h
 17603 00002943 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h
 17604 00002948 7442                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_fun

 17606                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17607                                  
 17608                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17609                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19 ; 13h
 17610 0000294A C606[7E03]13            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],GENIOCTL ; Assume real Request
 17611                                  	;cmp	al,10h

 17613 00002951 7C0C                    	jl	short SetIOCtlBlock
 17614                                  	
 17615                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],IOQUERY ; See if device supports a query
 17616                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],80h

 17618 00002958 7432                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; No support for query

 17629                                  	; 07/09/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 17630                                  	;;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19
 17631                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],GENIOCTL ; 07/09/2018
 17632                                  	;

 17634 0000296A 882E[8903]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION],CH
 17635 0000296E 880E[8A03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION],CL
 17636 00002972 8936[8B03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.REG_SI],SI
 17637 00002976 893E[8D03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.REG_DI],DI
 17638 0000297A 8916[8F03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET],DX
 17639 0000297E 8936[9103]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET+2],SI
 17640                                  
 17641                                  ;hkn; IOCALL is in DOSDATA
 17642 00002982 BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL
 17643                                  
 17644 00002985 16                      	PUSH	SS
 17645 00002986 07                      	POP	ES
 17646                                  					; DS:SI -> Device header.
 17647 00002987 5E                      	POP	SI
 17648 00002988 1F                      	POP	DS
 17649                                  	; 10/08/2018
 17650 00002989 E9E200                  	jmp	ioctl_do_IO		; Perform Call to device driver
 17651                                  
 17652                                  ioctl_bad_fun:
 17653 0000298C B001                    	mov	al, error_invalid_function  ; 1
 17654 0000298E E9E9DC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR

 17913                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17914                                  ; Proc name : Get_Driver_BL
 17915                                  ;
 17916                                  ;	DS is DOSDATA
 17917                                  ;	BL is drive number (0=default)

 17919                                  ;	No regs modified

 17937 00002AB0 750D                    	JNZ	short got_dev_ptr	 ; Is net

 17941                                  	;les	di,[es:di+13h]

 17943                                  got_dev_ptr:

 17945                                  ioctl_bad_drv:

 17947 00002AC1 C3                      	retn

 17949                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17950                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 17951                                  ;
 17952                                  ;
 17953                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 17954                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 17955                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 17956                                  ;
 17957                                  ; On Entry:
 17958                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 17959                                  ;
 17960                                  ; On Exit:
 17961                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 17962                                  ;		- reset if net device
 17963                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 17964                                  ;
 17965                                  ;
 17966                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 17967                                  ;
 17968                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 17969                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 17970                                  ;
 17971                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17972                                  
 17973                                  Check_If_Net:
 17974                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 17975 00002AC2 E8CFFF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 17976 00002AC5 720E                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 17977 00002AC7 06                      	PUSH	ES
 17978 00002AC8 57                      	PUSH	DI
 17979 00002AC9 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17980                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 17981                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 17982                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 17983 00002ACD 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 17984 00002AD2 5F                      	POP	DI
 17985 00002AD3 07                      	POP	ES
 17986 00002AD4 C3                      	retn
 17987                                  
 17988                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 17989 00002AD5 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 17990 00002AD6 E941FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 17991

 18060                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_DELETE - Internal DELETE call for MS-DOS
 18061                                  ;	NAME	DOS_DELETE
 18062                                  
 18063                                  ;
 18064                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 18065                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 18066                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 18067                                  ;
 18068                                  
 18069                                  ;**	DELETE.ASM - Low level routine for deleting files
 18070                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18071                                  ;		DOS_DELETE
 18072                                  ;		REN_DEL_Check
 18073                                  ;		FastOpen_Delete	       ; DOS 3.3
 18074                                  ;		FastOpen_Update	       ; DOS 3.3
 18075                                  
 18076                                  ;   Revision history:
 18077                                  ;
 18078                                  ;   A000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 18079                                  ;   A001  Fastopen Rename fix	April 1989
 18080                                  
 18081                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 18082                                  
 18083                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 18084                                  ;	i_need	Creating,BYTE
 18085                                  ;	i_need	DELALL,BYTE
 18086                                  ;	i_need	THISDPB,DWORD
 18087                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 18088                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 18089                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 18090                                  ;	i_need	ATTRIB,BYTE
 18091                                  ;	i_need	SATTRIB,BYTE
 18092                                  ;	i_need	WFP_START,WORD
 18093                                  ;	i_need	REN_WFP,WORD			 ;BN001
 18094                                  ;	i_need	NAME1,BYTE			 ;BN001
 18095                                  ;	i_need	FoundDel,BYTE
 18096                                  ;	i_need	AUXSTACK,BYTE
 18097                                  ;	i_need	VOLCHNG_FLAG,BYTE
 18098                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 18099                                  ;	i_need	FastOpenTable,BYTE		  ; DOS 3.3
 18100                                  ;	i_need	FastTable,BYTE			  ; DOS 4.00
 18101                                  ;
 18102                                  ;	i_need	Del_ExtCluster,WORD		  ; DOS 4.00
 18103                                  ;
 18104                                  ;	i_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ; DOS 4.00
 18105                                  ;	i_need	DMAADD,DWORD
 18106                                  ;	i_need	RENAMEDMA,BYTE
 18107                                  
 18108                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18109                                  ;
 18110                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_DELETE
 18111                                  ;
 18112                                  ; Inputs:
 18113                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 18114                                  ;		terminated)
 18115                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 18116                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 18117                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 18118                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 18119                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 18120                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 18121                                  ; Function:
 18122                                  ;	Delete the specified file(s)
 18123                                  ; Outputs:
 18124                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 18125                                  ;		OK
 18126                                  ;	CARRY SET
 18127                                  ;	    AX is error code
 18128                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 18129                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 18130                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 18131                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 18132                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 18133                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 18134                                  ;		error_access_denied
 18135                                  ;			Attempt to delete device or directory
 18136                                  ;		***error_sharing_violation***
 18137                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 18138                                  ;			This error is NOT returned. The INT 24H is generated,
 18139                                  ;			  and the file is ignored (not deleted). Delete will
 18140                                  ;			  simply continue on looking for more files.
 18141                                  ;			  Carry will NOT be set in this case.
 18142                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 18143                                  ;
 18144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18145                                  
 18146                                  FILEFOUND   equ 01h
 18147                                  FILEDELETED equ 10h
 18148                                  
 18149

 18170                                  			; SS = DS = DOS CS, SDA first filename pointer -> 
 18171                                  			;		fully-qualified filename in DOS CS
 18172                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory structure for drive with file
 18173                                  			; Return: CF set on error
 18174 00002B2D C3                      	retn

 18377                                  ;Break	<REN_DEL_Check - check for access for rename and delete>
 18378                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18379                                  ; Procedure Name : REN_DEL_Check
 18380                                  ;
 18381                                  ; Inputs:
 18382                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 18383                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX points to entry
 18384                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI points to firclus field of entry
 18385                                  ;	[WFP_Start] points to name
 18386                                  ; Function:
 18387                                  ;	Check for Exclusive access on given file.
 18388                                  ;	  Used by RENAME, SET_FILE_INFO, and DELETE.
 18389                                  ; Outputs:
 18390                                  ;	ES:BP = [THISDPB]
 18391                                  ;	NOTE: The WFP string pointed to by [WFP_Start] Will be Modified.  The
 18392                                  ;		last element will be loaded from the directory entry.  This is
 18393                                  ;		so the name given to the sharer doesn't have any meta chars in
 18394                                  ;		it.
 18395                                  ;	Carry set if sharing violation, INT 24H generated
 18396                                  ;	    NOTE THAT AX IS NOT error_sharing_violation.
 18397                                  ;		This is because input AX is preserved.
 18398                                  ;		Caller must set the error if needed.
 18399                                  ;	Carry clear
 18400                                  ;		OK
 18401                                  ; AX,DS,BX,SI,DI preserved
 18402                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
