 21074                                  ;============================================================================
 21075                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21076                                  ;============================================================================
 21077                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21078                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21079                                  
 21080                                  ;**
 21081                                  ;
 21082                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 21083                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 21084                                  ;
 21085                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 21086                                  ;
 21087                                  ;   Modification history:
 21088                                  ;
 21089                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21090                                  ;
 21091                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 21092                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 21093                                  ;
 21094                                  
 21095                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 21096                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21097                                  ;
 21098                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 21099                                  ;
 21100                                  ; Inputs:
 21101                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 21102                                  ; Function:
 21103                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 21104                                  ; Returns:
 21105                                  ;       None
 21106                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 21107                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21108                                  
 21109                                  DOS_ABORT:
 21110 000034C0 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 21111 000034C5 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 21112                                  reset_free_jfn:
 21113 000034CA 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 21114 000034CC 51                      	PUSH    CX
 21115 000034CD 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 21116                                  
 21117 000034CE E86338                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 21118 000034D1 59                      	POP     CX
 21119 000034D2 E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 21120                                  
 21121                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 21122                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 21123                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 21124                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 21125                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 21126                                  ;
 21127                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 21128                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 21129                                  ;
 21130                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 21131                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 21132                                  ; up after this process.
 21133                                  ;
 21134                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 21135                                  
 21136                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 21137 000034D4 16                      	push	ss
 21138 000034D5 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 21139                                  
 21140                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 21141 000034D6 B81D11                  	mov	ax, 111Dh
 21142 000034D9 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 21143                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 21144                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 21145                                  ;if installed
 21146 000034DB FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 21147                                  ;else
 21148                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 21149                                  ;endif
 21150                                  
 21151                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 21152                                  ; counts.
 21153                                  					; SS override
 21154 000034DF 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 21155                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 21156 000034E4 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 21157 000034E8 E317                    	jcxz    FCBScanDone
 21158                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 21159 000034EA 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 21160 000034ED 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 21161                                  FCBTest:
 21162                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 21163 000034F1 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 21164 000034F5 7505                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 21165 000034F7 26C7050000              	mov	word [es:di],0
 21166                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0  ; yes, blast ref count
 21167                                  FCBNext:
 21168 000034FC 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 21169 000034FF E2F0                    	loop    FCBTest
 21170                                  FCBScanDone:
 21171                                  
 21172                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 21173                                  
 21174 00003501 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 21175                                  Scan:
 21176 00003503 53                      	push    bx
 21177 00003504 E8A837                  	call	SFFromSFN
 21178 00003507 5B                      	pop     bx
 21179                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 21180                                  	;retn
 21181                                  	; 18/12/2022
 21182 00003508 72B5                    	jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 21183                                  
 21184                                  ;M038
 21185                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 21186                                  
 21187                                  Scan1:
 21188                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 21189                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21190                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21191 0000350A 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 21192                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 21193                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 21194 0000350E 7519                    	jnz	short scan_next
 21195                                  ;
 21196                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 21197                                  ;
 21198 00003510 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 21199                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 21200 00003514 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 21201 00003518 750F                    	jnz	short scan_next
 21202 0000351A 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 21203                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 21204 0000351E 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 21205 00003522 7505                    	jnz	short scan_next
 21206                                  
 21207                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 21208                                  
 21209 00003524 26C7050000              	mov	word [es:di],0
 21210                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 21211                                  scan_next:
 21212 00003529 43                      	inc     bx
 21213 0000352A EBD7                    	jmp     short Scan
 21214                                  
 21215                                  ;============================================================================
 21216                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21217                                  ;============================================================================
 21218                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21219                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21220                                  
 21221                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 21222                                  ;
 21223                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 21224                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 21225                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 21226                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 21227                                  ;
 21228                                  ;	Revision history:
 21229                                  ;
 21230                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 21231                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 21232                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 21233                                  
 21234                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21235                                  
 21236                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 21237                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21238                                  ;
 21239                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 21240                                  ;
 21241                                  ; Inputs:
 21242                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 21243                                  ; Function:
 21244                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 21245                                  ; Returns:
 21246                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 21247                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 21248                                  ;	Carry set if error
 21249                                  ;	    AX has error code
 21250                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21251                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21252                                  
 21253                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 21254                                  
 21255                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21256                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21257                                  
 21258                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21259                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21260                                  
 21261                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 21262                                  
 21263                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 21264 0000352C C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 21265                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 21266 00003530 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 21267                                  
 21268                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 21269                                  
 21270                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 21271                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 21272                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21273                                  	;test	bh,80h
 21274 00003534 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 21275 00003537 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 21276                                  
 21277                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 21278 00003539 B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 21279 0000353C CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 21280                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 21281                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 21282                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 21283                                  			; CF clear if successful
 21284 0000353E C3                      	retn
 21285                                  
 21286                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 21287                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 21288                                  ;
 21289                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 21290                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 21291                                  
 21292                                  LocalClose:
 21293 0000353F E8C1E3                  	call	ECritDisk
 21294 00003542 E86401                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 21295 00003545 E8E200                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 21296                                  
 21297                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 21298                                  	;Context DS
 21299 00003548 16                      	push	ss
 21300 00003549 1F                      	pop	ds
 21301                                  
 21302 0000354A 50                      	push	ax
 21303 0000354B 53                      	push	bx
 21304 0000354C E84744                  	call	ShareEnd
 21305 0000354F 5B                      	pop	bx
 21306 00003550 58                      	pop	ax
 21307                                  
 21308                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 21309                                  
 21310                                  CloseEntry:
 21311 00003551 50                      	PUSH	AX
 21312                                  
 21313                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 21314                                  
 21315                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 21316                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21317 00003552 F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 21318                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 21319 00003555 7403                    	JZ	short rdir
 21320                                  	; 14/11/2022
 21321 00003557 E9BD00                  	JMP	FREE_SFT_OK		; either clean or device
 21322                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 21323                                  
 21324                                  ; Retrieve the directory entry for the file
 21325                                  
 21326                                  rdir:
 21327 0000355A E8DA00                  	CALL	DirFromSFT
 21328                                  	;mov	al,5
 21329 0000355D B005                    	MOV	AL,error_access_denied
 21330 0000355F 7303                    	JNC	short clook
 21331                                  	; 14/11/2022
 21332 00003561 E9B400                  	JMP	CloseFinish		; pretend the close worked.
 21333                                  	;jc	short CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 21334                                  clook:
 21335                                  
 21336                                  ; ES:DI points to entry
 21337                                  ; DS:SI points to SFT
 21338                                  ; ES:BX points to buffer header
 21339                                  
 21340 00003564 57                      	push	di
 21341 00003565 56                      	push	si
 21342                                  	;lea	si,[si+20h]
 21343 00003566 8D7420                  	LEA	SI,[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_name]
 21344                                  
 21345                                  ; ES:DI point to directory entry
 21346                                  ; DS:SI point to unpacked name
 21347                                  
 21348 00003569 E889E2                  	call	XCHGP
 21349                                  
 21350                                  ; ES:DI point to unpacked name
 21351                                  ; DS:SI point to directory entry
 21352                                  
 21353 0000356C E8B60E                  	call	MetaCompare
 21354 0000356F E883E2                  	call	XCHGP
 21355 00003572 5E                      	pop	si
 21356 00003573 5F                      	pop	di
 21357 00003574 740C                    	JZ	short CLOSE_GO		; Name OK
 21358                                  Bye:	
 21359 00003576 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 21360 00003578 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 21361 00003579 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:DI points to SFT
 21362 0000357A 16                      	PUSH	SS
 21363 0000357B 1F                      	POP	DS
 21364 0000357C F9                      	STC
 21365                                  	;mov	al,2
 21366 0000357D B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found
 21367 0000357F E99600                  	JMP	CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 21368                                  
 21369                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21370                                  CLOSE_GO:
 21371                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21372                                  	;test	word [si+2],8000h
 21373                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB ; FCB ?
 21374                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21375                                  	;test	byte [si+3],80h
 21376 00003582 F6440380                	test	byte [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(sf_isFCB>>8) ; FCB ?
 21377 00003586 740D                    	JZ	short nofcb		; no, set dir attr, sf_attr
 21378                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 21379                                  	;mov	ch,[es:di+0Bh]
 21380 00003588 268A6D0B                	MOV	CH,[ES:DI+dir_entry.dir_attr]
 21381                                  	;mov	al,[si+4]
 21382 0000358C 8A4404                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr]
 21383                                  
 21384                                  ;hkn; SS override
 21385 0000358F 36A2[6B05]              	MOV	[SS:ATTRIB],AL
 21386                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 21387                                  	;;call	MatchAttributes

 21389                                  	; 18/05/2019
 21390 00003593 EB07                    	JMP	SHORT setattr		;FT.
 21391                                  nofcb:
 21392                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 21519                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT

 21654                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT

 21661                                  
 21662                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 21663                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 21664                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 21665                                  ; the close decrementing.
 21666                                  ;
 21667                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 21668                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 21669                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 21670                                  
 21671                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21672                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 21673                                  
 21674                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 21675 00003692 E86EE2                  	call	ECritDisk
 21676                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21677 00003695 E86BE2                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 21678 00003698 E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 21679 0000369B B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1
 21680 0000369E E8B0FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 21681                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21682 000036A1 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 21683 000036A2 E84015                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 21684 000036A5 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 21685                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 21686                                  	; 18/12/2022
 21687 000036A6 E987E2                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21688                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 21689                                  ;	retn

 21725

 21766                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 21767                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21768                                  ;
 21769                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 21770                                  ;
 21771                                  ; Inputs:
 21772                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21773                                  ;		terminated)
 21774                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21775                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21776                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21777                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21778                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21779                                  ; Function:
 21780                                  ;	Make a new directory
 21781                                  ; Returns:
 21782                                  ;	Carry Clear
 21783                                  ;		No error
 21784                                  ;	Carry Set
 21785                                  ;	    AX is error code
 21786                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21787                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21788                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21789                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21790                                  ;		error_access_denied
 21791                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 21792                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 21793                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21794                                  
 21795                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 21796                                  
 21797                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21798                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21799                                  
 21800                                  DOS_MKDIR:

 21803                                  
 21804                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 21805                                  ;	transfer NET_MKDIR
 21806                                  ;ELSE

 21808 000036CE B80311                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|3
 21809 000036D1 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - MAKE REMOTE DIRECTORY
 21810                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 21811                                  			; SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified directory name
 21812                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 21813                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 21814                                  			; CF clear if successful
 21815 000036D3 C3                      	retn
 21816                                  ;ENDIF

 21972                                  ;BREAK <DOS_ChDir -- Verify a directory>
 21973                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21974                                  ;
 21975                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 21976                                  ;
 21977                                  ; Inputs:
 21978                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21979                                  ;		terminated)
 21980                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21981                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21982                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21983                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used May not be NUL
 21984                                  ; Function:
 21985                                  ;	Validate the path for potential new current directory
 21986                                  ; Returns:
 21987                                  ;	NOTE:
 21988                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 21989                                  ;	Carry Clear
 21990                                  ;	    CX is cluster number of the DIR, LOCAL CDS ONLY
 21991                                  ;		Caller must NOT set ID fields on a NET CDS.
 21992                                  ;	Carry Set
 21993                                  ;	    AX is error code
 21994                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21995                                  ;			Bad path
 21996                                  ;		error_access_denied
 21997                                  ;			device or file name
 21998                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 21999                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 22263                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 22264                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 22265                                  
 22266                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 22267                                  ;
 22268                                  ;	SWAPCON
 22269                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 22270                                  ;	DOS_READ
 22271                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 22272                                  ;	get_io_sft
 22273                                  ;	DirRead
 22274                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 22275                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 22276                                  ;	FATSecRd
 22277                                  ;	DREAD
 22278                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 22279                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 22280                                  ;
 22281                                  ;	Revision history:
 22282                                  ;
 22283                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 22284                                  ;
 22285                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 22288                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 22289                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 22290                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 22291                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 22292                                  ;
 22293                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22294                                  ;
 22295                                  
 22296                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22297                                  
 22298                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 22299                                  
 22300                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 22301                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22302                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 22303                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 22304                                  ;
 22305                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 22306                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 22307                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 22308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22309                                  
 22310                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 22311                                  
 22312                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22313                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22314                                  
 22315                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22316                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22317                                  
 22318                                  SWAPBACK:
 22319 000038B9 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 22320 000038BE C3                      	retn
 22321                                  
 22322                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22323                                  ;
 22324                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 22325                                  ;
 22326                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 22327                                  ;
 22328                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 22329                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 22330                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 22331                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 22332                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22333                                  
 22334                                  SWAPCON:
 22335                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 22336                                  	;push	es
 22337                                  	;push	di
 22338                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 22339                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]

 22355                                  
 22356                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22357                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22358                                  
 22359                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 22360                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22361                                  ;
 22362                                  ; Inputs:
 22363                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 22364                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 22365                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 22366                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 22367                                  ; Function:
 22368                                  ;	Perform read operation
 22369                                  ; Outputs:
 22370                                  ;    Carry clear
 22371                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 22372                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 22373                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22374                                  ;    Carry set
 22375                                  ;	AX is error code
 22376                                  ;	CX = 0
 22377                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22378                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 22379                                  ;
 22380                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22381                                  
 22382                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 22383                                  
 22384                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22385                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22386                                  
 22387                                  DOS_READ:
 22388 000038D3 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22389                                  
 22390                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 22391                                  
 22392                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+2]
 22393 000038D7 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 22394                                  	;and	al,0Fh
 22395 000038DB 240F                    	AND	AL,access_mask
 22396                                  	;cmp	al,1

 22399 000038E1 E90306                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 22400                                  
 22401                                  READ_NO_MODE:
 22402 000038E4 E8E104                  	call	SETUP
 22403 000038E7 E30B                    	JCXZ	NoIORet 		; no bytes to read - fast return
 22404 000038E9 E86EDF                  	call	IsSFTNet
 22405 000038EC 7408                    	JZ	short LOCAL_READ
 22406                                  
 22407                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 22408                                  ;	transfer NET_READ
 22409                                  ;ELSE
 22410                                  	;mov	ax,1108h
 22411 000038EE B80811                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|8
 22412 000038F1 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - READ FROM REMOTE FILE
 22413                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22414                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22415                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 22416                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read
 22417 000038F3 C3                      	retn
 22418                                  ;ENDIF
 22419                                  
 22420                                  ; The user ended up requesting 0 bytes of input. We do nothing for this case
 22421                                  ; except return immediately.
 22422                                  
 22423                                  NoIORet:
 22424 000038F4 F8                      	CLC
 22425 000038F5 C3                      	retn

 22444                                  ; We are reading from a device. Examine the status of the device to see if we
 22445                                  ; can short-circuit the I/O. If the device in the EOF state or if it is the
 22446                                  ; null device, we can safely indicate no transfer.

 22555                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 22556                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line
 22557                                  ; CR line CR line CR, or is it file data, line CR LF line CR LF? Does it have
 22558                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 22559                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 22560                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode

 22562                                  ; like, LF line CR. This is a little weird.

 22858                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 22859                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22860                                  ;
 22861                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 22862                                  ;
 22863                                  ; Inputs:
 22864                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 22865                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 22866                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 22867                                  ; Function:
 22868                                  ;	Perform write operation
 22869                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 22870                                  ;		to current sf_position
 22871                                  ; Outputs:
 22872                                  ;    Carry clear
 22873                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 22874                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 22875                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22876                                  ;    Carry set
 22877                                  ;	AX is error code
 22878                                  ;	CX = 0
 22879                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22880                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 22881                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22882                                  
 22883                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio2.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is set up at this 
 22884                                  ;hkn; point to DOSDATA.
 22885                                  
 22886                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22887                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22888                                  
 22889                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22890                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22891                                  
 22892                                  DOS_WRITE:

 22903                                  
 22904                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 22905                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 22906                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 22907                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 22908                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 22909                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 22910                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 22911                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 22912                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 22913                                  
 22914                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 22915                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 22916                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB

 22934                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 22935 00003B23 B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 22936 00003B26 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 22937                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22938                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22939                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 22940                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 22941 00003B28 C3                      	retn
 22942                                  ;ENDIF

 23177                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23178                                  ;
 23179                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 23180                                  ;
 23181                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 23182                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 23183                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 23184                                  ;
 23185                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23186                                  
 23187                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23188                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23189                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23190                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23191                                  
 23192                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 23193                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 23194 00003C4F 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 23195 00003C55 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 23196                                  GetNormal:
 23197 00003C57 16                      	push	ss
 23198 00003C58 1F                      	pop	ds
 23199 00003C59 06                      	PUSH	ES
 23200 00003C5A 57                      	PUSH	DI
 23201 00003C5B E83B30                  	call	SFFromHandle
 23202 00003C5E 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 23203 00003C60 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 23204 00003C62 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 23205 00003C64 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 23206                                  RET44P:
 23207 00003C66 5F                      	POP	DI
 23208 00003C67 07                      	POP	ES
 23209 00003C68 C3                      	retn
 23210                                  GetRedir:

 23212 00003C6C 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 23213 00003C6E 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 23214 00003C73 F8                      	CLC
 23215                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 23216 00003C74 C3                      	retn
 23217                                  
 23218                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 23219                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23220                                  ;
 23221                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 23222                                  ;
 23223                                  ; Inputs:
 23224                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 23225                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 23226                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 23227                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 23228                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 23229                                  ; Function:
 23230                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 23231                                  ; Outputs:
 23232                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 23233                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 23234                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 23235                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 23236                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 23237                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 23238                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23239                                  
 23240                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 23241                                  
 23242                                  DIRREAD:
 23243                                  
 23244                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 23245                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 23246                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 23247                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 23248                                  
 23249 00003C75 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 23250                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 23251                                  	; 21/09/2023
 23252 00003C77 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 23253 00003C7B 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 23254 00003C7D 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 23255 00003C7E EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 23256                                  
 23257                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 23258                                  
 23259                                  SubDir:
 23260 00003C80 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 23261                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 23262 00003C82 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 23263                                  
 23264                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 23265                                  
 23266                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 23267 00003C86 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 23268 00003C8A D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 23269                                  
 23270                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 23271                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 23272                                  
 23273                                  DoRead:
 23274 00003C8C 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 23275 00003C90 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX

 23535                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 23536                                  
 23537                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs

 23539                                  ;	DskRead
 23540                                  ;	DWRITE
 23541                                  ;	DSKWRITE

 23543                                  ;	SETUP
 23544                                  ;	BREAKDOWN

 23553                                  ;
 23554                                  ;	Revision history:
 23555                                  ;
 23556                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 23557                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 23558                                  
 23559                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23560                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23561                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23562                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23563                                  
 23564                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 23565                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23566                                  ;
 23567                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 23568                                  ;
 23569                                  ; Inputs:
 23570                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 23571                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 23572                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 23573                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 23574                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 23575                                  ; Function:
 23576                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 23577                                  ; Outputs:
 23578                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 23579                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 23580                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 23581                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 23582                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 23583                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 23584                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23585                                  
 23586                                  DSKREAD:
 23587 00003D57 51                      	PUSH	CX
 23588                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 23589 00003D58 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 23590                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 23591 00003D5C 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 23592 00003D60 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23593 00003D61 06                      	PUSH	ES
 23594 00003D62 E87A0F                  	call	SETREAD
 23595 00003D65 EB27                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 23596                                  
 23597                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 23598                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23599                                  ;
 23600                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 23601                                  ;
 23602                                  ; Inputs:
 23603                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 23604                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 23605                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 23606                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 23607                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 23608                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 23609                                  ; Function:
 23610                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 23611                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 23612                                  ; Output:
 23613                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 23614                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 23615                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23616                                  
 23617                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 23618                                  DWRITE:
 23619 00003D67 E81600                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 23620 00003D6A 7413                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 23621                                  
 23622                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23623 00003D6C 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1
 23624 00003D72 E83A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 23625 00003D75 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1		; Check for retry
 23626 00003D77 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 23627 00003D79 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3		; Check for FAIL
 23628 00003D7B F8                      	CLC
 23629 00003D7C 7501                    	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 	; Ignore
 23630 00003D7E F9                      	STC
 23631                                  NO_CAR2:
 23632                                  dw_ret_label:
 23633 00003D7F C3                      	retn
 23634                                  
 23635                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 23636                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23637                                  ;
 23638                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 23639                                  ;
 23640                                  ; Inputs:
 23641                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 23642                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 23643                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 23644                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 23645                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 23646                                  ; Function:
 23647                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 23648                                  ; Outputs:
 23649                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 23650                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 23651                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 23652                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 23653                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 23654                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 23655                                  ;
 23656                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23657                                  
 23658                                  	;entry	DSKWRITE
 23659                                  DSKWRITE:
 23660 00003D80 51                      	PUSH	CX
 23661                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 23662 00003D81 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 23663                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 23664 00003D85 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 23665 00003D89 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23666 00003D8A 06                      	PUSH	ES
 23667 00003D8B E8840F                  	call	SETWRITE
 23668                                  DODSKOP:
 23669 00003D8E 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS		; Save DS
 23670 00003D90 1F                      	POP	DS		; DS:BP points to DPB
 23671 00003D91 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23672                                  
 23673                                  	;lds	si,[ds:bp+13h] ; 04/05/2019
 23674 00003D92 3EC57613                	LDS	SI,[ds:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; 07/09/2018
 23675 00003D96 E8D00E                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 23676                                  
 23677 00003D99 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX		; Restore DS
 23678 00003D9B 07                      	POP	ES		; Restore ES
 23679 00003D9C 5B                      	POP	BX
 23680                                  
 23681                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23682 00003D9D 368B0E[6C03]            	MOV	CX,[SS:CALLSCNT] ; Number of sectors transferred
 23683 00003DA2 5F                      	POP	DI
 23684 00003DA3 29F9                    	SUB	CX,DI
 23685 00003DA5 F7D9                    	NEG	CX		; Number of sectors not transferred
 23686                                  
 23687                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23688 00003DA7 36A1[5D03]              	MOV	AX,[SS:DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 23689                                  	;test	ax,8000h
 23690                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23691                                  	;test	ah,80h
 23692 00003DAB F6C480                  	test	ah,(STERR>>8)
 23693                                  	;test	AX,STERR
 23694 00003DAE C3                      	retn
 23695                                  
 23696                                  ;Break	<HardErrRW - map extended errors and call harderr>
 23697                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23698                                  ;
 23699                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErrRW
 23700                                  ;
 23701                                  ; Inputs:
 23702                                  ;	AX is error code from read or write
 23703                                  ;	Other registers set as per HARDERR
 23704                                  ; Function:
 23705                                  ;	Checks the error code for special extended
 23706                                  ;	errors and maps them if needed. Then invokes
 23707                                  ;	Harderr
 23708                                  ; Outputs:
 23709                                  ;	Of HARDERR
 23710                                  ; AX may be modified prior to call to HARDERR.
 23711                                  ; No other registers altered.
 23712                                  ;
 23713                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23714                                  
 23715                                  	; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23716                                  HARDERRRW:
 23717                                  	;cmp	al,0Fh
 23718 00003DAF 3C0F                    	CMP	AL,error_I24_wrong_disk
 23719 00003DB1 7512                    	JNZ	short DO_ERR			; Nothing to do
 23720                                  
 23721                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23722                                  	;push	ds
 23723                                  	;push	si
 23724                                  	;lds	si,[ss:CALLVIDRW]
 23725                                  	;mov	[ss:EXTERRPT+2], ds
 23726                                  	;mov	[ss:EXTERRPT], si
 23727                                  	;pop	si
 23728                                  	;pop	ds
 23729                                  
 23730                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23731 00003DB3 50                      	push	ax
 23732 00003DB4 36A1[7003]              	mov	ax,[SS:CALLVIDRW]		; get ptr lo  ;smr;SS Override
 23733 00003DB8 36A3[2803]              	mov	[ss:EXTERRPT],ax		; set ext err ptr lo
 23734 00003DBC 36A1[7203]              	mov	ax,[SS:CALLVIDRW+2]		; get ptr hi from dev
 23735 00003DC0 36A3[2A03]              	mov	[ss:EXTERRPT+2],ax		; set ext err ptr hi
 23736 00003DC4 58                      	pop	ax
 23737                                  DO_ERR:
 23738                                  	;;call	HARDERR
 23739                                  	;;retn

 23741                                  	; 10/06/2019

 23743                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23744                                  	;call	HARDERR
 23745                                  	;retn
 23746                                  
 23747                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23748                                  
 23749                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 23750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23751                                  ;
 23752                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 23753                                  ;
 23754                                  ; Inputs:
 23755                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 23756                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 23757                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 23758                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23759                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 23760                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 23761                                  ; Outputs:
 23762                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 23763                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 23764                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 23765                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 23766                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 23767                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 23768                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 23771                                  ;
 23772                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 23773                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 23774                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 23775                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 23776                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 23777                                  ;
 23778                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 23779                                  ;	   CX = 0
 23780                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 23781                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 23782                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 23783                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23784                                  
 23785                                  ;hkn; called from disk.asm. DS has been set up to DOSDATA.
 23786

 23905                                  ;Break	<BREAKDOWN -- CUT A USER READ OR WRITE INTO PIECES>
 23906                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23907                                  ;
 23908                                  ; Procedure Name : BREAKDOWN
 23909                                  ;
 23910                                  ; Inputs:
 23911                                  ;	CX = Length of disk transfer in bytes
 23912                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 23913                                  ;	[BYTSECPOS] = Byte position within first sector
 23914                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23915                                  ; Outputs:
 23916                                  ;	[BYTCNT1] = Bytes to transfer in first sector
 23917                                  ;	[SECCNT] = No. of whole sectors to transfer
 23918                                  ;	[BYTCNT2] = Bytes to transfer in last sector
 23919                                  ; AX, BX, DX destroyed. No other registers affected.
 23920                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23921                                  
 23922                                  BREAKDOWN:

 23924 00003E55 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX
 23925 00003E57 09C0                    	OR	AX,AX
 23926 00003E59 740E                    	JZ	short SAVFIR	; Partial first sector?
 23927                                  	;sub	ax,[es:bp+2]
 23928 00003E5B 262B4602                	SUB	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 23929 00003E5F F7D8                    	NEG	AX		; Max number of bytes left in first sector
 23930 00003E61 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX		; Subtract from total length
 23931 00003E63 7304                    	JAE	short SAVFIR
 23932 00003E65 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX		; Don't use all of the rest of the sector
 23933 00003E67 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX		; And no bytes are left
 23934                                  SAVFIR:

 23936 00003E6C 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX

 23941 00003E77 8916[D405]              	MOV	[BYTCNT2],DX	; Bytes remaining for last sector

 24178                                  
 24179 00003F41 368C1E[0E06]            	mov	[ss:TEMP_VAR2],ds

 24181                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 24182                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)

 24185                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).

 24188                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
 24189                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.
 24190

 24210                                  ;bufq:

 24212                                  ;;	BX = Extent end.

 24215                                  ;

 24231                                  ;;      transfer memory; otherwise, just re-position it in the buffer queue
 24232                                  ;;      as MRU (Most Recently Used).

 24246                                  ;;           block.

 24249                                  ;	mov	di,ax
