 26285 00004610 E9B901                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 26286                                  
 26287                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 26288                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26289                                  ;
 26290                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 26291                                  ;
 26292                                  ; Inputs:
 26293                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 26294                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 26295                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 26296                                  ; Function:
 26297                                  ;	Search from root for path
 26298                                  ; Outputs:
 26299                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 26300                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 26301                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 26302                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26303                                  
 26304                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26305                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26306                                  
 26307                                  ROOTPATH:
 26308 00004613 E8E0FE                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 26309                                  	; 24/09/2023
 26310 00004616 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 26311                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 26312 00004618 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 26313 0000461A 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 26314                                  
 26315                                  ; Root dir specified
 26316 0000461C A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 26317 0000461F A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 26318                                  	; 24/09/2023
 26319                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 26320                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 26321 00004622 C3                      	retn
 26322                                  
 26323                                  ; Inputs:
 26324                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 26325                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 26326                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 26327                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 26328                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 26329                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 26330                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 26331                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 26332                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 26333                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 26334                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 26335                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 26336                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 26337                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 26338                                  ; Function:
 26339                                  ;	Parse path name
 26340                                  ; Outputs:
 26341                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 26342                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 26343                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 26344                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 26345                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 26346                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 26347                                  ;	   Zero set
 26348                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 26349                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 26350                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 26351                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 26352                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 26353                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 26354                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 26355                                  ;	   Zero reset
 26356                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 26357                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 26358                                  ;	ELSE
 26359                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 26360                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 26361                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 26362                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 26363                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 26364                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 26365                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 26366                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 26367                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 26368                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 26369                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 26370                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 26371                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 26372                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 26373                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 26374                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 26375                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 26376                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 26377                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 26378                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 26379                                  
 26380                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26381                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26382                                  
 26383                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 26384                                  FINDPATH:
 26385 00004623 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 26386 00004624 56                      	PUSH	SI
 26387 00004625 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 26388 00004627 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 26389 0000462B 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 26390 00004630 740E                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 26391 00004632 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 26392 00004636 7508                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 26393 00004638 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 26394                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 26395 0000463C 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory currency
 26396                                  NOIDS:
 26397                                  
 26398                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 26399                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 26400                                  ;
 26401                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 26402                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 26403                                  ;
 26404                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 26405                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 26406                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 26407                                  
 26408 00004640 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 26409 00004642 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX
 26410                                  
 26411                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 26412 00004644 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 26413 00004647 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 26414 0000464A AA                      	STOSB
 26415 0000464B AB                      	STOSW
 26416 0000464C AB                      	STOSW
 26417 0000464D AB                      	STOSW
 26418 0000464E AB                      	STOSW
 26419 0000464F AB                      	STOSW
 26420                                  
 26421                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 26422 00004650 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 26423 00004653 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 26424                                  GetNam:
 26425                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26426                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 26427                                  
 26428                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26429                                  	; 16/12/2022
 26430                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 26431                                  	
 26432 00004655 AC                      	LODSB
 26433 00004656 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 26434 00004658 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 26435 0000465A 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 26436 0000465C 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 26437 0000465E 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 26438 00004660 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 26439 00004662 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 26440 00004664 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 26441 00004666 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 26442                                  StoNam: 
 26443 00004669 AA                      	STOSB
 26444 0000466A EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 26445                                  _SetExt:
 26446 0000466C BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 26447                                  GetExt:
 26448 0000466F AC                      	LODSB
 26449 00004670 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 26450 00004672 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 26451 00004674 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 26452 00004676 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 26453 00004678 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 26454 0000467A 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 26455 0000467C 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 26456                                  StoExt: 
 26457 0000467F AA                      	STOSB
 26458 00004680 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 26459                                  _GetDone:
 26460 00004682 4E                      	DEC	SI
 26461 00004683 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 26462 00004685 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 26463 00004688 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 26464 00004689 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 26465 0000468A 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 26466 0000468C 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 26467 0000468E E9E200                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 26468                                  check_device:
 26469 00004691 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 26470                                  	;MOV	AL,[SI]
 26471                                  	;OR	AL,AL
 26472                                  	; 23/09/2023
 26473 00004692 803C00                  	cmp	byte [si],0
 26474 00004695 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 26475                                  
 26476                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 26477                                  
 26478 00004697 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 26479 0000469B 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 26480                                  
 26481                                  NOT_LAST:
 26482                                  
 26483                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 26484                                  
 26485 0000469F 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 26486                                  
 26487                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 26488                                  	;context ES
 26489 000046A0 16                      	push	ss
 26490 000046A1 07                      	pop	es
 26491 000046A2 E82701                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 26492 000046A5 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 26493 000046A6 720B                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 26494 000046A8 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 26495 000046AA 7403                    	JZ	short GO_BDEV
 26496 000046AC E9C800                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 26497                                  
 26498                                  GO_BDEV:
 26499 000046AF 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 26500 000046B0 E989FE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 26501                                  
 26502                                  FindFile:
 26503                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 26504 000046B3 803E[4B05]E5            	CMP	BYTE [NAME1],0E5H	; if 1st char = E5
 26505 000046B8 7505                    	JNZ	short NOE5		; no
 26506 000046BA C606[4B05]05            	MOV	BYTE [NAME1],05H	; change it to 05
 26507                                  NOE5:
 26508                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 26509 000046BF 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Start of this element
 26510 000046C0 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP

 26512                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 26513                                  
 26514 000046C2 E89502                  	CALL	LookupPath		; call fastopen to get dir entry
 26515 000046C5 7303                    	JNC	short DIR_FOUND		; found dir entry
 26516                                  
 26517                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 26518 000046C7 E8B0FC                  	call	FINDENTRY
 26519                                  DIR_FOUND:
 26520 000046CA 59                      	POP	CX
 26521 000046CB 07                      	POP	ES
 26522 000046CC 5F                      	POP	DI
 26523 000046CD 7303                    	JNC	short LOAD_BUF
 26524 000046CF E9CA00                  	JMP	BADPATHPOP
 26525                                  
 26526                                  LOAD_BUF:
 26527 000046D2 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 26528                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],10h
 26529 000046D6 F6470B10                	TEST	BYTE [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_directory
 26530 000046DA 7503                    	JNZ	short GO_NEXT 		; DOS 3.3
 26531 000046DC E99800                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Error or end of path
 26532                                  
 26533                                  ; if we are not setting the directory, then check for end of string
 26534                                  
 26535                                  GO_NEXT:
 26536                                  ;hkn; SS override
 26537 000046DF 36803E[4C03]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NoSetDir],0
 26538 000046E5 7423                    	JZ	short SetDir
 26539 000046E7 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; Save pointer to entry
 26540 000046E9 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 26541                                  
 26542                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 26543                                  	;context DS
 26544 000046EB 16                      	push	ss
 26545 000046EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 26546 000046ED 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 26547                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26548                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 26549 000046EE F606[6D12]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 26550 000046F3 740B                    	JZ	short _nofast			; the FastOpen
 26551 000046F5 F606[6D12]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 26552 000046FA 7404                    	JZ	short _nofast			; no
 26553 000046FC 8B3E[B70D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 26554                                  _nofast:
 26555 00004700 803D00                  	CMP	BYTE [DI],0
 26556                                  	;;JNZ	short NEXT_ONE		; DOS 3.3
 26557                                  	;;JMP	_SETRET  ; retn		; Got it
 26558                                  	;retn	; 05/09/2018
 26559                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26560                                  	;jmp	_SETRET
 26561                                  	; 16/12/2022
 26562 00004703 7421                    	jz	short _SETRET
 26563                                  
 26564                                  NEXT_ONE:
 26565 00004705 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Put start of next element back on stack
 26566 00004706 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 26567 00004708 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX			; Get back pointer to entry
 26568                                  SetDir:

 26570                                  
 26571                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 26572 0000470C 1E                      	PUSH	DS		      ; save [curbuf+2]
 26573                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 26574 0000470D 16                      	push	ss
 26575 0000470E 1F                      	pop	ds		      ; set DS Dosgroup
 26576                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 26577 0000470F F606[6D12]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 26578 00004714 7411                    	JZ	short DO_NORMAL	      ; fastopen not in memory or path not
 26579 00004716 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX		      ; not found
 26580 00004718 8B3E[BC05]              	MOV	DI,[CLUSNUM]	      ; clusnum was set in LookupPath
 26581 0000471C 50                      	PUSH	AX		      ; save device id (AH)
 26582 0000471D E89BFD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 26583 00004720 58                      	POP	AX		      ; restore device id (AH)
 26584 00004721 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2		      ; pop ds in stack
 26585 00004724 EB37                    	JMP	short FAST_OPEN_SKIP
 26586                                  
 26587                                  	; 16/12/2022
 26588                                  _SETRET:
 26589 00004726 C3                      	retn
 26590                                  
 26591                                  DO_NORMAL:
 26592 00004727 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS = [curbuf + 2]
 26593                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 26594                                  
 26595 00004728 29FB                    	SUB	BX,DI			; Offset into sector of start of entry
 26596 0000472A 29FE                    	SUB	SI,DI			; Offset into sector of dir_first
 26597 0000472C 53                      	PUSH	BX
 26598 0000472D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 26599 0000472E 56                      	PUSH	SI
 26600 0000472F 51                      	PUSH	CX
 26601                                  	;push	word [di+6]
 26602 00004730 FF7506                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000;>32mb
 26603                                  	; 19/05/2019
 26604                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 26605                                  	;push	word [di+8]
 26606 00004733 FF7508                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000;>32mb
 26607 00004736 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX
 26608

 26709                                  ;Break	<STARTSRCH -- INITIATE DIRECTORY SEARCH>
 26710                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26711                                  ;
 26712                                  ; Procedure Name : STARTSRCH
 26713                                  ;
 26714                                  ; Inputs:
 26715                                  ;	[THISDPB] Set
 26716                                  ; Function:
 26717                                  ;	Set up a search for GETENTRY and NEXTENTRY
 26718                                  ; Outputs:
 26719                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameters
 26720                                  ;	Sets up LASTENT, ENTFREE=ENTLAST=-1, VOLID=0
 26721                                  ; Destroys ES,BP,AX

 26731 000047BB A3[DA05]                	MOV	[ENTLAST],AX

 26734                                  ;BREAK <MatchAttributes - the final check for attribute matching>
 26735                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26736                                  ; Procedure Name : MatchAttributes
 26737                                  ;
 26738                                  ; Input:    [Attrib] = attribute to search for
 26739                                  ;	    CH = found attribute
 26740                                  ; Output:   JZ <match>
 26741                                  ;	    JNZ <nomatch>
 26742                                  ; Registers modified: noneski
 26743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26744                                  
 26745                                  MatchAttributes:
 26746 000047BF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 26747                                  
 26748                                  ;hkn; SS override
 26749 000047C0 36A0[6B05]              	MOV	AL,[ss:ATTRIB]		; AL <- SearchSet
 26750 000047C4 F6D0                    	NOT	AL			; AL <- SearchSet'
 26751 000047C6 20E8                    	AND	AL,CH			; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet
 26752                                  	;and	al,16h
 26753 000047C8 2416                    	AND	AL,attr_all	; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet and Important
 26754                                  ;
 26755                                  ; the result is non-zero if an attribute is not in the search set
 26756                                  ; and in the found set and in the important set. This means that we do not
 26757                                  ; have a match. Do a JNZ <nomatch> or JZ <match>
 26758                                  ;
 26759 000047CA 58                      	POP	AX
 26760 000047CB C3                      	retn

 26762                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 26767                                  
 26768                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>
 26769                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26770                                  ;
 26771                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 26772                                  ;
 26773                                  ; Inputs:
 26774                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 26775                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 26776                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 26777                                  ; Function:
 26778                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 26779                                  ; Outputs:
 26780                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 26781                                  ;	ELSE
 26782                                  ;	Zero flag set
 26783                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 26784                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word
 26785                                  ;	DEVPT = DWORD pointer to Device header of device
 26786                                  ; BX destroyed, others preserved
 26787                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26788                                  
 26789                                  DEVNAME:
 26790                                  	; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 26791                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 49FBh
 26792

 26794 000047CD 57                      	PUSH	DI

 26796 000047CF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 26797                                  
 26798                                  ; E5 special code

 26800 000047D4 803E[4B05]05            	CMP	byte [NAME1],5
 26801 000047D9 7505                    	JNZ	short NOKTR
 26802 000047DB C606[4B05]E5            	MOV	byte [NAME1],0E5h
 26803                                  NOKTR:
 26804                                  	;test	byte [ATTRIB],8
 26805 000047E0 F606[6B05]08            	TEST	byte [ATTRIB],attr_volume_id
 26806                                  					; If looking for VOL id don't find devs
 26807 000047E5 7521                    	JNZ	short RET31
 26808                                  
 26809                                  ;hkn; NULDEV is in DOSDATA
 26810 000047E7 BE[4800]                	MOV	SI,NULDEV
 26811                                  LOOKIO:
 26812                                  	; 21/11/2022
 26813                                  	;test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],80h
 26814                                  	; 17/12/2022
 26815                                  	;test	byte [si+5],80h
 26816 000047EA F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)
 26817                                  	;;test	word [si+4],8000h
 26818                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 26819 000047EE 7411                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)
 26820 000047F0 89F0                    	MOV	AX,SI
 26821                                  	;add	si,10
 26822 000047F2 83C60A                  	ADD	SI,SYSDEV.NAME
 26823                                  
 26824                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 26825 000047F5 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 26826 000047F8 B90400                  	MOV	CX,4			; All devices are 8 letters
 26827 000047FB F3A7                    	REPE	CMPSW			; Check for name in list
 26828 000047FD 89C6                    	MOV	SI,AX
 26829 000047FF 7415                    	JZ	short IOCHK		; Found it?
 26830                                  SKIPDEV:

 26832 00004803 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1			; At end of list?
 26833 00004806 75E2                    	JNZ	short LOOKIO
 26834                                  RET31:	
 26835 00004808 F9                      	STC				; Not found
 26836                                  RETNV:	
 26837 00004809 8CD1                    	MOV	CX,SS
 26838 0000480B 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 26839                                  
 26840 0000480D 8F06[4B05]              	POP	WORD [NAME1]
 26841 00004811 58                      	POP	AX
 26842 00004812 59                      	POP	CX
 26843 00004813 5F                      	POP	DI
 26844 00004814 5E                      	POP	SI
 26845 00004815 C3                      	RETN

 26858                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 26859                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26860                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 26861                                  ;
 26862                                  ; Inputs:
 26863                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 26864                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 26865                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 26866                                  ; Function:
 26867                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 26868                                  ; Outputs:
 26869                                  ;	BX points to DEVFCB
 26870                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 26871                                  ;	AH = input BH

 26876                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26877                                  
 26878                                  Build_device_ent:

 26932                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 26933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26934                                  ;
 26935                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 26936                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 26937                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.
 26938                                  ;
 26939                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisCDS points to CDS of interest
 26940                                  ;		SS:DI points to temp buffer
 26941                                  ;   Outputs:	The current directory string is validated on the appropriate
 26942                                  ;		    drive
 26943                                  ;		ThisDPB changed
 26944                                  ;		ES:DI point to CDS
 26945                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 26946                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 26947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26948                                  
 26949                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26950                                  	; DOSCODE:819Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26951                                  
 26952                                  ValidateCDS:
 26953                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26954                                  	; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 26955                                  
 26956                                     %define  Temp	[bp-2]	; word
 26957                                     %define  SaveCDS	[bp-6]	; dword
 26958                                     %define  SaveCDSL	[bp-6]	; word
 26959                                     %define  SaveCDSH	[bp-4]	; word

 26961                                  	;Enter

 27095                                  
 27096                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27097                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 27098                                  
 27099                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 27100                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27101                                  ;
 27102                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 27103                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 27104                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 27105                                  ;
 27106                                  ;	[path]device
 27107                                  ;
 27108                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 27109                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 27110                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 27111                                  ;
 27112                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 27113                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 27114                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 27115                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 27116                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 27117                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 27118                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 27119                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27120                                  
 27121                                  CheckThisDevice:
 27122 00004915 57                      	push	di
 27123 00004916 56                      	push	si
 27124 00004917 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 27125                                  
 27126                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 27127                                  
 27128 00004919 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 27129 0000491B E8750D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 27130 0000491E 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 27131 00004920 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 27132                                  
 27133                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 27134                                  
 27135 00004921 AD                      	LODSW
 27136 00004922 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 27137 00004925 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 27138                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 27139 00004928 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 27140 0000492A AC                      	LODSB
 27141 0000492B 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 27142 0000492D 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 27143 0000492F 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 27144 00004931 AC                      	LODSB
 27145 00004932 E85E0D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 27146 00004935 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 27147                                  
 27148                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 27149                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 27150                                  
 27151                                  ParseDev:
 27152 00004937 1E                      	push	ds
 27153 00004938 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 27154 00004939 E8950C                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 27155 0000493C 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 27156 0000493F F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 27157 00004940 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 27158                                  
 27159                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 27160 00004942 16                      	push	ss
 27161 00004943 1F                      	pop	ds
 27162                                  
 27163                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 27164                                  ;
 27165                                  ; SR;
 27166                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 27167                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 27168                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 27169                                  
 27170 00004944 A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 27171 00004947 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 27172                                  
 27173                                  ; M026 - end
 27174                                  
 27175 0000494A E87FFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 27176                                  
 27177                                  SkipSearch:
 27178 0000494D 5E                      	pop	si
 27179 0000494E 1F                      	pop	ds
 27180                                  
 27181                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 27182                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 27183                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 27184                                  
 27185                                  CheckReturn:
 27186 0000494F 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 27187 00004950 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 27188 00004952 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 27189                                  Check_Done:
 27190 00004954 5F                      	pop	di
 27191 00004955 F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 27192 00004956 C3                      	retn
 27193                                  NotDevice:
 27194 00004957 F9                      	STC
 27195 00004958 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn
 27196                                  
 27197                                  ;BREAK <LookupPath - call fastopen to get dir entry info>
 27198                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27199                                  ;
 27200                                  ; Procedure Name : LookupPath
 27201                                  ;
 27202                                  ; Output  DS:SI -> path name,
 27203                                  ;	  ES:DI -> dir entry info buffer
 27204                                  ;	  ES:CX -> extended dir info buffer
 27205                                  ;
 27206                                  ;	  carry flag clear : tables pointed by ES:DI and ES:CX are filled by
 27207                                  ;			     FastOpen, DS:SI points to char just one after
 27208                                  ;			     the last char of path name which is fully or
 27209                                  ;			     partially found in FastOPen
 27210                                  ;	  carry flag set : FastOpen not in memory or path name not found
 27211                                  ;
 27212                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27213                                  
 27214                                  LookupPath:
 27215                                  ;	PUSH	AX
 27216                                  
 27217                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27218                                  	;test	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],1
 27219 0000495A 36F606[6D12]01          	TEST	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set  ; flg is set in DOSOPEN
 27220 00004960 7503                    	JNZ	short FASTINST			    ; and this routine is
 27221                                  NOLOOK:
 27222 00004962 E99700                  	JMP	NOLOOKUP			    ; executed once
 27223                                  
 27224                                  FASTINST:
 27225                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27226                                  	;test	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],8
 27227 00004965 36F606[6D12]08          	TEST	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],No_Lookup	    ; no more lookup?
 27228 0000496B 75F5                    	JNZ	short NOLOOK			    ; yes
 27229                                  
 27230 0000496D BB[6312]                	MOV	BX,FastOpenTable		    ; get fastopen related tab
 27231                                  
 27232                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27233 00004970 368B36[B205]            	MOV	SI,[SS:WFP_START]		    ; si points to path name
 27234 00004975 BF[970D]                	MOV	DI,Dir_Info_Buff
 27235 00004978 B9[8C0D]                	MOV	CX,FastOpen_Ext_Info
 27236 0000497B B001                    	MOV	AL,FONC_Look_up 		    ; al = 1
 27237 0000497D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 27238 0000497E 07                      	POP	ES
 27239                                  
 27240                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27241                                  	;call	far [bx+2]
 27242 0000497F FF5F02                  	CALL	far [BX+fastopen_entry.name_caching] ;call fastopen
 27243 00004982 7267                    	JC	short NOTFOUND			    ; fastopen not in memory
 27244                                  
 27245 00004984 8D5CFE                  	LEA	BX,[SI-2]
 27246                                  
 27247                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27248 00004987 363B1E[B205]            	CMP	BX,[SS:WFP_START]		    ; path found ?
 27249 0000498C 745D                    	JZ	short NOTFOUND			    ; no
 27250                                  
 27251                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27252                                  
 27253                                  	; MSDOS 6.0				    ; fully or partially found
 27254 0000498E 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0			    ;AN000;FO.
 27255 00004991 751A                    	JNZ	short parfnd			    ;AN000;FO.; partiallyfound
 27256 00004993 51                      	PUSH	CX				    ;AN000;FO.; is attribute matched ?
 27257                                  
 27258                                  ;hkn; SS override for attrib/sattrib
 27259 00004994 368A0E[6B05]            	MOV	CL,[ss:ATTRIB]			    ;AN000;FO.;
 27260 00004999 368A2E[6D05]            	MOV	CH,[ss:SATTRIB]			    ;AN000;FO.; attrib=sattrib
 27261 0000499E 36882E[6B05]            	MOV	[ss:ATTRIB],CH			    ;AN000;FO.;
 27262                                  	;mov	ch,[es:di+0Bh]
 27263 000049A3 268A6D0B                	MOV	CH,[ES:DI+dir_entry.dir_attr]	    ;AN000;FO.;
 27264 000049A7 E815FE                  	call	MatchAttributes 		    ;AN000;FO.;
 27265                                  ;;;	MOV	[ss:ATTRIB],CL			    ;AN001;FO.; restore attrib
 27266 000049AA 59                      	POP	CX				    ;AN000;FO.;
 27267 000049AB 754F                    	JNZ	short NOLOOKUP			    ;AN000;FO.; not matched
 27268                                  parfnd:
 27269                                  
 27270                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27271 000049AD 368936[B70D]            	MOV	[SS:Next_Element_Start],SI	    ; save si
 27272 000049B2 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX
 27273                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27274                                  	;mov	ax,[bx+7]
 27275 000049B4 8B4707                  	MOV	AX,[BX+FEI.lastent]		    ;AN000;;FO. restore lastentry
 27276                                  ;hkn; SS override for LASTENT, DIRSTART, CLUSNUM
 27277 000049B7 36A3[4803]              	MOV	[SS:LASTENT],AX			    ;AN000;;FO.
 27278 000049BB 8B4709                  	MOV	AX,[BX+FEI.dirstart]		    ;AN001;;FO. restore dirstart
 27279 000049BE 36A3[C205]              	MOV	[SS:DIRSTART],AX		    ;AN001;;FO.
 27280                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27281                                  	;;mov	ax,[bx+3] ; MSDOS 3.3
 27282                                  	;mov	ax,[bx+5] ; MSDOS 6.0
 27283 000049C2 8B4705                  	MOV	AX,[BX+FEI.clusnum]		    ; restore next cluster num
 27284 000049C5 36A3[BC05]              	MOV	[SS:CLUSNUM],AX			    ;
 27285                                  
 27286 000049C9 06                      	PUSH	ES				    ; save ES
 27287                                  ;hkn; SS override
 27288 000049CA 36C41E[8A05]            	LES	BX,[SS:THISDPB]			    ; put drive id
 27289 000049CF 268A27                  	mov	ah,[ES:BX] ; 15/08/2018
 27290                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BX+DPB.DRIVE]		    ; in AH for DOOPEN
 27291 000049D2 07                      	POP	ES				    ; pop ES
 27292                                  ;SR;
 27293                                  ; We cannot have a root dir if we have come here. So, we zero out CurBuf to
 27294                                  ;indicate it is not a root dir
 27295                                  
 27296 000049D3 36C706[E205]0000        	mov	word [SS:CURBUF],0		    ; indicate not root dir
 27297 000049DA 368C06[E405]            	MOV	WORD [SS:CURBUF+2],ES		    ; [curbuf+2].bx points to
 27298 000049DF 89FB                    	MOV	BX,DI				    ; start of entry
 27299                                  	;lea	si,[di+1Ah]
 27300 000049E1 8D751A                  	LEA	SI,[DI+dir_entry.dir_first]	    ; [curbuf+2]:si points to
 27301                                  						    ; dir_first field in the
 27302                                  						    ; dir entry
 27303                                  ;hkn; SS override for FastOpenFlg
 27304                                  	;or	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],12h ; 29/12/2022
 27305 000049E4 36800E[6D12]12          	OR	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success+Set_For_Search
 27306                                  ;	POP	AX
 27307 000049EA C3                      	RETN
 27308                                  NOTFOUND:
 27309 000049EB 83F8FF                  	CMP	AX,-1				    ; not in memory ?
 27310 000049EE 7506                    	JNZ	short Partial_Success 		    ; yes, in memory
 27311 000049F0 36C606[6D12]00          	MOV	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],0		    ; no more fastopen
 27312                                  Partial_Success:
 27313                                  	;and	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],0FBh
 27314 000049F6 368026[6D12]FB          	AND	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],Special_Fill_Reset
 27315                                  NOLOOKUP:
 27316                                  ;	POP	AX
 27317 000049FC F9                      	STC
 27318 000049FD C3                      	RETN

 27320                                  ;BREAK <InsertPath - call fastopen to insert dir entry info>
 27321                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27322                                  ;
 27323                                  ; Procedure Name : InsertPath
 27324                                  ; Input:  FastOpen_Set flag set when from DOSOPEN otherwise 0
 27325                                  ;	  Lookup_Success flag set when got dir entry info from FASTOPEN
 27326                                  ;	  DS = DOSDATA
 27327                                  ; Output: FastOPen_Ext_Info is set and path dir info is inserted
 27328                                  ;
 27329                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27330                                  
 27331                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27332                                  
 27333                                  InsertPath:
 27334 000049FE 9C                      	PUSHF
 27335                                  ;hkn; SS override for FastOpenFlag
 27336                                  	;test	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg], 1
 27337 000049FF 36F606[6D12]01          	TEST	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 27338 00004A05 7479                    	JZ	short GET_NEXT_ELEMENT		; the FastOpen
 27339                                  	;test	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],2
 27340 00004A07 36F606[6D12]02          	TEST	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 27341 00004A0D 740D                    	JZ	short INSERT_DIR_INFO		; no
 27342                                  	;and	byte [ss:FastOpenFlg],0FDh
 27343 00004A0F 368026[6D12]FD          	AND	byte [SS:FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Reset  ; we got dir info from fastopen so
 27344 00004A15 368B3E[B70D]            	MOV	DI,[SS:Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 27345 00004A1A EB5E                    	JMP	short GET_NEXT2
 27346                                  INSERT_DIR_INFO:				; save registers
 27347 00004A1C 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 27348 00004A1D 06                      	PUSH	ES
 27349 00004A1E 53                      	PUSH	BX

 27351 00004A20 57                      	PUSH	DI
 27352 00004A21 51                      	PUSH	CX
 27353 00004A22 50                      	PUSH	AX
 27354

 27357 00004A28 BE[8C0D]                	MOV	SI,FastOpen_Ext_Info

 27365

 27373                                  	;mov	[si+3],ax

 27375                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27376 00004A3A A1[BC05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSNUM]		; save next cluster number
 27377                                  	;;mov	[si+5],ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 27378                                  	;mov	[si+3],ax ; MSDOS 3.3

 27380                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 27382                                  	;mov	[si+7],ax

 27385                                  	;mov	[si+9],ax

 27387                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 27390                                  	;add	di,20  ; MSDOS 6.0

 27406                                  					; never insert info when file is empty

 27408

 27474                                  ;DEV001E:
 27475                                  
 27476                                  ; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27477                                  ; DOSCODE:8413h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27478                                  
 27479                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 27480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27481                                  ;
 27482                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 27483                                  ;
 27484                                  ; Inputs:
 27485                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 27486                                  ;	AH is function code
 27487                                  ;		= 0 Input
 27488                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 27489                                  ;		= 2 Output
 27490                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 27491                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 27492                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 27493                                  ;				   present.
 27494                                  ;	AL = character if output
 27495                                  ; Function:
 27496                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 27497                                  ; Outputs:
 27498                                  ;	AL is character if input
 27499                                  ;	If a status call
 27500                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 27501                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 27502                                  ; For regular files:
 27503                                  ;	Input Status
 27504                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 27505                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 27506                                  ;	Input
 27507                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 27508                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 27509                                  ;	Output Status
 27510                                  ;		Always ready
 27511                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 27512                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27513                                  
 27514                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27515                                  ; DOSCODE:83D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27516                                  
 27517                                  IOFUNC:
 27518 00004A94 368C16[8C03]            	MOV	[SS:IOXAD+2],SS		; SS override for IOXAD, IOSCNT, 
 27519                                  					; DEVIOBUF
 27520 00004A99 36C706[8A03][BC03]      	MOV	WORD [SS:IOXAD],DEVIOBUF
 27521 00004AA0 36C706[8E03]0100        	MOV	WORD [SS:IOSCNT],1
 27522 00004AA7 36A3[BC03]              	MOV	WORD [SS:DEVIOBUF],AX

 27524                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; 8000h
 27525 00004AAB F6440680                	test	byte [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 27526 00004AAF 7403                    	JZ	short IOTO22		;AN000;

 27528                                  IOTO22:
 27529                                  	;test	word [si+5],80h
 27530                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device 
 27531 00004AB4 F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device	
 27532 00004AB8 7503                    	JNZ	short IOTO33		;AN000;
 27533 00004ABA E99C00                  	JMP	IOTOFILE		;AN000;
 27534                                  IOTO33:
 27535 00004ABD 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 27536 00004ABE E897B9                  	call	save_world
 27537 00004AC1 8CDA                    	MOV	DX,DS
 27538 00004AC3 8CD3                    	MOV	BX,SS
 27539 00004AC5 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 27540 00004AC7 8EC3                    	MOV	ES,BX
 27541 00004AC9 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX

 27545                                  	; 16/12/2022

 27547                                  	;or	bx,0400H	    ; Set bit 10 in status word for driver
 27548                                  				    ; It is up to device driver to carry out
 27549                                  				    ; appropriate action.

 27618                                  	; Know user must have wanted Ignore OR Fail. Make sure device shows ready
 27619                                  	; ready so that DOS doesn't get caught in a status loop when user

 27736                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27737                                  ;**	Dev_Open_SFT - Open the Device for an SFT
 27738                                  ;
 27739                                  ;	Dev_Open_SFT issues an open call to the device associated with
 27740                                  ;	the SFT.
 27741                                  ;
 27742                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:DI) = SFT
 27743                                  ;	EXIT	none
 27744                                  ;	USES	all
 27745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27746                                  
 27747                                  DEV_OPEN_SFT:
 27748 00004BE5 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)

 27751 00004BE9 B00D                    	MOV	AL,DEVOPN
 27752 00004BEB EB06                    	JMP	SHORT DO_OPCLS
 27753                                  
 27754                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27755                                  ; Procedure Name : DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 27756                                  ;
 27757                                  ; Inputs:
 27758                                  ;	ES:DI Points to SFT
 27759                                  ; Function:
 27760                                  ;	Issue a CLOSE call to the correct device
 27761                                  ; Outputs:
 27762                                  ;	None
 27763                                  ; ALL preserved
 27764                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27765                                  
 27766                                  DEV_CLOSE_SFT:
 27767 00004BED 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 27768 00004BEE E867B8                  	call	save_world
 27769                                  	;mov	al,0Eh	
 27770 00004BF1 B00E                    	MOV	AL,DEVCLS
 27771                                  
 27772                                  	; Main entry for device open and close. AL contains the function 
 27773                                  	; requested. Subtlety: if Sharing is NOT loaded then we do NOT issue 
 27774                                  	; open/close to block devices. This allows networks to function but 
 27775                                  	; does NOT hang up with bogus change-line code.
 27776                                  
 27777                                  	;entry	DO_OPCLS
 27778                                  DO_OPCLS:
 27779                                  	; Is the SFT for the net? If so, no action necessary.
 27780                                  
 27781                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27782                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 27783                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet
 27784 00004BF3 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)

 27786 00004BFA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Unit
 27787                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],80h
 27788 00004BFC 26F6450580              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device
 27789                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]

 27791 00004C05 7513                    	JNZ	short GOT_DEV_ADDR
 27792                                  
 27793                                  	; We are about to call device open/close on a block driver. If no 
 27794                                  	; sharing then just short circuit to done.
 27795                                  	
 27796                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27797                                  					; SS override

 27800                                  
 27801                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27802                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+1]
 27803 00004C0F 268A6501                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+DPB.UNIT]	; (ah) = unit
 27804 00004C13 268A0D                  	mov	cl,[es:di]
 27805                                  	;MOV	CL,[ES:DI+DPB.DRIVE]	; (cl) = drive
 27806                                  	;;les	di,[es:di+12h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 27807                                  	;les	di,[es:di+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 27809                                  GOT_DEV_ADDR:				; ES:DI -> device
 27810                                  	;test	word [es:di+4],800h

 27843                                  	;jz	short OPCLS_DONEP

 27851 00004C4C 7404                    	JZ	short BLKDEV

 27853 00004C50 EB04                    	JMP	SHORT HRDERR
