 29957                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29958                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29959                                  
 29960                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29961                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 29962                                  
 29963                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 29964                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29965                                  ;
 29966                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 29967                                  ;
 29968                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 29969                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 29970                                  ;
 29971                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 29972                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 29973                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 29974                                  ;
 29975                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 29976                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 29977                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 29978                                  ;
 29979                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 29980                                  ;
 29981                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 29982                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 29983                                  ;           ELSE
 29984                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 29985                                  ;
 29986                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 29987                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 29988                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 29989                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 29990                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 29991                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 29992                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 29993                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 29994                                  ;   allocated.
 29995                                  ;
 29996                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 29997                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 29998                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 29999                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 30000                                  ;
 30001                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 30002                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 30003                                  ;                                                                          ;
 30004                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 30005                                  ;   explanation:
 30006                                  ;
 30007                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 30008                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 30009                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 30010                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 30011                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 30012                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 30013                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 30014                                  ;   the
 30015                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 30016                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 30017                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 30018                                  ;
 30019                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 30020                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 30021                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 30022                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 30023                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 30024                                  ;
 30025                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 30026                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 30027                                  ;                                                                          ;
 30028                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 30029                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 30030                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30031                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 30032                                  ;
 30033                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 30034                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 30035                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 30036                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 30037                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 30038                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 30039                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 30040                                  ;
 30041                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 30042                                  
 30043                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 30044                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 30045                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 30046                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 30047                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 30048                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 30049                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 30050                                  ;callmagic  endp
 30051                                  
 30052                                  
 30053                                  ; 25/09/2023
 30054                                  %if 0
 30055                                  callmagic:
 30056                                  	push	ds
 30057                                  	push	MagicPatch
 30058                                  	retf	
 30059                                  %endif
 30060                                  
 30061                                  ALLOCATE:
 30062                                  	; 10/09/2018
 30063                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 30064                                  ;
 30065                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 30066                                  ;
 30067                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 30068                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 30069                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 30070                                  ;data would not.
 30071                                  ;        
 30072                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 30073                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 30074                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 30075                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 30076                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 30077                                  
 30078                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30079                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 30080                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 30081                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 30082                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 30083                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 30084                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 30085                                  
 30086                                  ; 25/09/2023
 30087                                  %if 0
 30088                                  	clc
 30089                                  	push	cs
 30090                                  	call	callmagic
 30091                                  	jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 30092                                  	jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 30093                                  Regular_Allocate_Path:
 30094                                  %endif
 30095

 30097                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS

 30102 0000540C 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 30103 0000540D 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 30104 0000540F E82407                  	call	UNPACK
 30105 00005412 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 30106 00005416 5B                              POP     BX

 30118                                  
 30119                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 30120                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan

 30127                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 30128                                  
 30129                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 30130                                  ;
 30131                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 30132                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 30133                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 30134                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file

 30140 00005434 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 30141 00005436 E8FD06                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 30142 00005439 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 30143 0000543B 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 30144                                  
 30145                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 30146                                  ;

 30148                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file

 30153 00005441 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 30154 00005442 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 30155 00005445 E84207                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 30156 00005448 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 30157                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 30158                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30159 0000544A 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 30160 0000544F 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 30161                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 30162                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30163 00005451 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 30164                                  NO_ALLOC:
 30165 00005455 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 30166 00005456 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 30167 00005458 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 30168 0000545A E82D07                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 30169                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 30170                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 30171 0000545D 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 30172 0000545F 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 30173 00005460 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 30174 00005462 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 30175                                  
 30176                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 30177                                  ;
 30178                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 30179                                  
 30180 00005464 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 30181 00005467 E82007                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 30182                                  
 30183                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 30184                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 30185                                  ;
 30186                                  ;       'C' set if error
 30187                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 30188                                  
 30189                                  ads4:   
 30190 0000546A 5B                      	POP     BX
 30191 0000546B 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 30192 0000546C 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 30193 0000546E E8C506                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 30194                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 30195 00005471 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 30196 00005473 E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 30197 00005476 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 30198 00005478 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 30199 0000547A 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 30200 0000547C 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 30201                                  
 30202                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 30203                                  ;   info
 30204                                  dofastk:
 30205                                  	; 20/05/2019
 30206                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30207                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 30208                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 30209                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #

 30224                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx

 30236                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 30237                                  
 30238 0000548C C3                      	retn	
 30239                                  
 30240                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 30241                                  ;   of the disk...
 30242                                  
 30243                                  ads7:   
 30244 0000548D 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 30245 00005492 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 30246                                  
 30247                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 30248                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 30249                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 30250                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 30251                                  ;
 30252                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 30253                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 30254                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 30255                                  
 30256 00005494 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 30257 00005495 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 30258 00005498 E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 30259 0000549B 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 30260                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 30261                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 30262                                                                  ;   setup.
 30263 0000549C 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 30264 0000549E E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 30265                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 30266                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 30267                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 30268 000054A1 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 30269 000054A6 F9                              STC
 30270 000054A7 C3                              retn
 30271                                  
 30272                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30273                                  ;
 30274                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 30275                                  ;
 30276                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 30277                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30278                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30279                                  
 30280                                  RESTFATBYT:
 30281 000054A8 53                              PUSH    BX
 30282 000054A9 52                              PUSH    DX
 30283 000054AA 57                              PUSH    DI
 30284 000054AB 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 30285 000054AD 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 30286 000054B1 E8D606                  	call	PACK
 30287 000054B4 5F                              POP     DI
 30288 000054B5 5A                              POP     DX
 30289 000054B6 5B                              POP     BX
 30290                                  ; 16/12/2022
 30291                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30292                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 30293 000054B7 C3                      	retn
 30294                                  
 30295                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 30296                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30297                                  ;
 30298                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 30299                                  ;
 30300                                  ; Inputs:
 30301                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 30302                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30303                                  ; Function:
 30304                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 30305                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30306                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 30307                                  ;
 30308                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30309                                  
 30310                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30311                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30312                                  RELEASE:
 30313 000054B8 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 30314                                  
 30315                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 30316                                  RELBLKS:
 30317                                  
 30318                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 30319                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 30320                                  
 30321 000054BA E87906                  	call	UNPACK
 30322 000054BD 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 30323 000054BF 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 30324 000054C1 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 30325 000054C3 52                              PUSH    DX
 30326 000054C4 E8C306                  	call	PACK
 30327 000054C7 5A                              POP     DX
 30328 000054C8 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 30329 000054CA 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 30330 000054CC 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 30331                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30332                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30333 000054CE 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 30334 000054D3 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 30335 000054D5 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 30336                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 30337 000054D9 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 30338 000054DB 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 30339 000054DC 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 30340 000054DE E83E06                  	call	IsEOF
 30341 000054E1 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 30342                                  
 30343                                  	; 16/12/2022
 30344                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30345                                  ;%if 0
 30346                                  RELEASE_flush:
 30347                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30348 000054E3 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 30349                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 30350 000054E7 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 30351 000054E8 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 30352 000054E9 06                      	push	es
 30353 000054EA 55                      	push	bp
 30354 000054EB E8850B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 30355 000054EE 5D                      	pop	bp
 30356 000054EF 07                      	pop	es
 30357 000054F0 59                      	pop	cx
 30358 000054F1 5E                      	pop	si
 30359                                  ;%endif
 30360                                  RET12:
 30361 000054F2 C3                      	retn
 30362                                  
 30363                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 30364                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30365                                  ;
 30366                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 30367                                  ;
 30368                                  ; Inputs:
 30369                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 30370                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 30371                                  ;       DS = CS
 30372                                  ; Outputs:
 30373                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 30374                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30375                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 30376                                  ;
 30377                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30378                                  
 30379                                  GETEOF:
 30380 000054F3 E84006                  	call	UNPACK
 30381 000054F6 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 30382 000054F8 53                              PUSH    BX
 30383 000054F9 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 30384 000054FB E82106                  	call	IsEOF
 30385 000054FE 5B                              POP     BX
 30386 000054FF 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 30387 00005501 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 30388 00005503 EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 30389

 30420

 30426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30427                                  ;
 30428                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 30429                                  ;
 30430                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30431                                  
 30432                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30433                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30434                                  MAKEFCB:
 30435                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30436 00005505 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 30437 0000550B 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 30438                                  	;test	al,2
 30439 0000550D A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 30440 0000550F 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 30441 00005511 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 30442                                  DEFDRV:
 30443 00005515 47                      	INC	DI
 30444 00005516 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 30445                                  	;test	al,4
 30446 00005519 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 30447 0000551B 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 30448 0000551C B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 30449 0000551E 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 30450 00005520 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 30451 00005522 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 30452                                  FILLB:
 30453 00005524 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 30454 00005526 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 30455 00005528 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 30456 0000552B 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 30457 0000552D 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 30458 0000552F 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 30459                                  FILLB2:
 30460 00005531 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 30461 00005533 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 30462 00005534 AB                      	STOSW
 30463 00005535 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 30464 00005536 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 30465                                  	;test	bl,1
 30466 00005539 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 30467 0000553C 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 30468 0000553E E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 30469 00005541 E82201                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 30470 00005544 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 30471 00005546 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 30472                                  SKPSPC:
 30473 00005547 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 30474                                  NOSCAN:
 30475 0000554A E8F000                  	CALL	GETLET
 30476 0000554D 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 30477 0000554F 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 30478 00005552 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 30479 00005554 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 30480 00005555 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 30481 00005557 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 30482                                  
 30483 00005559 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30484 0000555A E8441B                  	call	GetVisDrv
 30485 0000555D 58                      	POP	AX
 30486 0000555E 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 30487                                  
 30488                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30489                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30490                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30491 00005560 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 30492                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 30493 00005566 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 30494                                  BADDRV:
 30495 00005568 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 30496                                  HAVDRV:
 30497 0000556A AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 30498 0000556B 46                      	INC	SI
 30499 0000556C 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 30500                                  NODRV:
 30501 0000556D 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 30502 0000556E 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 30503                                  
 30504                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 30505                                  NORMSCAN:
 30506 0000556F B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 30507 00005572 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 30508 00005575 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 30509 00005578 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 30510 0000557A 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 30511                                  
 30512                                  	; 24/09/2023
 30513                                  	;mov	cx,3
 30514 0000557B B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 30515                                  
 30516                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30517                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30518                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 30519                                  	; 10/06/2019
 30520 0000557D 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 30521 00005583 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 30522 00005585 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 30523                                  	; 24/09/2023
 30524                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 30525 00005586 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 30526                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 30527                                  VOLOK:
 30528                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 30529                                  contvol:
 30530 00005587 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 30531                                  NODOT:
 30532 0000558A 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 30533                                  
 30534                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30535                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 30536                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30537 0000558C 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 30538                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 30539                                  
 30540 00005592 C3                      	retn
 30541                                  
 30542                                  NONAM:
 30543 00005593 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 30544 00005595 4E                      	DEC	SI
 30545 00005596 C3                      	retn
 30546                                  
 30547                                  GETWORD:
 30548 00005597 E8A300                  	CALL	GETLET		
 30549 0000559A 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 30550 0000559C 4E                      	DEC	SI
 30551                                  
 30552                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 30553                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 30554                                  
 30555                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 30556 0000559D E89D00                  	CALL	GETLET
 30557                                  
 30558                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 30559                                  
 30560                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 30561                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30562                                  ;ENDIF
 30563 000055A0 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 30564                                  
 30565                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30566 000055A2 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 30567 000055A8 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 30568 000055AA 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 30569 000055AC 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 30570                                  
 30571                                  MustCheckCX:
 30572 000055AE E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 30573 000055B0 49                      	DEC	CX
 30574 000055B1 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 30575 000055B3 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 30576 000055B5 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 30577 000055B7 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 30578                                  NOSTAR:
 30579 000055B9 AA                      	STOSB
 30580 000055BA 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 30581 000055BC 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 30582 000055BE 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 30583 000055C1 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 30584                                  FILLNAM:
 30585 000055C3 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 30586 000055C5 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 30587 000055C7 4E                      	DEC	SI
 30588 000055C8 C3                      	retn
 30589                                  
 30590                                  SCANB:
 30591 000055C9 AC                      	LODSB
 30592 000055CA E8A100                  	CALL	SPCHK
 30593 000055CD 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 30594 000055CF 4E                      	DEC	SI
 30595                                  scanb_retn:
 30596 000055D0 C3                      	retn
 30597                                  
 30598                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30599                                  ;
 30600                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 30601                                  ;
 30602                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 30603                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 30604                                  ;
 30605                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 30606                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 30607                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 30608                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 30609                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 30610                                  ;
 30611                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30612                                  
 30613                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30614                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30615                                  NameTrans:
 30616                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30617 000055D1 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 30618 000055D7 16                      	push	ss
 30619 000055D8 07                      	pop	es
 30620                                  
 30621                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 30622 000055D9 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 30623 000055DC 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30624 000055DD B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 30625 000055E0 B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 30626 000055E3 AA                      	STOSB
 30627 000055E4 F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 30628 000055E6 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 30629 000055E8 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 30630 000055EA AA                      	STOSB
 30631 000055EB 5F                      	POP	DI
 30632                                  
 30633 000055EC E880FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 30634                                  
 30635                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 30636 000055EF 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 30637 000055F5 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 30638 000055F7 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 30639 000055FD C3                      	retn

 30641                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 30642                                  ;============================================================================
 30643                                  
 30644                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30645                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30646                                  
 30647                                  ;If TableLook
 30648                                  
 30649                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 30650                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 30651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30652                                  
 30653                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 30654                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 30655                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 30656                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 30657                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 30658                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 30659                                  
 30660                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 30661                                  ;CharType:
 30662                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30663                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 30664                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30665                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 30666                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30667                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 30668                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30669                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 30670                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30671                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 30672                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30673                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 30674                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30675                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 30676                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30677                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 30678                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30679                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 30680                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30681                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 30682                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30683                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 30684                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30685                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 30686                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30687                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 30688                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30689                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30691                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 30692                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30693                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 30694                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 30695                                  ;	      ; # and "
 30696                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 30697                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 30698                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 30699                                  ;	      ; + and *
 30700                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 30701                                  ;	      ; - and '
 30702                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 30703                                  ;	      ; / and .
 30704                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30705                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 30706                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 30707                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 30708                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 30709                                  ;	      ; = and <
 30710                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 30711                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 30712                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 30713                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 30714                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 30715                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 30716                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 30717                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 30718                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 30719                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 30720                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 30721                                  ;	      ; } and |
 30722                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 30723                                  
 30724                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 30725                                  ;					; character in the table
 30726                                  
 30727                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 30728                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 30729                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 30730                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 30731                                  
 30732                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 30794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30795                                  ;
 30796                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 30797                                  ;
 30798                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 30799                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 30800                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 30801                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 30802                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 30803                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 30804                                  ;
 30805                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 30806                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 30807                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 30808                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 30809                                  ;
 30810                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 30811                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 30812                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 30813                                  ;
 30814                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30815                                  
 30816                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 30817                                  
 30818                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 30819                                  GETLET:	
 30820 0000563D AC                      	LODSB
 30821                                  
 30822                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 30823                                  
 30824                                  	;entry	UCase
 30825                                  UCase:	
 30826                                  	; 09/08/2018
 30827                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 30828                                  _UCase:
 30829 0000563E 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30830 0000563F BB[850B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 30831                                  
 30832                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 30833                                  
 30834                                  gl_0:
 30835 00005642 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 30836 00005644 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 30837 00005646 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 30838 00005648 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 30839 0000564A 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 30840                                  
 30841                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 30842                                  
 30843                                  gl_1:
 30844 0000564C 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 30845 0000564E 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 30846 00005650 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 30847                                  
 30848                                  	; M048 - Start 
 30849                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 30850                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 30851                                  	; preserve it.
 30852                                  
 30853                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30854                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30855                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 30856                                  	;CS	XLAT
 30857                                  
 30858                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30859                                  
 30860                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30861 00005652 1E                      	push	ds
 30862                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 30863 00005653 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 30864 00005658 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 30865 00005659 1F                      	pop	ds
 30866                                  
 30867                                  	; M048 - End
 30868                                  
 30869                                  ; Now check the type
 30870                                  
 30871                                  ;If TableLook
 30872                                  gl_2:
 30873                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30874 0000565A 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30875                                  
 30876                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30877                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 30878                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 30879                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 30880                                  	;cs	xlat	
 30881                                  	
 30882                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30883 0000565B E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 30884                                  	
 30885                                  	;test	al,1	
 30886 0000565E A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 30887 00005660 58                      	POP	AX
 30888                                  
 30889 00005661 5B                      	POP	BX
 30890 00005662 C3                      	RETN
 30891                                  
 30892                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 30893                                  
 30894                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30895                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 30896                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 30897 00005663 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30898 00005664 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 30899                                  ;ELSE
 30900                                  ;
 30901                                  ;gl_2:
 30902                                  ;	POP	BX
 30903                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 30904                                  ;	retz
 30905                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 30906                                  ;	retz
 30907                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 30908                                  ;	retz
 30909                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 30910                                  ;	retz
 30911                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 30912                                  ;	retz
 30913                                  ;ENDIF
 30914                                  
 30915                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30916                                  ;

 30918                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 30919                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 30920                                  ;	Uses  : Flags

 30923

 31003                                  
 31004                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31005                                  ;
 31006                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 31007                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 31008                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 31009                                  ;
 31010                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 31011                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 31012                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 31013                                  ;
 31014                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31015                                  
 31016                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31017                                  
 31018                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31019                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31020                                  GetCharType:
 31021                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 31022 00005676 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 31023 00005678 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 31024                                  
 31025 0000567A 53                      	push	bx
 31026 0000567B BB[FE55]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 31027 0000567E D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 31028                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 31029 00005680 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 31030 00005682 5B                      	pop	bx
 31031                                  
 31032                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 31033                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 31034                                  
 31035 00005683 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 31036                                  
 31037 00005685 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 31038 00005687 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 31039 00005689 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 31040 0000568B D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 31041                                  gct_80:
 31042 0000568D 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 31043 0000568F C3                      	retn
 31044                                  gct_90:
 31045 00005690 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 31046 00005692 C3                      	retn
 31047

 31056 00005695 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 31057 00005697 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 31058 00005699 C3                      	retn
 31059                                  GotFor:
 31060 0000569A B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 31061 0000569C C3                      	retn
 31062                                  PathRet:
 31063 0000569D 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 31064 0000569F C3                      	retn

 31076                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 31077                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 31078                                  
 31079                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 31080                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 31081                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.

 31083                                  ;	FATAL

 31085                                  ;	reset_environment
 31086                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK

 31091                                  ;	CHARHARD
 31092                                  ;	HardErr
 31093                                  ;
 31094                                  ;	Revision history:
 31095                                  ;
 31096                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 31097                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 31098                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 31099                                  ;
 31100                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 31101                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 31102                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 31103                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 31104                                  ;
 31105                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 31106                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 31107                                  ;	      charhard.

 31452                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31453                                  ;
 31454                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 31455                                  ;
 31456                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 31457                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 31458                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 31459                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 31460                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 31461                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 31462                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 31463                                  ; is simulated.
 31464                                  ;
 31465                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31466                                  
 31467                                  CNTCHAND:
 31468                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 31469                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 31470                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 31471                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 31472                                  
 31473                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31474                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 31475 000057EA 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 31476 000057F0 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 31477                                  
 31478 000057F2 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 31479 000057F4 E8EAC4                          CALL	BUFOUT
 31480 000057F7 E885C3                          CALL	CRLF
 31481                                  around_deadlock:
 31482 000057FA 16                              PUSH    SS
 31483 000057FB 1F                              POP     DS
 31484 000057FC 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 31485 00005801 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 31486 00005803 E8B3E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 31487                                  NOSWAP:
 31488 00005806 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 31489 00005807 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 31490 0000580B 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 31491 0000580F E82FAC                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 31492                                  
 31493                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 31494                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 31495                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 31496                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 31497                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 31498                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 31499                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 31500                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 31501                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 31502                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 31503                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 31504                                  			; else
 31505                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 31506                                  
 31507                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31508                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 31509                                  
 31510                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 31511                                  	
 31512 00005812 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 31513                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 31514 00005813 1E                      	push	ds
 31515                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 31516 00005814 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 31517 00005819 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 31518 0000581E C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 31519 00005823 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 31520                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 31521 00005827 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 31522                                  
 31523 0000582C 803E[870D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 31524 00005831 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 31525 00005832 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 31526 00005834 F8                      	CLC				
 31527 00005835 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 31528 00005837 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 31529                                  
 31530                                  	; 05/05/2019
 31531                                  do_low_int23:
 31532 00005839 F8                      	clc
 31533 0000583A 2EFF1E[A056]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 31534                                  
 31535                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 31536                                  
 31537                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 31538                                  
 31539                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 31540                                  ;
 31541                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 31542                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 31543                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 31544                                  ;
 31545                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 31546                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 31547                                  
 31548                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 31549                                  
 31550 0000583F FA                      	CLI
 31551                                  
 31552                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 31553                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 31554                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 31555                                  	;POP	AX
 31556                                  
 31557                                  	; 05/05/2019
 31558                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31559                                  
 31560                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 31561

 31563 00005841 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 31564                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 31565 00005843 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 31566 00005848 A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 31567 0000584B 58                      	pop	ax
 31568 0000584C A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 31569 0000584F 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 31570 00005850 58                      	pop	ax
 31571                                  
 31572                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 31573                                  
 31574                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31575                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 31576                                  	;JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 31577                                  
 31578                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 31580 00005855 750A                    	JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 31581                                  
 31582                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 31583                                  
 31584                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 31585                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31586                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 31587                                  	; 05/05/2019

 31590 0000585A 8E1E[840D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 31591                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 31592                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 31593                                  COMMANDJ:
 31594 0000585E E990AA                  	JMP	COMMAND
 31595                                  
 31596                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 31597                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 31598                                  
 31599                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 31600 00005861 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 31601                                  	;;test	ax,1
 31602                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 31603 00005864 A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 31604 00005866 74EF                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 31605                                  
 31606                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31607 00005868 8E1E[840D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 31608                                  
 31609                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 31610                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 31611                                  
 31612                                  ctrlc_abort:
 31613                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31614                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0

 31622                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 31624 0000586F 1E                      	push	ds

 31699                                  ;

 31807                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 31808                                  ;
 31809                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 31810                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 31811                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 31812                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 31813                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code

 31998

 32000                                  
 32001 000059E6 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 32002 000059E8 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore

 32023                                  CleanUp:

 32032 00005A15 1E                      	push	ds

 32043

 32051

 32061                                  DoAbort:

 32064

 32067 00005A44 E872DE                  	call	SWAPBACK
 32068                                  NOSWAP2:
 32069                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 32070                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 32071                                  
 32072                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 32073                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 32074

 32077
