 32079                                  
 32080 00005A4E C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 32081 00005A53 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 32082                                  
 32083                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 32084                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 32085                                  
 32086 00005A55 E9B30D                  	jmp	exit_inner
 32087                                  
 32088                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32089                                  ;
 32090                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 32091                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 32092                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 32093                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 32094                                  ;
 32095                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 32096                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 32097                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 32098                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 32099                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 32100                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 32101                                  ;
 32102                                  ; output:   none.
 32103                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32104                                  
 32105                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 32106                                  	
 32107                                  reset_environment:
 32108                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32109                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 32110                                  
 32111                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 32112                                  
 32113 00005A58 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 32114                                  
 32115                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 32116                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 32117                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 32118                                  
 32119 00005A59 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 32120                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 32121                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 32122 00005A5B CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 32123                                  
 32124                                  					; SS override
 32125 00005A5D 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 32126                                  
 32127                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 32128                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 32129                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 32130                                  					; On process exit.
 32131 00005A63 B82211                  	mov     ax, 1122h
 32132 00005A66 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 32133                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 32134                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 32135 00005A68 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 32136 00005A6A E814B5                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 32137                                  
 32138 00005A6D 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 32139 00005A6E 06                      	push	es
 32140 00005A6F 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 32141                                  
 32142 00005A70 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 32143 00005A75 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 32144 00005A77 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 32145                                  
 32146                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 32147                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper 
 32148                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 32149                                  	
 32150 00005A7A 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 32151 00005A7C 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 32152 00005A7E 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 32153 00005A80 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 32154 00005A82 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 32155                                  
 32156                                  					; SS override
 32157                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 32158 00005A83 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 32159 00005A89 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 32160                                  
 32161                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks 
 32162                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 32163                                  
 32164                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 32165 00005A8B E8B50D                  	call	arena_free_process
 32166                                  
 32167                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal 
 32168                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that 
 32169                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 32170                                  
 32171                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 32172 00005A8E E82FDA                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 32173                                  
 32174                                  reset_to_parent:
 32175                                  					; SS override
 32176 00005A91 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 32177                                  
 32178                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 32179                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA  
 32180 00005A96 16                      	push	ss
 32181 00005A97 1F                      	pop	ds	
 32182                                  
 32183 00005A98 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 32184                                  
 32185                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors, 
 32186                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 32187                                  
 32188                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 32189 00005A9A E866BE                  	call	ECritDisk
 32190                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 32191 00005A9D E8D305                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 32192                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 32193 00005AA0 E88DBE                  	call	LCritDisk
 32194                                  
 32195                                  	; Decrement open ref. count if we had done a virtual open earlier.
 32196                                  
 32197 00005AA3 E883F7                  	call	CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 32198 00005AA6 FA                      	CLI
 32199 00005AA7 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 32200 00005AAC C606[2203]FF            	MOV	BYTE [WPERR],-1		; Forget about WP error
 32201 00005AB1 C606[5903]00            	MOV	byte [fAborting],0	; let aborts occur
 32202 00005AB6 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]
 32203 00005ABA 8F06[8205]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD+2]
 32204                                  
 32205                                  	; Snake into multitasking... Get stack from CurrentPDB person
 32206                                  
 32207 00005ABE 8E1E[3003]              	MOV	DS,[CurrentPDB]
 32208 00005AC2 8E163000                	MOV	SS,[PDB.USER_STACK+2]
 32209 00005AC6 8B262E00                	MOV	SP,[PDB.USER_STACK]
 32210                                  
 32211 00005ACA E874A9                  	call	restore_world
 32212                                  
 32213                                  	; 05/05/2019
 32214 00005ACD 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 32215                                  
 32216                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32217 00005ACE 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG 
 32218 00005ACF 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.
 32219                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 32220 00005AD1 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg] 
 32221 00005AD6 A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 32222 00005AD9 58                      	pop	ax
 32223                                  					; set up ds to DOSDATA
 32224                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_SP],AX ; MSDOS 3.3
 32225 00005ADA A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],ax
 32226                                  
 32227 00005ADD 58                      	POP	AX			; suck off CS:IP of interrupt...
 32228 00005ADE 58                      	POP	AX
 32229 00005ADF 58                      	POP	AX
 32230                                  
 32231                                  ; M011 : BEGIN
 32232                                  
 32233                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32234                                  ;	MOV	AX,0F202h	; STI
 32235                                  
 32236                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32237 00005AE0 9F                      	LAHF
 32238 00005AE1 86E0                    	XCHG	AH,AL
 32239 00005AE3 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 32240 00005AE5 B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h
 32241                                  
 32242                                  ; M011 : END
 32243                                  
 32244                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32245 00005AE7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32246                                   
 32247                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD+2]
 32248                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 32249                                  	
 32250                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32251 00005AE8 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]
 32252 00005AEC FF36[8005]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD]
 32253                                  
 32254                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_SP]
 32255                                  
 32256                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32257 00005AF0 A1[8405]                	MOV	AX,[USER_SP]
 32258 00005AF3 8E1E[840D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]	; restore ds
 32259                                  
 32260 00005AF7 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 32261                                  
 32262                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32263                                  ;
 32264                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 32265                                  ;
 32266                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 32267                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 32268                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 32269                                  ;
 32270                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32271                                  
 32272                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 32273 00005AF8 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32274                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 32275 00005AF9 B8[020F]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 32276 00005AFC 2D[F20E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 32277                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 32278                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 32279                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32280                                  	
 32281                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32282 00005AFF 1E                      	push	ds
 32283                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 32284 00005B00 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 32285                                  
 32286                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 32287                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 32288                                  
 32289 00005B05 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 32290 00005B07 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 32291 00005B09 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 32292                                  
 32293                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 32294 00005B0B 8A85[F20E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32295 00005B0F 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 32296                                  NoTrans:
 32297                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 32298 00005B11 A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 32299 00005B14 1F                      	pop	ds
 32300                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 32301 00005B15 58                      	POP	AX
 32302                                  
 32303                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct 
 32304                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 32305                                  
 32306 00005B16 56                      	PUSH	SI
 32307                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 32308 00005B17 BE[A20E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 32309 00005B1A E896AB                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 32310 00005B1D 5E                      	POP	SI
 32311 00005B1E C3                      	retn
 32312                                  
 32313                                  ;============================================================================
 32314                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 32315                                  ;============================================================================
 32316                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32317                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32318                                  
 32319                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 32320                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 32321                                  
 32322                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 32323                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32324                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 32325                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 32326                                  ;
 32327                                  ;	IsEof
 32328                                  ;	UNPACK
 32329                                  ;	PACK
 32330                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 32331                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 32332                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 32333                                  ;	FAT_operation
 32334                                  ;
 32335                                  ;	Revision history:
 32336                                  ;
 32337                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 32338                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 32339                                  ;
 32340                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 32341                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 32342                                  
 32343                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32344                                  
 32345                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 32346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32347                                  ;
 32348                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 32349                                  ;
 32350                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 32351                                  ;
 32352                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 32353                                  ;		BX has fat value
 32354                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 32355                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 32356                                  ;
 32357                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32358                                  
 32359                                  IsEOF:
 32360                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 32361 00005B1F 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 32362 00005B25 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 32363                                  
 32364                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 32365                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 32366                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 32367                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 32368                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 32369                                  
 32370 00005B27 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 32371 00005B2B 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 32372                                  
 32373 00005B2D 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 32374                                  IsEOF_other:
 32375 00005B31 C3                      	retn
 32376                                  EOF16:
 32377 00005B32 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 32378 00005B35 C3                      	retn
 32379                                  
 32380                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32381                                  
 32382                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 32383                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32384                                  ;
 32385                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 32386                                  ;
 32387                                  ; Inputs:
 32388                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 32389                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32390                                  ; Outputs:
 32391                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 32392                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 32393                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32394                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 32395                                  ;
 32396                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 32397                                  ;
 32398                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32399                                  	
 32400                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32401                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32402                                  
 32403                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32404                                  UNPACK:
 32405                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 32406 00005B36 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 32407 00005B38 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 32408 00005B3A 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 32409 00005B3E 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 32410 00005B40 C3                      	retn				; done
 32411                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 32412                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 32413                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 32414 00005B41 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 32415 00005B45 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 32416 00005B47 E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 32417 00005B4A 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 32418 00005B4C 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 32419 00005B4E 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 32420 00005B50 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 32421 00005B54 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 32422 00005B58 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 32423 00005B5A 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 32424 00005B5C EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 32425                                  High12:
 32426 00005B5E D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 32427 00005B60 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 32428 00005B62 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 32429 00005B64 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 32430                                  Unpack12:
 32431 00005B66 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 32432                                  _DoContext:
 32433 00005B6A 16                      	PUSH	SS
 32434 00005B6B 1F                      	POP	DS
 32435 00005B6C C3                      	retn
 32436                                  HURTFAT:
 32437                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 32438                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 32439 00005B6D 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 32440 00005B73 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32441 00005B74 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 32442                                  
 32443                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32444 00005B76 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 32445                                  ;
 32446                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 32447                                  ;
 32448 00005B7C BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 32449 00005B7F E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 32450 00005B82 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 32451 00005B84 F8                      	CLC
 32452 00005B85 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 32453 00005B87 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 32454                                  OKU_RET:
 32455 00005B88 58                      	POP	AX
 32456                                  hurtfat_retn:
 32457 00005B89 C3                      	retn
 32458                                  
 32459                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32460                                  
 32461                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 32462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32463                                  ;
 32464                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 32465                                  ;
 32466                                  ; Inputs:
 32467                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 32468                                  ;	DX = Data
 32469                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 32470                                  ; Outputs:
 32471                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 32472                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 32473                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32474                                  ;	No other registers affected
 32475                                  ;
 32476                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 32477                                  ;
 32478                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32479                                  
 32480                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32481                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32482                                  PACK:
 32483                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 32484 00005B8A 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 32485 00005B8C 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 32486 00005B8E 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 32487 00005B92 C3                      	retn				; done
 32488                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 32489                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 32490 00005B93 E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 32491 00005B96 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 32492 00005B98 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 32493 00005B9A 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 32494 00005B9C 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 32495 00005B9D B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 32496 00005B9F D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 32497 00005BA1 59                      	POP	CX
 32498 00005BA2 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 32499 00005BA5 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 32500                                  ALIGNED:
 32501                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 32502 00005BA7 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 32503 00005BAD 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 32504 00005BAF 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 32505 00005BB3 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 32506 00005BB7 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 32507                                  Pack16:
 32508 00005BB9 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 32509                                  PACKIN:
 32510 00005BBB 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 32511 00005BBD 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 32512                                  
 32513                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32514 00005BBF 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 32515                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32516 00005BC4 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32517                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 32518 00005BC8 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 32519                                  	; 10/06/2019
 32520 00005BCA E8AB05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 32521                                  	
 32522                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 32523 00005BCD 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32524                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 32525                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32526 00005BD1 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 32527                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32528 00005BD7 16                      	push	ss
 32529 00005BD8 1F                      	pop	ds
 32530 00005BD9 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 32531 00005BDB 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32532 00005BDC 53                      	PUSH	BX
 32533 00005BDD 51                      	PUSH	CX
 32534 00005BDE A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 32535 00005BE1 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 32536                                  	;;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 32537                                  	;;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32538                                  	; 02/01/2024
 32539                                  	;add	si,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 
 32540 00005BE5 83C618                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 32541 00005BE8 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 32542                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32543                                  	;Context DS
 32544 00005BEA 16                      	push	ss
 32545 00005BEB 1F                      	pop	ds
 32546                                  	
 32547 00005BEC 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32548                                  	
 32549                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32550 00005BED 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 32551 00005BF1 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 32552                                  
 32553                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 32554 00005BF5 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 32555                                  
 32556                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *
 32557                                  	;XOR	AL,AL     ; *
 32558                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB ; *
 32559                                  	; 22/09/2023
 32560 00005BF9 E86C03                  	call	GETBUFFRA ; *
 32561                                  
 32562 00005BFC 58                      	POP	AX
 32563 00005BFD 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 32564 00005BFF C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 32565                                  	
 32566                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32567 00005C03 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 32568                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 32569 00005C07 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 32570 00005C09 E86C05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 32571                                  	
 32572                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 32573 00005C0C 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 32574                                  yesdirty12:
 32575                                  	;;;add	di,16
 32576                                  	;;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32577                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 32578                                  	;DEC	DI
 32579                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 32580                                  	;add	di,23 ; PCDOS 7.1
 32581 00005C10 83C717                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 23 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 32582                                  	
 32583                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 32584 00005C13 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 32585 00005C17 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 32586 00005C19 F8                      	CLC
 32587                                  POPP_RET:
 32588 00005C1A 16                      	PUSH	SS
 32589 00005C1B 1F                      	POP	DS
 32590 00005C1C 59                      	POP	CX
 32591 00005C1D 5B                      	POP	BX
 32592 00005C1E 58                      	POP	AX
 32593 00005C1F C3                      	retn
 32594                                  
 32595                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32596                                  
 32597                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 32598                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32599                                  ;
 32600                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 32601                                  ;
 32602                                  ; Inputs:
 32603                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 32604                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 32605                                  ; Function:
 32606                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 32607                                  ; Outputs:
 32608                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 32609                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 32610                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 32611                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 32612                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 32613                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 32614                                  ;
 32615                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32616                                  
 32617                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32618                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32619                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32620                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32621                                  
 32622                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 32623                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 32624 00005C20 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 32625                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 32626 00005C25 50                      	push	ax
 32627 00005C26 53                      	push	bx
 32628 00005C27 51                      	push	cx
 32629 00005C28 52                      	push	dx
 32630 00005C29 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 32631 00005C2B 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 32632 00005C31 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 32633 00005C33 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 32634                                  Map16:	
 32635                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 32636 00005C35 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 32637                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32638 00005C37 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 32639 00005C39 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 32640 00005C3B 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 32641                                  
 32642                                  ;IF FastDiv
 32643                                  ;
 32644                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 32645                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 32646                                  ;
 32647                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 32648                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 32649                                  ;
 32650                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 32651                                  
 32652 00005C3F 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 32653 00005C43 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 32654 00005C45 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 32655 00005C47 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 32656 00005C4B 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 32657                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 32658                                  	;shr	al,1	
 32659                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 32660 00005C4D D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 32661 00005C4F D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 32662                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32663 00005C51 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 32664 00005C53 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 32665                                  _DoDiv:
 32666                                  ;ENDIF
 32667                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32668                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 32669                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32670 00005C55 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 32671                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 32672 00005C57 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 32673                                  ;IF FastDiv
 32674                                  DivDone:
 32675                                  ;ENDIF
 32676                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 32677 00005C59 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 32678 00005C5D 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 32679                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 32680 00005C5E 50                      	push	ax
 32681 00005C5F 52                      	push	dx
 32682 00005C60 51                      	push	cx
 32683 00005C61 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 32684                                  
 32685                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32686                                  	; 22/09/2023
 32687                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 32688                                  	;
 32689                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32690                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 32691                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 32692                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 32693                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 32694                                  	; 22/09/2023
 32695 00005C63 E8FC02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 32696                                  
 32697                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 32698 00005C66 59                      	pop	cx
 32699 00005C67 58                      	pop	ax
 32700 00005C68 5A                      	pop	dx
 32701 00005C69 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 32702                                  
 32703 00005C6B C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 32704                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 32705                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32706 00005C6F 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 32707 00005C72 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 32708 00005C74 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 32709 00005C76 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 32710 00005C78 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 32711                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32712 00005C7A 16                      	push	ss
 32713 00005C7B 1F                      	pop	ds	
 32714 00005C7C FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 32715 00005C80 A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 32716 00005C83 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 32717                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32718 00005C87 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 32719 00005C8D 42                      	INC	DX
 32720                                  
 32721                                  	; 22/09/2023
 32722                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 32723                                  	;
 32724                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32725                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 32726                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 32727                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 32728                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 32729                                  	; 22/09/2023
 32730 00005C8E E8D102                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 32731 00005C91 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 32732                                  
 32733 00005C93 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 32734 00005C97 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 32735 00005C9A 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 32736                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32737 00005C9C 16                      	push	ss
 32738 00005C9D 1F                      	pop	ds
 32739 00005C9E A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 32740                                  
 32741                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 32742 00005CA1 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 32743                                  MAPRET:
 32744                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 32745 00005CA4 5A                      	pop	dx
 32746 00005CA5 59                      	pop	cx
 32747 00005CA6 5B                      	pop	bx
 32748 00005CA7 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 32749 00005CA9 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 32750 00005CAF 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 32751 00005CB1 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 32752                                  MapSet:
 32753 00005CB3 A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 32754                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 32755 00005CB5 58                      	pop	ax
 32756 00005CB6 C3                      	retn
 32757                                  
 32758                                  MAP_POP:
 32759                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 32760 00005CB7 5A                      	pop	dx
 32761 00005CB8 59                      	pop	cx
 32762 00005CB9 5B                      	pop	bx
 32763 00005CBA 58                      	pop	ax
 32764                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 32765 00005CBB C3                      	retn
 32766                                  
 32767                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32768                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32769                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32770                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32771                                  
 32772                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 32773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32774                                  ;
 32775                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 32776                                  ;
 32777                                  ; Inputs:
 32778                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 32779                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 32780                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 32781                                  ; Function:
 32782                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 32783                                  ;	if disk changed.
 32784                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 32785                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 32786                                  ; Outputs:
 32787                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32788                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 32789                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 32790                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 32791                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 32792                                  ;
 32793                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32794                                  
 32795                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 32796 00005CBC 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 32797                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32798                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 32799                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32800 00005CC0 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 32801 00005CC4 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 32802 00005CC7 E89DA9                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 32803                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 32804                                  	; 17/12/2022
 32805 00005CCA E99F00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 32806                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 32807                                  	;retn
 32808                                  
 32809                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32810                                  ;
 32811                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 32812                                  ;
 32813                                  ; Inputs:
 32814                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 32815                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 32816                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 32817                                  ; Function:
 32818                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 32819                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 32820                                  ; Outputs:
 32821                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 32822                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 32823                                  ;	THISDRV set
 32824                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32825                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 32826                                  ;
 32827                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32828                                  
 32829                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32830                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32831                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32832                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32833                                  
 32834                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 32835 00005CCD 06                      	PUSH	ES
 32836 00005CCE 57                      	PUSH	DI
 32837                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 32838 00005CCF 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 32839                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32840                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 32841                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32842 00005CD3 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 32843 00005CD7 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 32844 00005CDA E88AA9                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 32845 00005CDD E88C00                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 32846 00005CE0 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 32847 00005CE1 07                      	POP	ES
 32848 00005CE2 72D7                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 32849 00005CE4 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 32850                                  
 32851                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 32852                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 32853                                  
 32854                                  MED_CHANGE:
 32855 00005CE6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 32856 00005CE8 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 32857 00005CE9 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 32858 00005CEA 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 32859 00005CEE 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 32860                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 32861 00005CF0 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 32862                                  
 32863                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32864                                  
 32865                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 32866                                  ;
 32867                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 32868                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 32869                                  
 32870 00005CF4 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 32871                                  frcd20: 
 32872                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 32873                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 32874 00005CF9 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 32875 00005CFE 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 32876                                  
 32877                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32878                                  	;push	es
 32879                                  	;push	di
 32880                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 32881                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 32882                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 32883                                  	;pop	di
 32884                                  	;pop	es
 32885                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 32886                                  
 32887                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32888 00005D00 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 32889 00005D04 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 32890 00005D06 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 32891 00005D08 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 32892 00005D0C 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 32893                                  
 32894                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32895                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 32896 00005D0E 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 32897 00005D12 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 32898                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 32899 00005D14 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 32900                                  frcd25:	
 32901                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 32902                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 32903 00005D18 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 32904 00005D1B E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 32905 00005D1D 1F                      	POP	DS
 32906                                  NO_CHANGE:
 32907 00005D1E C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 32908 00005D22 F8                      	CLC
 32909 00005D23 C3                      	retn
 32910                                  
 32911                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32912                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 32913                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 32914                                  ;;;
 32915                                  chk_set_first_access:
 32916 00005D24 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0	; DPB.FATSIZE
 32917 00005D29 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 32918                                  					; FAT32
 32919 00005D2B 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT_HW
 32920 00005D30 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 32921 00005D36 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 32922                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 32923 00005D38 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT
 32924                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 32925 00005D3D 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 32926 00005D43 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 32927 00005D45 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+18h],1	; DPB.FIRST_ACCESS
 32928                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 32929 00005D4A C3                      	retn
 32930                                  ;;;

 32937                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation

 32941                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32942                                  
 32943                                  FAT_operation:
 32944                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32945                                  FATERR:
 32946                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 32947                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32948 00005D4B 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 32949                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 32950                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 32951 00005D51 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 32952                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 32953 00005D55 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 32954                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 32955 00005D5A B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 32956 00005D5C A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 32957 00005D5F E8ECFB                  	call	FATAL1
 32958 00005D62 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 32959 00005D66 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 32960 00005D68 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 32961 00005D6A F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 32962 00005D6B C3                      	retn
 32963                                  
 32964                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 32965                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32966 00005D6C 16                      	push	ss
 32967 00005D6D 1F                      	pop	ds
 32968                                  	;mov	al,0Fh
 32969 00005D6E B00F                    	MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 32970                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 32971 00005D70 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 32972 00005D74 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 32973 00005D77 C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 32974 00005D7C C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 32975                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 32976                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32977 00005D82 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 32978 00005D86 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 32979 00005D89 06                      	PUSH	ES
 32980 00005D8A 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 32981                                  
 32982                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 32983 00005D8B BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 32984                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 32985                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32986 00005D8E 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 32987 00005D92 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 32988 00005D93 E8D3EE                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 32989                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 32990 00005D96 16                      	push	ss
 32991 00005D97 1F                      	pop	ds
 32992 00005D98 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 32993 00005D99 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 32994                                  	;test	di,8000h
 32995                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 32996 00005D9D 09FF                    	or	di,di
 32997 00005D9F 78AA                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 32998 00005DA1 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 32999                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 33000                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 33001 00005DA3 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 33002 00005DA7 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 33003                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 33004 00005DAA 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 33005 00005DAE 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 33006 00005DB0 C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1
 33007 00005DB5 E9A500                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 33008                                  					; new volume label.
 33009                                  CHECK_BYT:
 33010 00005DB8 0A26[6803]              	OR	AH,[CALLRBYT]
 33011                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 33012                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 33013                                  	; 17/12/2022
 33014 00005DBC 7863                    	js	short NEWDSK
 33015                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33016                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 33017                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 33018                                  
 33019                                  CHECK_ZR:
 33020 00005DBE 743B                    	JZ	short CHKBUFFDIRT	; jump if I don't know
 33021                                  	; 24/09/2023
 33022                                  	; cf=0 (after 'or' instruction)
 33023                                  	;CLC
 33024 00005DC0 C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 33025                                  
 33026                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:
 33027 00005DC1 06                      	PUSH	ES
 33028 00005DC2 55                      	PUSH	BP
 33029                                  	;;les	bp,[es:bp+12h]
 33030                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 33031 00005DC3 26C46E13                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Get device pointer
 33032                                  	;;test	word [es:bp+4],800h
 33033                                  	;TEST	word [ES:BP+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVOPCL ; Did it set vol id?
 33034 00005DC7 26F6460508              	test	byte [es:bp+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVOPCL>>8)
 33035 00005DCC 5D                      	POP	BP
 33036 00005DCD 07                      	POP	ES
 33037 00005DCE 7426                    	JZ	short FAIL_OPJ2		; Nope, FAIL
 33038 00005DD0 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save buffer pointer for ignore
 33039 00005DD1 57                      	PUSH	DI
 33040 00005DD2 16                      	push	ss			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 33041 00005DD3 1F                      	pop	ds
 33042                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 33043 00005DD4 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 33044 00005DD9 06                      	PUSH	ES
 33045 00005DDA C43E[6903]              	LES	DI,[CALLVIDM]		; Get volume ID pointer
 33046 00005DDE 8C06[2A03]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT+2],ES

 33309                                  ;SETVISIT:
 33310                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33311                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 33312                                  ;; Inputs:
 33313                                  ;;      None
 33314                                  ;; Function:
 33315                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 33316                                  ;; Outputs:
 33317                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 33318                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 33319                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 33320                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 33321                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 33322                                  ;; No other registers altered
 33323                                  ;
 33324                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 33325                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 33326                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 33327                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 33328                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 33329                                  ;SETLOOP:
 33330                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 33331                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 33332                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 33333                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 33334                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 33335                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 33336                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 33337                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 33338                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 33339                                  ;       RETN
 33340                                  ;
 33341                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 33342                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33343                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 33344                                  ;
 33345                                  ;; Inputs:
 33346                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 33347                                  ;; Function:
 33348                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 33349                                  ;; Outputs:
 33350                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 33351                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 33352                                  ;; No other registers altered
 33353                                  ;
 33354                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 33355                                  ;       ;retz
 33356                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 33357                                  ;
 33358                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 33359                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 33360                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 33361                                  ;
 33362                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 33363                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 33364                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 33365                                  ;	
 33366                                  ;	push	ax
 33367                                  ;	or	al,1
 33368                                  ;	pop	ax
 33369                                  ;	retn	
 33370                                  ;
 33371                                  ;SKIPLOOP:

 33373                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT

 33398                                  ;
 33399                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 33400                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 33401                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 33402                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 33403                                  
 33404                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 33405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33406                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 33407                                  ; Inputs:
 33408                                  ;	 No Inputs
 33409                                  ; Function:
 33410                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 33411                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 33412                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 33413                                  ; Outputs:
 33414                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 33415                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 33416                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 33417                                  ; No other registers altered
 33418                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33419                                  
 33420                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33421                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33422                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33423                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33424                                  
 33425                                  GETCURHEAD:
 33426 00005EFD 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 33427 00005F02 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 33428 00005F09 36893E[A512]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 33429 00005F0E C3                      	retn
 33430                                  
 33431                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 33432                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33433                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 33434                                  ; Inputs:
 33435                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 33436                                  ; Function:
 33437                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 33438                                  ; Outputs:
 33439                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 33440                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 33441                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33442                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 33443                                  
 33444                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 33445                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33446                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 33447                                  ;	push	es
 33448                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 33449                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 33450                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 33451                                  ;	push	es
 33452                                  ;	pop	ds
 33453                                  ;	mov	di,si
 33454                                  ;	pop	es
 33455                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 33456                                  ;	retn	
 33457                                  	
 33458                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33459                                  SCANPLACE:
 33460 00005F0F FF35                    	push	word [di]
 33461                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 33462 00005F11 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 33463 00005F14 5F                      	pop	di
 33464 00005F15 C3                      	retn
 33465                                  
 33466                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33467                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 33468                                  ; Input:
 33469                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 33470                                  ; Function:
 33471                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 33472                                  ; NO registers altered
 33473                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33474                                  
 33475                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 33476                                  
 33477                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33478                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33479                                  PLACEBUF:
 33480                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33481                                  
 33482                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33483 00005F16 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 33484 00005F17 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 33485                                  	; 23/09/2023
 33486                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 33487                                  	
 33488 00005F18 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 33489                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 33490 00005F1A 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 33491                                  	
 33492 00005F1F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 33493 00005F21 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 33494 00005F23 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 33495 00005F25 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 33496 00005F27 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 33497 00005F2B EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 33498                                  not_first:
 33499                                  	; 23/09/2023
 33500 00005F2D 56                      	push	si
 33501                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 33502 00005F2E 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 33503 00005F31 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 33504                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 33505 00005F33 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 33506                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 33507 00005F34 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 33508                                  	
 33509 00005F37 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 33510 00005F3A 893C                    	mov	[si],di

 33657                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 33658                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33659                                  ;
 33660                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 33661                                  ; Inputs:
 33662                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 33663                                  ; Function:
 33664                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 33665                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 33666                                  ;	   same segment
 33667                                  ;
 33668                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 33669                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 33670                                  ; No Registers altered
 33671                                  ;
 33672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33673                                  
 33674                                  POINTCOMP:
 33675                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33676                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
