 33693                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 33694                                  
 33695                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 33696                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33697                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 33698                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 33699                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 33700                                  ; 
 33701                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 33702                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 33703                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 33704                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 33705                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 33706                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 33707                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 33708                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 33709                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 33710                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 33711                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 33712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33713                                  
 33714                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 33715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33716                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 33717                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 33718                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 33719                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 33720                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 33721                                  ; 
 33722                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 33723                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 33724                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 33725                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 33726                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 33727                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 33728                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 33729                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 33730                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 33731                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 33732                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 33733                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 33734                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33735                                  
 33736                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 33978                                  ;	Setup the various buffer fields
 33979                                  ;
 33980                                  ;	(ds:di) = buffer address
 33981                                  ;	(es:bp) = DPB address
 33982                                  ;	(HIGH_SECTOR:DX) = sector #
 33983                                  ;	(ah) = BUF_FLAGS value

 33986                                  ;hkn; SS override
 33987                                  getb20:	; MSDOS 6.0

 34000                                  	; 15/12/2022

 34002                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 34003                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 34005                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 34006 0000603D 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX		; Set ID and Flags
 34007                                  getb25:	
 34008                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34009                                  	;mov     ax,1
 34010

 34012                                  	;mov	byte [di+0Ah],1

 34018 00006048 740B                    	JZ	short getb30

 34022

 34027                                  						;  sectors
 34028                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34029                                  	;;mov	ah,[es:bp+0Fh]
 34030                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 34031

 34033                                  ;		is set
 34034

 34037                                  	;mov	[di+0Bh],ax
 34038 00006055 89450B                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc],AX

 34047                                  getb35: 
 34048                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34049                                  	; 07/12/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34050                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 5.0 & MSDOS 6.0

 34053                                  	;MOV	[SS:CURBUF],DI
 34054                                  	;MOV	[SS:LastBuffer],DI
 34055                                  	;CLC
 34056

 34079                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>
 34080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34081                                  ; Input:
 34082                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 34083                                  ;	AL = Physical unit number local buffers only
 34084                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers
 34085                                  ; Function:
 34086                                  ;	Write out all dirty buffers for unit, and flag them as clean
 34087                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 34088                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.
 34089                                  ; DS Preserved, all others destroyed (ES too)
 34090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34091                                  
 34092                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34093                                  	; DOSCODE:9A35h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34094                                  
 34095                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34096                                  	; DOSCODE:99DAh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34097                                  FLUSHBUF:
 34098                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34099                                  	;;mov	ah,-1 ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34100                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 34101                                  
 34102                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34103 00006073 E887FE                  	call	GETCURHEAD
 34104                                  	;TEST	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET ; from disk reset ? ;hkn;
 34105 00006076 36F606[1106]04          	TEST	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET ; 4
 34106 0000607C 7508                    	jnz	short scan_buf_queue
 34107 0000607E 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0			;hkn;
 34108 00006084 7423                    	je	short end_scan
 34109                                  	
 34110                                  scan_buf_queue:
 34111 00006086 E82900                  	call	CHECKFLUSH
 34112                                  	;push	ax  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34113                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34114                                  	;mov	ah,[di+4]
 34115 00006089 8A6504                  	mov	ah,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 34116 0000608C 363826[2203]            	cmp	[SS:WPERR],ah					;hkn;
 34117 00006091 7408                    	je	short free_the_buf
 34118                                  	;TEST	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET ; from disk reset ? ;hkn;
 34119 00006093 36F606[1106]04          	TEST	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET ; 4
 34120 00006099 7405                    	jz	short dont_free_the_buf
 34121                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34122                                  	;;mov	al,[di+4]
 34123                                  	;mov	al,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 34124                                  	;cmp	[SS:WPERR],al					;hkn;
 34125                                  	; 15/08/2018
 34126                                  	;jne	short dont_free_the_buf	
 34127                                  free_the_buf:
 34128                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34129 0000609B C74504FF00              	mov	word [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],00FFh
 34130                                  dont_free_the_buf:
 34131                                  	;pop	ax  ; MSDOS 3.3 	   	
 34132                                  
 34133                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34134                                  	;mov	di,[DI]
 34135                                  	;;mov	di,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link] ; .buf_next
 34136                                  	;
 34137                                  	; 15/08/2018
 34138                                  	;lds	di,[di]
 34139                                  	;
 34140                                  	;cmp	di,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 34141                                  	;jnz	short scan_buf_queue 
 34142                                  	
 34143                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34144 000060A0 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 34145                                  	;mov	di,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ; .buf_link
 34146 000060A2 363B3E[A512]            	cmp	di,[SS:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]				;hkn;
 34147 000060A7 75DD                    	jne	short scan_buf_queue
 34148                                  
 34149                                  end_scan:
 34150 000060A9 16                      	push	ss
 34151 000060AA 1F                      	pop	ds
 34152                                  	; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34153                                  	;cmp	byte [FAILERR],0
 34154                                  	;jne	short bad_flush
 34155                                  	;retn
 34156                                  ;bad_flush:
 34157                                  	;stc
 34158                                  	;retn
 34159                                  
 34160                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34161                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34162                                  	; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34163 000060AB 803E[4A03]01            	cmp	byte [FAILERR],1
 34164 000060B0 F5                      	cmc
 34165                                  flushbuf_retn:
 34166 000060B1 C3                      	retn
 34167                                  	
 34168                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34169                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34170                                  	;cmp	byte [FAILERR],0
 34171                                  	;jne	short bad_flush
 34172                                  	;retn
 34173                                  ;bad_flush:
 34174                                  	;stc
 34175                                  	;retn

 34177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34178                                  ;
 34179                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 34180                                  ;
 34181                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 34182                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 34183                                  ;
 34184                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 34185                                  ;
 34186                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34187                                  ;
 34188                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34189                                  
 34190                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 34191                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34192 000060B2 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 34193                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 34194 000060B4 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 34195 000060B7 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 34196 000060B9 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 34197 000060BB 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 34198                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 34199 000060BD 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 34200 000060C0 F8                      	CLC
 34201 000060C1 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 34202                                  DOBUFFER:
 34203                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 34204 000060C3 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 34205 000060C7 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 34206 000060C9 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34207                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 34208 000060CA FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 34209 000060CD E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 34210 000060D0 58                      	POP	AX
 34211 000060D1 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 34212                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 34213 000060D3 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 34214                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 34215 000060D6 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 34216                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 34217 000060D9 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 34218                                  checkflush_retn:
 34219 000060DA C3                      	retn
 34220                                  
 34221                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 34222                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34223                                  ;
 34224                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 34225                                  ;
 34226                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 34227                                  ;
 34228                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 34229                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34230                                  ;
 34231                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 34232                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 34233                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34234                                  
 34235                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34236                                  	; DOSCODE:9AA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34237                                  
 34238                                  
 34239                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34240                                  	; DOSCODE:9A45h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34241                                  
 34242                                  BUFWRITE:
 34243                                  	; 10/09/2018
 34244                                  	; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34245                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E94h
 34246 000060DB B8FF00                  	MOV	AX,00FFH
 34247                                  	;xchg	ax,[di+4]
 34248 000060DE 874504                  	XCHG	AX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]	; Free, in case write barfs
 34249 000060E1 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
 34250 000060E3 74F5                    	jz      short checkflush_retn	; Buffer is free, carry clear.
 34251                                  	;test	ah,40h
 34252 000060E5 F6C440                  	test	AH,buf_dirty
 34253 000060E8 74F0                    	jz      short checkflush_retn	; Buffer is clean, carry clear.
 34254                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34255 000060EA E89100                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT 	; LB. decrement dirty count
 34256                                  
 34257                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34258 000060ED 363A06[2203]            	CMP	AL,[SS:WPERR]
 34259 000060F2 74E6                    	jz      short checkflush_retn	; If in WP error zap buffer
 34260                                  
 34261                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34262                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34263 000060F4 36A2[000E]              	MOV	[SS:SC_DRIVE],AL	;LB. set it for invalidation ;AN000;
 34264                                  	
 34265                                  	;;les	bp,[di+10] ; MSDOS 3.3
 34266                                  	;les	bp,[di+13] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34267 000060F8 C46D0F                  	LES	BP,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_DPB]
 34268                                  	;;lea	bx,[di+16]
 34269                                  	;lea	bx,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34270 000060FB 8D5D18                  	LEA	BX,[DI+BUFINSIZ]	; Point at buffer
 34271                                  	;mov	dx,[di+6]
 34272 000060FE 8B5506                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector] ;F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 34273                                  	
 34274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34275                                  	;mov	cx,[di+8]
 34276 00006101 8B4D08                  	MOV	CX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2] ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 34277                                  
 34278                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34279 00006104 36890E[0706]            	MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],CX	;F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 34280 00006109 8A4D0A                  	MOV	CL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt] ;>32mb		;AC000;
 34281                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34282                                  	;; mov	cx,[DI+8]
 34283                                  	;mov	cx,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt]
 34284                                  	;MOV	AL,CH			; [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc]
 34285 0000610C 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH
 34286                                  	;;mov	ah,ch ; MSDOS 3.3
 34287                                  
 34288                                  ;hkn; SS override for ALLOWED
 34289                                  	;mov	byte [SS:ALLOWED],18h
 34290 0000610E 36C606[4B03]18          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 34291                                  	;test	byte [di+5],8
 34292                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& Retro DOS 3.0)
 34293                                  	;test	ah,8
 34294 00006114 F6C408                  	test	AH,buf_isDATA
 34295 00006117 7406                    	JZ	short NO_IGNORE
 34296                                  	;or	byte [SS:ALLOWED],20h
 34297 00006119 36800E[4B03]20          	OR	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE
 34298                                  NO_IGNORE:
 34299                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 10/09/2018 (MSDOS 3.3, Retro DOS v3.0)
 34300                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34301                                  	;mov	ax,[di+11]
 34302 0000611F 8B450B                  	MOV	AX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc]	;>32mb		;AC000;
 34303                                  
 34304 00006122 57                      	PUSH	DI		; Save buffer pointer
 34305 00006123 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI		; Indicate failure
 34306                                  
 34307 00006125 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 34308 00006126 53                      	push	bx ; **
 34309                                  WRTAGAIN:
 34310 00006127 57                      	push	di ; ***
 34311 00006128 51                      	push	cx ; ****
 34312 00006129 50                      	push	ax ; *****
 34313                                  	;MOV	CX,1
 34314                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34315                                  	; ch = 0
 34316 0000612A B101                    	mov	cl,1 ; 24/07/2019
 34317                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34318                                  	;mov	cx,1
 34319 0000612C 53                      	push	bx ; ******
 34320 0000612D 52                      	push	dx ; *******
 34321 0000612E 1E                      	push	ds ; ********
 34322                                  
 34323                                  ; Note: As far as I can tell, all disk reads into buffers go through this point. -mrw 10/88
 34324                                  
 34325                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34326                                  	;cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0 ; 10/06/2019
 34327                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34328 0000612F 36382E[7900]            	cmp	[ss:BuffInHMA],ch ; 0
 34329 00006134 7418                    	jz	short NBUFFINHMA
 34330 00006136 51                      	push	cx
 34331 00006137 06                      	push	es
 34332 00006138 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 34333 0000613A 268B4E02                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 34334 0000613E D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 34335 00006140 36C43E[7A00]            	les	di,[ss:LoMemBuff] ; 10/06/2019
 34336 00006145 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34337 00006147 FC                      	cld
 34338 00006148 F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 34339 0000614A 06                      	push	es
 34340 0000614B 1F                      	pop	ds
 34341 0000614C 07                      	pop	es
 34342 0000614D 59                      	pop	cx
 34343                                  NBUFFINHMA:
 34344 0000614E E816DC                  	call	DWRITE		; Write out the dirty buffer
 34345 00006151 1F                      	pop	ds ; ********
 34346 00006152 5A                      	pop	dx ; *******
 34347 00006153 5B                      	pop	bx ; ******
 34348 00006154 58                      	pop	ax ; *****
 34349 00006155 59                      	pop	cx ; ****
 34350 00006156 5F                      	pop	di ; ***
 34351 00006157 7201                    	JC	short NOSET
 34352 00006159 47                      	INC	DI		; If at least ONE write succeedes, the operation
 34353                                  NOSET:				;	succeedes.
 34354 0000615A 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX
 34355 0000615C E2C9                    	LOOP	WRTAGAIN
 34356 0000615E 5B                      	pop	bx ; **
 34357 0000615F 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 34358                                  	;OR	DI,DI		; Clears carry
 34359                                  	;JNZ	short BWROK	; At least one write worked
 34360                                  	;STC			; DI never got INCed, all writes failed.
 34361                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34362 00006160 83FF01                  	cmp	di,1
 34363                                  BWROK:	
 34364 00006163 5F                      	POP	DI
 34365 00006164 C3                      	retn
 34366                                  
 34367                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 34368                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34369                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 34370                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 34371                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 34372                                  ;	code and time
 34373                                  ;
 34374                                  ;	ENTRY	ES:BP = drive parameter block
 34375                                  ;
 34376                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 34377                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 34378                                  ;
 34379                                  ;	USES	Flags
 34380                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34381                                  
 34382                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34383                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34384                                  
 34385                                  SET_RQ_SC_PARMS:
 34386                                  ;hkn; SS override for all variables used in this procedure.
 34387 00006165 50                      	push	ax
 34388                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+2]
 34389 00006166 268B4602                	MOV	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]	; save sector size
 34390 0000616A 36A3[FE0D]              	MOV	[ss:SC_SECTOR_SIZE],ax
 34391                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 34392                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34393                                  	;MOV	al,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]		; save drive #
 34394                                  	; 15/12/2022
 34395 0000616E 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 34396 00006172 36A2[000E]              	MOV	[ss:SC_DRIVE],al
 34397 00006176 58                      	pop	ax
 34398                                  srspx:	
 34399 00006177 C3                      	retn					;LB. return
 34400

 34407                                  ; Output:

 34416 00006178 36FF06[7100]            	inc	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount]	;hkn;
 34417 0000617D C3                      	retn
 34418                                  
 34419                                  ;Break	<DEC_DIRTY_COUNT-decrement dirty count>
 34420                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34421                                  ; Input:
 34422                                  ;	none

 34425                                  ; Output:
 34426                                  ;	dirty buffers count is decremented
 34427                                  ;

 34429                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34430                                  
 34431                                  DEC_DIRTY_COUNT:
 34432 0000617E 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ;hkn;
 34433 00006184 7405                    	jz	short ddcx		; BUGBUG - shouldn't it be an
 34434 00006186 36FF0E[7100]            	dec	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount] 
 34435                                  					; error condition to underflow here? ;hkn;
 34436                                  ddcx:

 34449                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 34450                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 34451                                  
 34452                                  ; =========================================================================
 34453                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 34454                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 34455                                  ;
 34456                                  ;	$WAIT
 34457                                  ;	$EXEC
 34458                                  ;	$Keep_process
 34459                                  ;	Stay_resident
 34460                                  ;	$EXIT
 34461                                  ;	$ABORT
 34462                                  ;	abort_inner
 34463                                  ;
 34464                                  ;	Modification history:
 34465                                  ;
 34466                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 34467                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 34468                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 34469                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 34470                                  ;
 34471                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 34472                                  ;
 34473                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 34474                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 34475                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 34476                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 34477                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 34478                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 34479                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 34480                                  ;
 34481                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 34482                                  ;
 34483                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 34484                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 34485                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 34486                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 34487                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 34488                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 34489                                  ;
 34490                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 34491                                  ;
 34492                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 34493                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 34494                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 34495                                  ;
 34496                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 34497                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 34498                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 34499                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 34500                                  ;
 34501                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 34502                                  ;
 34503                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 34504                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 34505                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 34506                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 34507                                  ;
 34508                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 34509                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 34510                                  ;		       UMBs.
 34511                                  ;
 34512                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 34513                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 34514                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 34515                                  ;
 34516                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 34517                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 34518                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 34519                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 34520                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 34521                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 34522                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 34523                                  ;
 34524                                  ; =========================================================================
 34525                                  
 34526                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 34527                                  
 34528                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 34529                                  ; =========================================================================
 34530                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 34531                                  ;
 34532                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34533                                  ;
 34534                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 34535                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 34536                                  ;
 34537                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 34538                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 34539                                  ;	USES	all
 34540                                  ; =========================================================================
 34541                                  
 34542                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34543                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34544                                  
 34545                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34546                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 34547                                  _$WAIT:
 34548                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34549                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 34550                                  
 34551 0000618C 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 34552 0000618E 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 34553 00006193 E9DAA4                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 34554                                  
 34555                                  ; =========================================================================
 34556                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 34557                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 34558                                  ;
 34559                                  ;
 34560                                  ; Assembler usage:
 34561                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 34562                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 34563                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 34564                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 34565                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 34566                                  ;
 34567                                  ;	AL  Function
 34568                                  ;	--  --------
 34569                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 34570                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 34571                                  ;	    begin execution.
 34572                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 34573                                  ;
 34574                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 34575                                  ;
 34576                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34577                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 34578                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 34579                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34580                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 34581                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 34582                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34583                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 34584                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 34585                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34586                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 34587                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 34588                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34589                                  ;
 34590                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 34591                                  ;
 34592                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34593                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 34594                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 34595                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34596                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 34597                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 34598                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34599                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 34600                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 34601                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34602                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 34603                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 34604                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34605                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 34606                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 34607                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34608                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 34609                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 34610                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34611                                  ;
 34612                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 34613                                  ;
 34614                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34615                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 34616                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 34617                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34618                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 34619                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 34620                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 34621                                  ;
 34622                                  ; Returns:
 34623                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 34624                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 34625                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 34626                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 34627                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 34628                                  ; =========================================================================
 34629                                  ;
 34630                                  ;   Revision history:
 34631                                  ;
 34632                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 34633                                  ;
 34634                                  ; =========================================================================
 34635                                  
 34636                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 34637                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)

 34643                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 34644                                  ;%out
 34645                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 34646                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 34647                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 34648                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen

 34659                                  
 34660                                  	; 30/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 34662                                  	
 34663                                  _$EXEC:
 34664                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34665                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 34666                                  
 34667                                  EXEC001S:
 34668                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 34669                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 34670                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 34671                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 34672                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 34673                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 34674                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 34675                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 34676                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 34677                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 34678                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 34679                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 34680                                  	;
 34681                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 34682                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 34683                                  
 34684                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34685                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 34686                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 34687                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 34688                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 34689                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 34690                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 34691                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 34692                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 34693                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 34694                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 34695                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 34696                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 34697                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 34698                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 34699                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 34700                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 34701                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 34702                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 34703                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34704                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]

 34707                                  	; ==================================================================
 34708                                  	; validate function
 34709                                  	; ==================================================================
 34710                                  		      	
 34711                                  	; M068 - Start
 34712                                  	;
 34713                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 34714                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 34715                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 34716                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 34717                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 34718                                  
 34719                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34720 00006196 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 34721                                  
 34722                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 34723                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 34724                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 34725                                  
 34726 0000619C 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 34727                                  	;jne	short @f
 34728 0000619E 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 34729                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 34730 000061A0 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 34731 000061A1 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 34732 000061A4 51                      	push	cx
 34733                                  ;@@:
 34734                                  Exec_@f:
 34735                                  	; M068 - End
 34736                                  	
 34737                                  	;Enter
 34738                                  
 34739 000061A5 55                      	push	bp
 34740 000061A6 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 34741                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 34742                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 34743                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 34744                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34745                                  	; 20/05/2019
 34746 000061A8 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 34747                                  
 34748                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34749 000061AB 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 34750                                  					; M030
 34751 000061AD 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 34752                                  
 34753                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34754                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 34755                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 34756                                  
 34757                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 34758 000061AF 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 34759                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 34760                                  	;mov	al,1
 34761 000061B5 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 34762                                  
 34763                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 34764                                  	;Leave
 34765 000061B7 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 34766 000061B9 5D                      	pop	bp
 34767                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 34768 000061BA E9BDA4                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 34769                                  
 34770                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34771                                  ExecReadyJ:
 34772 000061BD E8FD17                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 34773 000061C0 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 34774                                  
 34775                                  Exec_Check_2:
 34776 000061C3 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 34777 000061C5 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 34778                                  
 34779                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34780 000061C7 3C04                    	cmp	al,4			; 2 & 4 are not allowed
 34781 000061C9 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 34782                                  	
 34783 000061CB 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; M028 ; M030
 34784 000061CD 74EE                    	je	short ExecReadyJ	; M028
 34785                                  
 34786                                  	;mov	[bp-4],bx
 34787 000061CF 895EFC                  	mov	Exec_BlkL,BX		; stash args
 34788                                  	;mov	[bp-2],es
 34789 000061D2 8C46FE                  	mov	Exec_BlkH,ES
 34790                                  	;mov	[bp-5],al
 34791 000061D5 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL
 34792                                  	;mov	byte [bp-6],0
 34793 000061D8 C646FA00                	mov	Exec_Load_High,0
 34794                                  
 34795                                  	;mov	[bp-26],dx
 34796 000061DC 8956E6                  	mov	ExecNameL,DX		; set up length of exec name
 34797                                  	;mov	[bp-24],ds
 34798 000061DF 8C5EE8                  	mov	ExecNameH,DS
 34799 000061E2 89D6                    	mov	SI,DX			; move pointer to convenient place
 34800                                  	;invoke	DStrLen
 34801 000061E4 E808B6                  	call	DStrLen
 34802                                  	;mov	[bp-22],cx
 34803 000061E7 894EEA                  	mov	ExecNameLen,CX		; save length
 34804                                  
 34805                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34806 000061EA 36A0[0203]              	mov	al,[ss:AllocMethod]	; M063: save alloc method in 
 34807 000061EE 36A2[8400]              	mov	[ss:ALLOCMSAVE],al	; M063: AllocMsave
 34808                                  
 34809 000061F2 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL			; open for reading
 34810 000061F4 55                      	push	BP
 34811                                  
 34812                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34813                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 34814 000061F5 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to 
 34815                                  					; the redir that this open call is
 34816                                  					; due to an exec.
 34817                                  
 34818                                  	;invoke	$OPEN			; is the file there?
 34819 000061FB E80513                  	call	_$OPEN
 34820                                  
 34821                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34822 000061FE 9C                      	pushf
 34823                                  	; 02/06/2019
 34824                                  	;and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],0FEh
 34825 000061FF 368026[8600]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],~EXECOPEN ; reset flag
 34826 00006205 9D                      	popf
 34827                                  
 34828 00006206 5D                      	pop	BP
 34829                                  
 34830                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34831 00006207 72AE                    	jc	short Exec_Ret_Err
 34832                                  
 34833                                  	;mov	[bp-8],ax
 34834 00006209 8946F8                  	mov	Exec_FH,AX
 34835 0000620C 89C3                    	mov	BX,AX
 34836 0000620E 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 34837                                  	;invoke	$Ioctl
 34838 00006210 E85EC6                  	call	_$IOCTL
 34839 00006213 7207                    	jc	short Exec_BombJ
 34840                                  
 34841                                  	;test	dl,80h
 34842 00006215 F6C280                  	test	DL,devid_ISDEV
 34843 00006218 740A                    	jz	short Exec_Check_Environ
 34844                                  
 34845                                  	;mov	al,2
 34846 0000621A B002                    	mov	AL,error_file_not_found
 34847                                  Exec_BombJ:
 34848 0000621C E9CA00                  	jmp	Exec_Bomb
 34849                                  
 34850                                  BadEnv:
 34851                                  	;mov	al,0Ah
 34852 0000621F B00A                    	mov	AL,error_bad_environment
 34853 00006221 E9C500                  	jmp	Exec_Bomb
 34854                                  
 34855                                  Exec_Check_Environ:
 34856                                  	;mov	word [bp-18],0
 34857 00006224 C746EE0000              	mov	Exec_Load_Block,0
 34858                                  	;mov	word [bp-14],0
 34859 00006229 C746F20000              	mov	Exec_Environ,0
 34860                                  					; overlays... no environment
 34861                                  	;test	byte [bp-5],2
 34862 0000622E F646FB02                	test	Exec_Func,exec_func_overlay
 34863 00006232 7552                    	jnz	short Exec_Read_Header
 34864                                  
 34865                                  	;lds	si,[bp-4]
 34866 00006234 C576FC                  	lds	SI,Exec_Blk		; get block
 34867 00006237 8B04                    	mov	ax,[SI]
 34868                                  	;mov	AX,[SI+EXEC1.ENVIRON]	; address of environ
 34869 00006239 09C0                    	or	AX,AX
 34870 0000623B 750C                    	jnz	short Exec_Scan_Env
 34871                                  
 34872 0000623D 368E1E[3003]            	mov	DS,[SS:CurrentPDB]	;smr;SS Override
 34873                                  	;mov	ax,[44]
 34874 00006242 A12C00                  	mov	AX,[PDB.ENVIRON]
 34875                                  
 34876                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34877                                  ;---------------------------------------------BUG 92 4/30/90-----------------
 34878                                  ;
 34879                                  ; Exec_environ is being correctly initialized after the environment has been
 34880                                  ; allocated and copied form the parent's env. It must not be initialized here.
 34881                                  ; Because if the call to $alloc below fails Exec_dealloc will deallocate the
 34882                                  ; parent's environment.
 34883                                  ;	mov	Exec_Environ,AX
 34884                                  ;
 34885                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34886                                  
 34887                                  	;mov	[bp-14],ax
 34888                                  	;mov	Exec_Environ,ax
 34889                                  
 34890 00006245 09C0                    	or	AX,AX
 34891 00006247 743D                    	jz	short Exec_Read_Header
 34892                                  
 34893                                  Exec_Scan_Env:
 34894 00006249 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 34895 0000624B 31FF                    	xor	DI,DI
 34896                                  	;mov	cx,7FFFh ; MSDOS 3.3
 34897 0000624D B90080                  	mov	CX,8000h ; MSDOS 6.0	; at most 32k of environment ;M040
 34898 00006250 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 34899                                  
 34900                                  Exec_Get_Environ_Len:
 34901 00006252 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find that nul byte
 34902 00006254 75C9                    	jnz	short BadEnv
 34903                                  
 34904 00006256 49                      	dec	CX			; Dec CX for the next nul byte test
 34905 00006257 78C6                    	js	short BadEnv		; gone beyond the end of the environment
 34906                                  
 34907 00006259 AE                      	scasb				; is there another nul byte?
 34908 0000625A 75F6                    	jnz	short Exec_Get_Environ_Len ; no, scan some more
 34909                                  
 34910 0000625C 57                      	push	DI
 34911                                  	;lea	bx,[DI+11h]
 34912 0000625D 8D5D11                  	lea	BX,[DI+0Fh+2]
 34913                                  	;add	bx,[bp-22]
 34914 00006260 035EEA                  	add	BX,ExecNameLen		; BX <- length of environment
 34915                                  					; remember argv[0] length
 34916                                  					; round up and remember argc
 34917 00006263 B104                    	mov	CL,4
 34918 00006265 D3EB                    	shr	BX,CL			; number of paragraphs needed
 34919 00006267 06                      	push	ES
 34920                                  	;invoke	$Alloc			; can we get the space?
 34921 00006268 E84406                  	call	_$ALLOC
 34922 0000626B 1F                      	pop	DS
 34923 0000626C 59                      	pop	CX
 34924                                  
 34925                                  	;jnc	short Exec_Save_Environ
 34926                                  	;jmp	SHORT Exec_No_Mem	; nope... cry and sob
 34927                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34928 0000626D 7274                    	jc	short Exec_No_Mem ; 02/06/2019
 34929                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34930                                  	;jnc	short Exec_Save_Environ
 34931                                  	;jmp	SHORT Exec_No_Mem
 34932                                  
 34933                                  Exec_Save_Environ:
 34934 0000626F 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 34935                                  	;mov	[bp-14],ax
 34936 00006271 8946F2                  	mov	Exec_Environ,AX 	; save him for a rainy day
 34937 00006274 31F6                    	xor	SI,SI
 34938 00006276 89F7                    	mov	DI,SI
 34939 00006278 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; copy the environment
 34940 0000627A B80100                  	mov	AX,1
 34941 0000627D AB                      	stosw
 34942                                  	;lds	si,[bp-26]
 34943 0000627E C576E6                  	lds	SI,ExecName
 34944                                  	;mov	cx,[bp-22]
 34945 00006281 8B4EEA                  	mov	CX,ExecNameLen
 34946 00006284 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 34947                                  
 34948                                  Exec_Read_Header:
 34949                                  	; We read in the program header into the above data area and
 34950                                  	; determine where in this memory the image will be located.
 34951                                  
 34952                                  	;Context DS
 34953 00006286 16                      	push	ss

 35685                                  ;SR;
 35686                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 35687                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 35688                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 35689                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 35690                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie

 35692                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 35693                                  ;call is issued.

 36215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36216                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 36217                                  ;
 36218                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 36219                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 36220                                  ;
 36221                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 36222                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 36223                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 36224                                  ;
 36225                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36226                                  
 36227                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36228                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36229                                  
 36230                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36231                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36232                                  
 36233                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 36234 000067BC 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 36235                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 36236 000067BD 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 36237 000067C3 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 36238 000067C8 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 36239 000067CB 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 36240                                  
 36241 000067CD BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 36242                                  
 36243                                  Keep_Shrink:
 36244 000067D0 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 36245 000067D2 53                      	push	BX

 36247 000067D4 E82E02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 36248 000067D7 1F                      	pop	DS
 36249 000067D8 5B                      	pop	BX
 36250 000067D9 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 36251                                  
 36252 000067DB 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 36253 000067DD 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 36254                                  	;mov	[2],ax

 36256

 36311                                  
 36312                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 36313                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36314                                  ; Inputs:
 36315                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 36316                                  ; Function:
 36317                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 36318                                  ;	to the terminate address
 36319                                  ; Returns:
 36320                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 36321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36322                                  
 36323                                  _$ABORT:
 36324 00006818 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 36325                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 36326                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 36327 0000681A 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 36328                                  
 36329                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 36330                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 36331                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 36332                                  
 36333                                  abort_inner:
 36334 00006820 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 36335 00006825 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 36336 00006829 E84B9C                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 36337                                  
 36338                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 36339 0000682C 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 36340 0000682F 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 36341 00006831 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 36342                                  	;mov	si,10
 36343 00006833 BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 36344                                  	;mov	di,88h
 36345 00006836 BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 36346 00006839 A5                      	movsw
 36347 0000683A A5                      	movsw
 36348 0000683B A5                      	movsw
 36349 0000683C A5                      	movsw
 36350 0000683D A5                      	movsw
 36351 0000683E A5                      	movsw
 36352 0000683F E916F2                  	jmp	reset_environment

 36401                                  ;		      M003 - added support for link/unlink UMBs from
 36402                                  ;			     DOS arena chain. 7/18/90

 36418                                  ;			     set allloc strategy.

 36452                                  ;SUBTTL memory allocation utility routines
 36453                                  ;PAGE
 36454                                  ;
 36455                                  ; arena data
 36456                                  ;
 36457                                  ;       i_need  arena_head,WORD         ; seg address of start of arena
 36458                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 36459                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 36460                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found
 36461                                  ;       i_need  LastArena,WORD          ; last free block found
 36462                                  ;       i_need  AllocMethod,BYTE        ; how to alloc first(best)last
