 37859                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 37860                                  
 37861                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 37862                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37863                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 37864                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 37865                                  ;
 37866                                  ;	NOTE:
 37867                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 37868                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 37869                                  ;
 37870                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 37871                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 37872                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 37873                                  ;		'C' set if error
 37874                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 37875                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 37876                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37877                                  
 37878                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37879                                  
 37880                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 37881                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37882                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 37883 00006C7C 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 37884                                  	
 37885                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 37886 00006C81 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 37887                                  
 37888                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 37889 00006C86 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 37890 00006C8B 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 37891                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37892                                  	;mov	al,6
 37893 00006C8D B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 37894                                  ReturnCarry:
 37895 00006C8F F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 37896 00006C90 C3                      	retn				; go back
 37897                                  pjfn10: 
 37898                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 37899 00006C91 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 37900 00006C96 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 37901                                  	;clc
 37902                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 37903 00006C98 C3                      	retn
 37904                                  
 37905                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 37906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37907                                  ;
 37908                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 37909                                  ;
 37910                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 37911                                  ;
 37912                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 37913                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 37914                                  ;                   AX has error code
 37915                                  ;               Carry Reset
 37916                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 37917                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 37918                                  ; NOTE:
 37919                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 37920                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 37921                                  ;
 37922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37923                                  
 37924                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37925                                  
 37926                                  SFFromHandle:
 37927 00006C99 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 37928                                  	;retc				; return if error
 37929 00006C9C 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 37930 00006C9E 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 37931                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 37932                                  	;;mov	al,6
 37933                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 37934                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 37935                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37936                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37937 00006CA2 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 37938                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 37939                                  	;;mov	al,6
 37940                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 37941                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 37942                                  GetSF:
 37943 00006CA4 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 37944 00006CA5 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 37945 00006CA8 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 37946 00006CAA E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 37947 00006CAD 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 37948 00006CAE C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 37949                                  
 37950                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 37951                                  
 37952                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 37953                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37954                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 37955                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 37956                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 37957                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 37958                                  ;
 37959                                  ;   NOTE:
 37960                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 37961                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 37962                                  ;
 37963                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 37964                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 37965                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 37966                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 37967                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 37968                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37969                                  
 37970                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37971                                  
 37972                                  SFFromSFN:
 37973                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37974                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 37975 00006CAF 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 37976                                  
 37977                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 37978 00006CB4 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 37979                                  sfsfn5:	
 37980                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 37981 00006CB9 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 37982 00006CBD 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 37983                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 37984 00006CBF 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 37985 00006CC3 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 37986                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 37987 00006CC6 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 37988 00006CC9 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 37989 00006CCB F9                      	STC
 37990 00006CCC C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 37991                                  sfsfn7:
 37992 00006CCD 50                      	push	ax
 37993                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 37994                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37995                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 37996                                  	
 37997                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37998 00006CCE B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 37999                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38000                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 38001                                  	
 38002 00006CD0 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 38003 00006CD2 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 38004 00006CD4 58                      	pop	ax
 38005                                  	;add	di,6
 38006 00006CD5 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 38007 00006CD8 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 38008                                  
 38009                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 38010                                  
 38011                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 38012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38013                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 38014                                  ;
 38015                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 38016                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38017                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 38018                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 38019                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38020                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 38021                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 38022                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38023                                  
 38024                                  JFNFree:
 38025 00006CD9 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 38026                                  jfnf1:	
 38027 00006CDB E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 38028 00006CDE 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 38029 00006CE0 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 38030 00006CE4 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 38031 00006CE6 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 38032 00006CE7 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 38033                                  
 38034                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 38035                                  jfnf5:	
 38036                                  	;mov	al,4
 38037 00006CE9 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 38038                                  jfnfx:	
 38039 00006CEB C3                      	retn				; bye
 38040                                  
 38041                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 38042                                  
 38043                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 38044                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38045                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 38046                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 38047                                  ;
 38048                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 38049                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 38050                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 38051                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 38052                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 38053                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 38054                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 38055                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 38056                                  ;
 38057                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 38058                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 38059                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 38060                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 38061                                  ;
 38062                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 38063                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 38064                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 38065                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 38066                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 38067                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38068                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 38069                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 38070                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38071                                  
 38072                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38073                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38074                                  
 38075                                  SFNFree:
 38076                                  	; 12/08/2018
 38077                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38078                                  	;
 38079                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38080 00006CEC 50                      	push	ax
 38081 00006CED 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 38082                                  sfnf5:	
 38083 00006CEF 53                      	push	bx
 38084 00006CF0 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 38085 00006CF3 5B                      	pop	bx
 38086 00006CF4 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 38087 00006CF6 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 38088                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 38089 00006CFA 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 38090                                  	
 38091                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 38092 00006CFC 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 38093                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 38094 00006D00 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 38095                                  sfnf7:	
 38096 00006D02 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 38097 00006D03 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 38098                                  
 38099                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 38100                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 38101                                  ;
 38102                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 38103                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 38104                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 38105                                  
 38106                                  sfnf10:	
 38107 00006D05 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 38108                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 38109 00006D09 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 38110 00006D0D 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 38111 00006D0F 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 38112                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 38113 00006D13 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 38114 00006D17 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 38115                                  
 38116                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 38117                                  ;
 38118                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 38119                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 38120                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 38121                                  
 38122                                  sfnf20:
 38123                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 38124                                  
 38125                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 38126 00006D19 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 38127                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 38128                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 38129                                  
 38130 00006D1E 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 38131                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 38132 00006D22 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 38133 00006D26 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 38134                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 38135 00006D2A 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 38136                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 38137                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38138                                  	;pop	ax
 38139                                  	;;clc
 38140                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 38141                                  	; 17/12/2022
 38142 00006D2E 58                      	pop	ax
 38143                                  	;clc
 38144 00006D2F C3                      	retn
 38145                                  
 38146                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 38147                                  ;
 38148                                  ;	'C' set
 38149                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 38150                                  
 38151                                  sfnf95: 
 38152 00006D30 58                      	pop	ax
 38153                                  	;mov	al,4
 38154 00006D31 B004                    	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 38155 00006D33 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 38156                                  
 38157                                  ;============================================================================
 38158                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 38159                                  ;============================================================================
 38160                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38161                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38162                                  
 38163                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38164                                  
 38165                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 38166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38167                                  ;
 38168                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 38169                                  ;
 38170                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 38171                                  ;		path
 38172                                  ;
 38173                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 38174                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 38175                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 38176                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 38177                                  ;
 38178                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 38179                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 38180                                  ;	USES	all
 38181                                  ;
 38182                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38183                                  
 38184                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38185                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38186                                  
 38187                                  _$CLOSE:
 38188                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 38189                                  
 38190 00006D34 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 38191 00006D37 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 38192 00006D39 16                      	push	ss
 38193 00006D3A 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 38194 00006D3B 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 38195 00006D3F 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 38196                                  
 38197                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 38198                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 38199                                  ;
 38200                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 38201                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 38202                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 38203                                  
 38204                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 38205 00006D43 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 38206 00006D47 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 38207                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 38208 00006D49 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 38209                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 38210 00006D4D 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 38211                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 38212 00006D4F 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 38213 00006D51 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 38214                                  
 38215                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 38216                                  ; -1.
 38217                                  
 38218                                  FreeJFN:
 38219 00006D53 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 38220 00006D56 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 38221                                  PostFree:
 38222                                  
 38223                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 38224                                  
 38225 00006D5A E8CFC7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 38226                                  
 38227                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 38228                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 38229                                  
 38230 00006D5D 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 38231                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 38232 00006D5F B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 38233                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38234                                  CloseOk:
 38235 00006D61 E90C99                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 38236                                  CloseError:
 38237 00006D64 E91399                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 38238                                  
 38239                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 38240                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38241                                  ;
 38242                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 38243                                  ;
 38244                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 38245                                  ;	flushed out.  BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 38246                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 38247                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 38248                                  ;
 38249                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 38250                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 38251                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 38252                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 38253                                  ;
 38254                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 38255                                  ;	EXIT	none
 38256                                  ;	USES	all
 38257                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38258                                  
 38259                                  _$COMMIT:
 38260                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 38261                                  
 38262 00006D67 E82702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 38263 00006D6A 7213                    	JC	short CommitError	; error return
 38264 00006D6C 16                      	push	ss
 38265 00006D6D 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT

 38785                                  ;   Assembler usage:

 38980                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 38981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38982                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 38983                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 38984                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 38985                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 38986                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 38987                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 38988                                  ;
 38989                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 38990                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 38991                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 38992                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 38993                                  ;	USES	none
 38994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38995                                  
 38996                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38997                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38998                                  CheckOwner:
 38999                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 39003

 39005

 39041                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 39042                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39043                                  
 39044                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 39045                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 39046                                  
 39047                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 39048                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 39049                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 39050                                  
 39051                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 39052                                  ;
 39053                                  ;	$AssignOper
 39054                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 39055                                  ;	InitCDS
 39056                                  ;	$UserOper
 39057                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 39058                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 39059                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 39060                                  ;
 39061                                  ;   Revision history:
 39062                                  ;
 39063                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 39064                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 39065                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 39066                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 39067                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 39068                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 39069                                  ;				    aliasing.
 39070                                  ;
 39071                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 39072                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 39073                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 39074                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 39075                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 39076                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 39077                                  ;
 39078                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 39079                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 39080                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 39081                                  ;
 39082                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 39083                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 39084                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 39085                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 39086                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 39087                                  ;
 39088                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 39089                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 39090                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 39091                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 39092                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 39093                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 39094                                  ;
 39095                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 39096                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 39097                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 39098                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 39099                                  ;   number.
 39100                                  ;
 39101                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 39102                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 39103                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 39104                                  ;   TransPath.
 39105                                  ;
 39106                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39107                                  
 39108                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 39109                                  
 39110                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 39111                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 39112                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 39113                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 39114                                  ;					; current drive)
 39115                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 39116                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 39117                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 39118                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 39119                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 39120                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 39121                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 39122                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 39123                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 39124                                  
 39125                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 39126                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39127                                  ; Inputs:
 39128                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 39129                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 39130                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 39131                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 39132                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 39133                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 39134                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 39135                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 39136                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 39137                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 39138                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 39139                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 39140                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 39141                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 39142                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 39143                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 39144                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 39145                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 39146                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 39147                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 39148                                  ; Function:
 39149                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 39150                                  ; Returns:
 39151                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 39152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39153                                  
 39154                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39155                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39156                                  _$AssignOper:
 39157                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39158 00006FB2 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set in_use ?		;AN000;
 39159 00006FB4 7525                    	JNZ	short chk08		      ; no			;AN000;
 39160                                  srinuse:								;AN000;
 39161 00006FB6 50                      	PUSH	AX			      ; save al 		;AN000;
 39162 00006FB7 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL			      ; AL= drive id		;AN000;
 39163 00006FB9 E85601                  	CALL	GetCDSFromDrv		      ; ds:si -> cds		;AN000;
 39164 00006FBC 58                      	POP	AX			      ; 			;AN000;
 39165 00006FBD 7216                    	JC	short baddrv		      ; bad drive		;AN000;
 39166                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0
 39167 00006FBF 837C4500                	CMP	WORD [SI+curdir.devptr],0     ; dpb ptr =0 ?		;AN000;
 39168 00006FC3 7410                    	JZ	short baddrv		      ;     no			;AN000;
 39169 00006FC5 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set ?			;AN000;

 39321                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 39322                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39323                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 39324                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 39325                                  ;
 39326                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 39327                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 39328                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 39329                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 39330                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 39331                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 39332                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 39333                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 39334                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 39335                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 39336                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 39337                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39338                                  
 39339                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39340                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39341                                  _$UserOper:
 39342                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39343                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39344 0000704D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 39345 0000704E 2C01                    	SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 39346 00007050 58                      	POP	AX
 39347 00007051 7211                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 39348 00007053 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 39349 00007055 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 39350 00007057 763D                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 39351                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 39352 00007059 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 39353                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 39354                                  	;error	error_invalid_function	; not 0,1,2,3
 39355                                  	;mov	al,1
 39356 0000705F B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 39357                                  useroper_error:
 39358                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39359                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39360 00007061 E91696                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 39361                                  	;jmp	short ASS_ERR
 39362                                  
 39363                                  UserGet:
 39364                                  ; Transfer MYNAME to DS:DX
 39365                                  ; Set Return CX to MYNUM
 39366 00007064 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; switch registers
 39367 00007065 07                      	POP	ES
 39368 00007066 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX			; destination
 39369 00007068 368B0E[0E00]            	MOV	CX,[SS:MYNUM]		; Get number	;smr;SS Override
 39370 0000706D E80794                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 39371                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
 39372 00007070 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX ; Set number return
 39373 00007073 16                      	push	ss			; point to DOSDATA
 39374 00007074 1F                      	pop	ds
 39375 00007075 BE[0503]                	MOV	SI,MYNAME		; point source to user string
 39376                                  UserMove:

 39378 0000707B F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; blam.

 39380 0000707F AA                      	STOSB
 39381                                  UserBye:
 39382 00007080 E9ED95                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; no errors here
 39383                                  
 39384                                  UserSet:
 39385                                  ; Transfer DS:DX to MYNAME
 39386                                  ; CX to MYNUM
 39387 00007083 36890E[0E00]            	MOV	[SS:MYNUM],CX				;smr;SS Override
 39388 00007088 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; user space has source
 39389 0000708A 16                      	push	ss
 39390 0000708B 07                      	pop	es

 39392 0000708F 36FE06[0403]            	INC	byte [SS:DIFFNAM]	; signal change ;smr;SS Override
 39393 00007094 EBE2                    	JMP	short UserMove

 39545                                  ;Break <GetCDSFromDrv - convert a drive number to a CDS pointer>
 39546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39547                                  ;   GetCDSFromDrv - given a physical drive number, convert it to a CDS
 39548                                  ;	pointer, returning an error if the drive number is greater than the
 39549                                  ;	number of CDS's

 39554                                  ;		    DS:SI -> CDS

 39563                                  	;STC				; signal error
 39564                                  	;RETN				; bye

 39567 00007118 7217                    	jc	short GetCDS_retn
 39568                                  GetCDS:

 39570                                  	;PUSH	BX
 39571 0000711A 50                      	PUSH	AX
 39572 0000711B 36C536[3C00]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; get pointer to table	;smr;SS Override
 39573                                  	;mov	bl,81 ; MSDOS 3.3
 39574                                  	;mov	bl,88 ; MSDOS 6.0

 39577                                  	;MUL	BL			; get net offset

 39597                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 39598                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39599                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 39600                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 39601                                  ;
 39602                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 39603                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 39604                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 39605                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 39606                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 39607                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 39608                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 39609                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39610                                  
 39611                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39612                                  TransFCB:
 39613                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39614                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39615                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 39616                                  	;ENTER
 39617 00007132 55                      	push	bp
 39618 00007133 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39619                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 39620 00007135 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 39621 00007138 16                      	push	ss
 39622 00007139 07                      	pop	es
 39623 0000713A 06                      	push	es

 39626                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp

 39688                                  
 39689                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39690                                  
 39691                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 39692                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39693                                  ;
 39694                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 39695                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 39696                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 39697                                  ;       exactly.
 39698                                  ;
 39699                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 39700                                  ;       matches splice.
 39701                                  ;
 39702                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 39703                                  ;
 39704                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 39705                                  ;
 39706                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 39707                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 39708                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 39709                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 39710                                  ;
 39711                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 39712                                  ;
 39713                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 39714                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 39715                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 39716                                  ;
 39717                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 39718                                  ;
 39719                                  ;       if fSharing then
 39720                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 39721                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 39722                                  ;           splice
 39723                                  ;           fatRead
 39724                                  ;           return
 39725                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 39726                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 39727                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 39728                                  ;           return
 39729                                  ;       if device then
 39730                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 39731                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 39732                                  ;           return
 39733                                  ;       if file then
 39734                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 39735                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 39736                                  ;           Copy current dir
 39737                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 39738                                  ;           splice
 39739                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 39740                                  ;           if local then
 39741                                  ;               fatread
 39742                                  ;           return
 39743                                  ;
 39744                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 39745                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 39746                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 39747                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 39748                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 39749                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 39750                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 39751                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 39752                                  ;
 39753                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39754                                  
 39755                                  ; 22/05/2019
 39756                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39757                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39758                                  
 39759                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39760                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39761                                  
 39762                                  TransPath:

 39774 000071AF 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override

 39779                                  ;
 39780                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 39781                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 39782                                  ;
 39783 000071BC 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 39784 000071C2 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 39785                                  ;
 39786                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 39787                                  ;
 39788 000071C4 E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI

 39794 000071D5 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors

 39796                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 39797                                  ;

 39799 000071D8 1F                      	pop	ds

 39801 000071DD F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 39802 000071E2 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice

 39804                                  NoServerSplice:

 39806 000071E8 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD

 39815                                  
 39816                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 39817                                  ; the name if so.
 39818                                  
 39819                                  CheckUNC:
 39820 000071F9 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override

 39822 00007200 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h

 39824                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize

 39830                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 39831                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net

 39884                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39885                                  %if 0
 39886                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39887                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 39888                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 39889                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 39890                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 39891                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 39892                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 39893                                  ;;;
 39894                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 39895                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 39896                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 39897                                  ;;;
 39898                                  ;;;More info:
 39899                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 39900                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 39901                                  ;;;
 39902                                  	call	no5Dshere
 39903                                  start5Dhack:
 39904                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 39905                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 39906                                  
 39907                                  %endif
 39908                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39909                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 39910 00007242 E8D0D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 39911                                  
 39912 00007245 5D                      	pop	bp
 39913 00007246 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back

 39915                                  
 39916                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 39917                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 39918                                  ; call.

 39922 00007252 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 39923                                  
 39924                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 39925                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 39926                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 39927                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 39928                                  ; a device.
 39929

 39995

 39997                                  
 39998 0000728F B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 39999 00007291 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 40000 00007295 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 40001 00007297 AA                      	STOSB
 40002                                  
 40003                                  ; Now get original string.
 40004

 40007 00007299 5E                      	pop	si
 40008 0000729A 1F                      	pop	ds
 40009                                  
 40010                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 40011                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 40012                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 40014 0000729B E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?

 40020                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 40021                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.

 40024                                  SkipPath:

 40059                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 40060

 40063 000072CE 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 40064                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK

 40105                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 40106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40107                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 40108                                  ;
 40109                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 40110                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 40111                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 40112                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 40113                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 40114                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 40115                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 40116                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 40117                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 40118                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 40119                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40120                                  
 40121                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 40481                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 40482                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40483                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 40484                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 40485                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 40486                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 40487                                  ;
 40488                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 40489                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 40490                                  ;   Outputs:
 40491                                  ;       Carry Clear
 40492                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 40493                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 40494                                  ;       Carry Set
 40495                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 40496                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 40497                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40498                                  
 40499                                  _$NameTrans:
 40500 0000749E 1E                      	push	ds
 40501 0000749F 56                      	push	si

 40505                                  	
 40506                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 40507                                  ; M027 - Start
 40508                                  ;
 40509                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 40510                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 40511                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 40512                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 40513                                  ; and restore CX.

 40541                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 40542                                  ;   pointer.

 40569                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40570                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 40571                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 40572                                  ;
 40573                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 40574                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced

 40584 000074DF AB                      	STOSW

 40588                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 40589                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40590                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 40591                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 40592                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 40593                                  ;
 40594                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 40595                                  ;               ES:DI string
 40596                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 40597                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 40598                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 40599                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 40600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40601                                  
 40602                                  PathPref:
 40603 000074E1 E80BA3                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 40604 000074E4 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 40605 000074E5 F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 40606 000074E7 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 40607 000074E9 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 40608 000074EA 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 40609 000074ED E8A3E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 40610 000074F0 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 40611                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 40612 000074F2 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 40613 000074F5 E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 40614                                  Prefix:
 40615 000074F8 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 40616 000074F9 C3                      	retn

 40618                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 40619                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40620                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for

 40649                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 40650                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 40651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40652                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40653                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 40654                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 40655                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 40656                                  ;           INT     int_command
 40657                                  ;
 40658                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 40659                                  ;       ------          --------
 40660                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 40661                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 40662                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 40663                                  ;
 40664                                  ;   Error returns:
 40665                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 40666                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 40667                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 40668                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 40669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40670                                  
 40671                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 40672                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 40673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40674                                  ;
 40675                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 40676                                  ;
 40677                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 40678                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 40679                                  ;
 40680                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 40681                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 40682                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 40683                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 40684                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40685                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 40686                                  ;	USES	all
 40687                                  ;
 40688                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40689                                  
 40690                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40691                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 40693                                  _$OPEN:       
 40694 00007503 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 40695                                  _$Open2:
 40696                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 40697 00007505 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 40698 00007507 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 40699 0000750A B9[7331]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 40700                                  
 40701                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 40702                                  
 40703 0000750D 50                      	push	ax
 40704                                  
 40705                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 40706                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 40707                                  ;
 40708                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 40709                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 40710                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 40711                                  ;
 40712                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 40713                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 40714                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 40715                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 40716                                  
 40717                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 40718                                  
 40719                                  AccessFile:
 40720 0000750E E8F2A3                  	call	ECritSFT
 40721 00007511 E8D8F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 40722 00007514 E819A4                  	call	LCritSFT
 40723 00007517 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 40724 00007519 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 40725 0000751E 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 40726 00007523 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 40727                                  
 40728                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 40729                                  
 40730 00007528 E8AEF7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 40731 0000752B 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 40732                                  OpenFailJ:
 40733 0000752D E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 40734                                  
 40735                                  SaveJFN:
 40736 00007530 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 40737 00007535 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 40738 0000753A 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 40739                                  
 40740                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 40741                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 40742                                  
 40743 0000753F 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 40744 00007544 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 40745 00007547 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 40746 00007549 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 40747 0000754C 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 40748 0000754D E844FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 40749 00007550 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 40750                                  
 40751 00007551 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 40752 00007556 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 40753 00007558 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 40754 0000755E 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch

 40760                                  SetSearch:

 40764

 40769                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0

 40771                                  	;

 40774                                  	;test   al,80h

 40781                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 40782                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0

 40789                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 40790                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 40792                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 40802 00007585 07                      	pop	es

 40807 00007588 1F                      	pop	ds

 40811 0000758C 59                      	pop	cx
 40812 0000758D C536[9E05]              	LDS	SI,[THISSFT]

 40814                                  	;jc	short OpenE ; MSDOS 3.3

 40816                                  ;	The SFT was successfully opened. Remove busy mark.
 40817                                  
 40818                                  OpenOK:

 40822 00007597 094C05                  	OR	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],CX ; set no inherit bit if necessary
 40823                                  
 40824                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 40825                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 40826                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 40827                                  ;

 40829                                  ; sharer.

 41013                                  ;	BREAK <$UNLINK - delete a file entry>
 41014                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41015                                  ;
 41016                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 41017                                  ;
 41018                                  ;
 41019                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41020                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 41021                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 41022                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 41023                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 41024                                  ;	    INT     21h
 41025                                  ;
 41026                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 41027                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 41028                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 41029                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41030                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 41031                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 41032                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 41033                                  ;
 41034                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41035                                  
 41036                                  _$UNLINK:
