 45103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45104                                  ;
 45105                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 45106                                  ;
 45107                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 45108                                  ;
 45109                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 45110                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 45111                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 45112                                  ;
 45113                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 45114                                  ;
 45115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45116                                  
 45117                                  WhatCPUType:
 45118                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45119                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 45120                                  
 45121                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 45122                                  
 45123                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 45124                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 45125                                  ;
 45126                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 45127                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 45128                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 45129                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 45130                                  
 45131                                  	; 04/11/2022
 45132                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 45133                                  
 45134                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 45135                                  	pushf
 45136                                  	push	bx			; preserve bx
 45137                                  	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 45138                                  
 45139                                  	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 45140                                  	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 45141                                  	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 45142                                  	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 45143                                  	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 45144                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 45145                                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 45146                                  	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 45147                                  
 45148                                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 45149                                  	push	ax
 45150                                  	popf
 45151                                  	pushf
 45152                                  	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 45153                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 45154                                  	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 45155                                  
 45156                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 45157                                  	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 45158                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 45159                                  	inc	bx
 45160                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 45161                                  	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 45162                                  	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 45163                                  	popf
 45164                                  	
 45165                                  	;endm
 45166                                  
 45167                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45168                                  	retn	; 19/09/2023
 45169                                  
 45170                                  ; 19/09/2023
 45171                                  ;	; 04/11/2022
 45172                                  ;	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 45173                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 45174                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 45175                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 45176                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 45177                                  
 45178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45179                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 45180                                  
 45181                                  	; 19/09/2023
 45182                                  	;jmp	short sr_done
 45183                                  
 45184                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 45185 00008047 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 45186 00008049 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 45187                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 45188                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 45189                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 45190                                  					; DOSINIT.
 45191                                  sr_done:
 45192 0000804C 2EC606[FC7F]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 45193 00008052 1F                      	pop	ds
 45194 00008053 CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 45195                                  
 45196                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45197                                  ;
 45198                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 45199                                  ;
 45200                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 45201                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA
 45202                                  ;
 45203                                  ; Outputs	 : Patches in AX as the segment for the following vectors:
 45204                                  ;			
 45205                                  ;			0,20-28,3a-3f
 45206                                  ;
 45207                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : DI,CX,DX,AX
 45208                                  ;
 45209                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45210                                  
 45211                                  patch_vec_segments:
 45212                                  
 45213 00008054 06                      	push	es
 45214                                  
 45215 00008055 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0
 45216 00008057 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 45217                                  
 45218                                  	;mov	di,82h
 45219 00008059 BF8200                  	mov	di,INTBASE+2		; di -> segment of int 20 vector
 45220                                  
 45221 0000805C 26A30200                	mov	[es:2],ax		; segment of default divide trap handler
 45222                                  
 45223                                  					; set vectors 20 & 21
 45224                                  	; 04/11/2022
 45225                                  	;mov	cx,2
 45226                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45227                                  	;mov	cl,2
 45228                                  ps_set1:
 45229 00008060 AB                      	stosw	; int 20h segment
 45230                                  	;add	di,2
 45231                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45232 00008061 47                      	inc	di
 45233 00008062 47                      	inc	di
 45234                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 45235                                  
 45236                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45237 00008063 AB                      	stosw	; int 21h segment
 45238                                  	;inc	di
 45239                                  	;inc	di
 45240                                  
 45241                                  	;add	di,4			; skip int 22h vector
 45242 00008064 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 45243                                  
 45244 00008067 AB                      	stosw				; set int 23h
 45245 00008068 83C706                  	add	di,6			; skip int 24h
 45246                                  
 45247                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 45248                                  	; 04/11/2022
 45249                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 45250                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45251 0000806B B104                    	mov	cl,4
 45252                                  ps_set2:
 45253 0000806D AB                      	stosw				
 45254                                  	;add	di,2
 45255                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45256 0000806E 47                      	inc	di
 45257 0000806F 47                      	inc	di
 45258 00008070 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set2
 45259                                  
 45260 00008072 83C704                  	add	di,4			; skip int 29h vector (fast con) as it may
 45261                                  					;   already be set.
 45262                                  	; 04/11/2022
 45263                                  	;mov	cx,6			; set 6 segs (skip 2 between each)
 45264                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45265 00008075 B106                    	mov	cl,6			;  set segs for ints 2ah-2fh
 45266                                  ps_set3:
 45267 00008077 AB                      	stosw
 45268                                  	;add	di,2
 45269                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45270 00008078 47                      	inc	di
 45271 00008079 47                      	inc	di
 45272 0000807A E2FB                    	loop	ps_set3
 45273                                  
 45274                                  ; 30h & 31H is the CPM call entry point whose segment address is set up by
 45275                                  ; below. So skip it.
 45276

 45544                                  ;
 45545                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 45546                                  ;
 45547                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 45548                                  ;
 45549                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 45550                                  ;
 45551                                  ;	Description:
 45552                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 45553                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 45554                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 45555                                  ;
 45556                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45557                                  
 45558                                  	; 04/11/2022
 45559                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45560                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 45561                                  
 45562                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 45563                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 45564                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 45565                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 45566                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 45567                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 45568                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 45569                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 45570                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 45571 00008141 [D410]                  	dw	i0patch
 45572 00008143 [DE10]                  	dw	i20patch
 45573 00008145 [E810]                  	dw	i21patch
 45574 00008147 [F210]                  	dw	i25patch
 45575 00008149 [FC10]                  	dw	i26patch
 45576 0000814B [0611]                  	dw	i27patch
 45577 0000814D [1011]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 45578 0000814F [1A11]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 45579                                  
 45580                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 45581                                  
 45582                                  patch_in_nops:
 45583 00008151 50                      	push	ax

 45588                                  	; cx = 0

 45677                                  ;============================================================================
 45678                                  ; DOSDATA - MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS Offset 0BF70h, file offset 8190h
 45679                                  ;============================================================================
 45680                                  
 45681                                  ;align 16
 45682                                  	; DOSDATA (MSDOS.SYS kernel DATA) segment starts here...
 45683                                  	; (4970 bytes for MSDOS 6.21)
 45684                                  	; (4976 bytes for Retro DOS v4.0, 25/05/2019 modification.)
 45685                                  
 45686                                  ;============================================================================
 45687                                  ; MSCONST.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 45688                                  ;============================================================================
 45689                                  ; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45690                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
 45691                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 45692                                  
 45693                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 45694                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45695                                  
 45696                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 45697                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 45698                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 45699                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 45700                                  ;
 45701                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 45702                                  ; describing that data item.
 45703                                  
 45704                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT
 45705                                  
 45706                                  ; 04/11/2022
 45707                                  ;[ORG 0]
 45708                                  
 45709                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45710                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45711                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45712                                  ; DOSDATA segment start offset from beginning of MSDOS.SYS file: 32432 (7EB0h)
 45713                                  ; (3DD0h+7EB0h = 0BC80h) - for MSDOS 5.0 kernel file -
 45714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45715                                  
 45716                                  ; 04/11/2022
 45717                                  
 45718                                  ;DOSDATA:0000h
 45719                                  
 45720 0000816A 90<rep 6h>              align 16
 45721                                  
 45722                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45723                                  ; 06/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45724                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45725                                  
 45726                                  segment .data  vstart=0 ; 06/12/2022
 45727                                  
 45728                                  ; ============================================================================
 45729                                  
 45730                                  ; 06/12/2022
 45731                                  ;DOSDATASTART equ $
 45732                                  DOSDATASTART:
 45733                                  
 45734                                  
 45735                                  ;hkn; add 4 bytes to get correct offsets since jmp has been removed in START
 45736                                  
 45737                                  	;; 03/11/2022
 45738                                  	;jmp	DOSINIT		; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS (DOSDATA:0000h)
 45739                                  
 45740                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45741                                  	;db	4 dup (?)	
 45742 00000000 00<rep 4h>              	times	4 db 0
 45743                                  
 45744                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 modification
 45745                                  	;dw 	_$STARTCODE ; DOSCODE offset and/or size of DOSDATA
 45746                                  	;dw	0
 45747                                  
 45748                                  	;EVEN
 45749                                  
 45750                                  ;align 2
 45751                                  
 45752                                  ; WANGO!!! The following word is used by SHARE and REDIR to determin data
 45753                                  ; area compatability. This location must be incremented EACH TIME the data
 45754                                  ; area here gets mucked with.
 45755                                  ;
 45756                                  ; Also, do NOT change this position relative to DOSDATA:0.
 45757                                  
 45758                                  MSCT001S:	; LABEL BYTE
 45759                                  	
 45760                                  DataVersion:	
 45761 00000004 0100                    	dw	1	;AC000; [SYSTEM] version number for DOS DATA
 45762                                  
 45763                                  ;hkn; add 8 bytes to get correct offsets since BugTyp, BugLev and "BUG " has 
 45764                                  ;hkn; been removed to DOSCODE above
 45765                                  
 45766                                  ;M044
 45767                                  ; First part of save area for saving last para of Window memory
 45768                                  
 45769                                  WinoldPatch1:	; db 8 dup (?)	;M044
 45770 00000006 00<rep 8h>              	times	8 db 0
 45771                                  
 45772                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 DOSDATA:000Eh
 45773                                  MYNUM:			; Offset 000Eh
 45774 0000000E 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] A number that goes with MYNAME
 45775                                  FCBLRU: 		; [SYSTEM] LRU count for FCB cache
 45776 00000010 0000                    	dw	0
 45777                                  OpenLRU:
 45778 00000012 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] LRU count for FCB cache opens
 45779                                  OEM_HANDLER: 		
 45780 00000014 FFFFFFFF                	dd	-1	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to OEM handler code
 45781                                  
 45782                                  ;	BUGBUG - who uses LeaveAddr?  What if we want to rework the
 45783                                  ;;			way that we leave DOS???? - jgl
 45784                                  
 45785                                  LeaveAddr:
 45786 00000018 [F603]                  	dw	LeaveDOS  ; <<OFFSET DOSCODE:LeaveDOS>> ; [SYSTEM]
 45787                                  RetryCount:		
 45788 0000001A 0300                    	dw	3	; [SYSTEM] Share retries
 45789                                  RetryLoop:
 45790 0000001C 0100                    	dw	1	; [SYSTEM] Share retries
 45791                                  LastBuffer:
 45792 0000001E FFFFFFFF                	dd	-1	; [SYSTEM] Buffer queue recency pointer
 45793                                  CONTPOS:
 45794 00000022 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] location in buffer of next read
 45795                                  arena_head:
 45796 00000024 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] Segment # of first arena in memory
 45797                                  
 45798                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 45799                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 45800                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 45801                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 45802                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 45803                                  ;;
 45804                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 45805                                  ;;
 45806                                  ;;	on return:
 45807                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 45808                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 45809                                  ;;
 45810                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 45811                                  ;;
 45812                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 45813                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 45814                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 45815                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 45816                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 45817                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 45818                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 45819                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 45820                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 45821                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 45822                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 45823                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 45824                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 45825                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 45826                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 45827                                  ;;
 45828                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 45829                                  
 45830                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 45831                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block
 45832                                  
 45833                                  ;SYSINITVAR:
 45834                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45835                                  SYSINITVARS:
 45836                                  DPBHEAD:
 45837 00000026 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of DPB-FAT list
 45838                                  SFT_ADDR:
 45839 0000002A [CC000000]              	dd	SFTABL	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to first SFT table
 45840                                  BCLOCK:
 45841 0000002E 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] The CLOCK device
 45842                                  BCON:
 45843 00000032 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Console device entry points
 45844                                  MAXSEC:
 45845 00000036 8000                    	dw	128	; [SYSTEM] Maximum allowed sector size
 45846                                  BUFFHEAD:
 45847 00000038 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of buffer queue
 45848                                  CDSADDR:
 45849 0000003C 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to curdir structure table
 45850                                  SFTFCB:
 45851 00000040 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] pointer to FCB cache table
 45852                                  KEEPCOUNT:
 45853 00000044 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] count of FCB opens to keep
 45854                                  NUMIO:
 45855 00000046 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] Number of disk tables
 45856                                  CDSCOUNT:
 45857 00000047 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] Number of CDS structures in above
 45858                                  
 45859                                  ; A fake header for the NUL device
 45860                                  NULDEV:
 45861 00000048 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Link to rest of device list
 45862                                  	;dw	8004h
 45863 0000004C 0480                    	dw	DEVTYP|ISNULL ; [SYSTEM] Null device attributes
 45864 0000004E [160E]                  	dw	SNULDEV	; [SYSTEM] Strategy entry point
 45865 00000050 [1B0E]                  	dw	INULDEV	; [SYSTEM] Interrupt entry point
 45866 00000052 4E554C2020202020        	db	"NUL     " ; [SYSTEM] Name of null device
 45867                                  SPLICES:
 45868 0000005A 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] TRUE => splices being done
 45869                                  
 45870                                  Special_Entries:
 45871 0000005B 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] address of special entries ;AN000;
 45872                                  UU_IFS_DOS_CALL:
 45873 0000005D 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] entry for IFS DOS service ;AN000;
 45874                                  ; 
 45875                                  ; UU_IFS_HEADER:
 45876                                  ; 	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] IFS header chain ;AN000;
 45877                                  
 45878                                  ChkCopyProt:
 45879 00000061 0000                    	dw	0	; M068
 45880                                  A20OFF_PSP:
 45881 00000063 0000                    	dw	0	; M068
 45882                                  BUFFERS_PARM1:
 45883 00000065 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] value of BUFFERS= ,m	;AN000;
 45884                                  BUFFERS_PARM2:
 45885 00000067 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] value of BUFFERS= ,n ;AN000;
 45886                                  BOOTDRIVE:
 45887 00000069 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] the boot drive ;AN000;
 45888                                  DDMOVE:
 45889 0000006A 00                      	db	0 	; [SYSTEM] 1 if we need DWORD move ;AN000;
 45890                                  EXT_MEM_SIZE:
 45891 0000006B 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] extended memory size	;AN000;
 45892                                  
 45893                                  HASHINITVAR: ; LABEL   WORD	; AN000;
 45894                                  ;
 45895                                  ; Replaced by next two declarations
 45896                                  ;
 45897                                  ;UU_BUF_HASH_PTR:
 45898                                  ;	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] buffer Hash table addr
 45899                                  ;UU_BUF_HASH_COUNT:
 45900                                  ;	dw	1	; [SYSTEM] number of Hash entries
 45901                                  
 45902                                  BufferQueue:
 45903 0000006D 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Head of the buffer Queue
 45904                                  DirtyBufferCount:
 45905 00000071 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] Count of Dirty buffers in the Que
 45906                                  			; BUGBUG ---- change to byte
 45907                                  SC_CACHE_PTR:
 45908 00000073 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] secondary cache pointer
 45909                                  SC_CACHE_COUNT:
 45910 00000077 0000                    	dw	0 	; [SYSTEM] secondary cache count
 45911                                  BuffInHMA:
 45912 00000079 00                      	db	0	; Flag to indicate that buffs are in HMA
 45913                                  LoMemBuff:
 45914 0000007A 00000000                	dd	0	; Ptr to intermediate buffer
 45915                                  			;  in Low mem when buffs are in HMA
 45916                                  ;
 45917                                  ; All variables which have UU_ as prefix can be reused for other
 45918                                  ; purposes and can be renamed. All these variables were used for
 45919                                  ; EMS support of Buffer Manager. Now they are useless for Buffer
 45920                                  ; manager ---- MOHANS
 45921                                  ;
 45922                                  	;I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_FIRST_PAGE,3,<0,0,0>  
 45923                                  UU_BUF_EMS_FIRST_PAGE:	
 45924 0000007E 000000                  	db	0,0,0	; holds the first page above 640K
 45925                                  
 45926                                  	;;I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_NPA640,WORD,<0> ; holds the number of pages 
 45927                                  ;UU_BUF_EMS_NPA640:			   ; above 640K	
 45928                                  ;	dw	0			
 45929                                  
 45930                                  CL0FATENTRY:
 45931 00000081 FFFF                    	dw	-1	; M014:	Holds the data that
 45932                                  			; is used in pack/unpack rts.
 45933                                  			; in fat.asm if cluster 0 is specified.
 45934                                  			; SR;
 45935                                  IoStatFail:
 45936 00000083 00                      	db	0	; IoStatFail has been added to 
 45937                                  			; record a fail on an I24 
 45938                                  			; issued from IOFUNC on a status call. 
 45939                                  
 45940                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_MODE,BYTE,<-1>	; EMS mode 	;AN000;
 45941                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_HANDLE,BYTE		; buffer EMS handle ;AN000;
 45942                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_PAGE_FRAME,WORD ,<-1>; EMS page frame # ;AN000;
 45943                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_SEG_CNT,WORD,<1>	; EMS seg count	;AN000;
 45944                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_PFRAME,WORD		; EMS page frame seg address ;AN000;
 45945                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_RESERV,WORD,<0> 	; reserved	;AN000;
 45946                                  ;
 45947                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_MAP_BUFF,1,<0>	; this is not used to save the
 45948                                  						; state of the 	buffers page.
 45949                                  						; This one byte is retained to
 45950                                  						; keep the size of this data 
 45951                                  						; block the same.;
 45952                                  ALLOCMSAVE:
 45953 00000084 00                      	db	0	; M063: temp var. used to 
 45954                                  			; M063: save alloc method in
 45955                                  			; M063: msproc.asm
 45956                                  A20OFF_COUNT:
 45957 00000085 00                      	db	0	; M068: indiactes the # of 
 45958                                  			; M068: int 21 calls for 
 45959                                  			; M068: which A20 is off
 45960                                  DOS_FLAG:
 45961 00000086 00                      	db	0	; see DOSSYM.INC for Bit 
 45962                                  			; definitions
 45963                                  UNPACK_OFFSET:
 45964 00000087 0000                    	dw	0	; saves pointer to the start
 45965                                  			; of unpack code in exepatch.
 45966                                  			; asm.
 45967                                  UMBFLAG:
 45968 00000089 00                      	db	0 	; M003: bit 0 indicates the 
 45969                                  			; M003: link state of the UMBs
 45970                                  			; M003: whether linked or not 
 45971                                  			; M003: to the DOS arena chain
 45972                                  SAVE_AX:
 45973 0000008A 0000                    	dw	0	; M000: temp varibale to store ax
 45974                                  			; M000: in msproc.asm
 45975                                  UMB_HEAD:
 45976 0000008C FFFF                    	dw	-1	; M000: this is initialized to  
 45977                                  			; M000: the first umb arena by 
 45978                                  			; M000: BIOS sysinit.
 45979                                  START_ARENA:
 45980 0000008E 0100                    	dw	1	; M000: this is the first arena 
 45981                                  			; M000: from which DOS will 
 45982                                  			; M000: start its scan for alloc.
 45983                                  
 45984                                  ; End of SYSINITVar block

 46036                                  ;============================================================================
 46037                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 46038                                  ;============================================================================
 46039                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 46040                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 46041                                  
 46042                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 46043                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46044                                  
 46045                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 46046                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 46047                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 46048                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 46049                                  ;
 46050                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 46051                                  ; describing that data item.
 46052                                  
 46053                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 46054                                  
 46055                                  ;
 46056                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 46057                                  ;
 46058                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 46059                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 46060                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 46061                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 46062                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 46063                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 46064                                  ;
 46065                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 46066                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 46067                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 46068                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 46069                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 46070                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 46071                                  ;   as EOF).
 46072                                  
 46073                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 46074                                  
 46075                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 46076                                  
 46077                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 46078 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 46079 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 46080 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 46081                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 46082 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 46083                                  
 46084                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 46085                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 46086                                  ; console.
 46087                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 46088 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 46089 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 46090                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 46091 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 46092 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 46093                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 46094 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 46095 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 46096 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 46097                                  switch_character:
 46098 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 46099 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 46100 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 46101 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 46102 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 46103                                  
 46104                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 46105                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 46106                                  
 46107                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21)
 46108                                  
 46109                                  ;PUBLIC	CritPatch
 46110                                  
 46111                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 46112                                  
 46113                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>
 46114                                  
 46115                                  ;IF (NOT REDIRECTOR) AND (NOT SHAREF)
 46116                                  ;
 46117                                  ;SR; Change code patch address to a variable in data segment
 46118                                  ;
 46119                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 46120                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 46121                                  ;
 46122                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  E&sect
 46123                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  L&sect
 46124                                  ;
 46125                                  ;ELSE
 46126                                  ;	DW	0
 46127                                  ;	DW	0
 46128                                  ;ENDIF
 46129                                  ;ENDM
 46130                                  ;	DW	0
 46131                                  
 46132                                  	; 25/07/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
 46133

 46136 00000319 [860D]                  	dw	redir_patch

 46138                                  
 46139 0000031D 0000                    	dw	0

 46147                                  SWAP_START:	; LABEL BYTE
 46148 00000320 00                      ERRORMODE:	db 0		; Flag for INT 24 processing
 46149 00000321 00                      INDOS:		db 0		; DOS status for interrupt processing
 46150 00000322 FF                      WPERR:		db -1		; Write protect error flag
 46151 00000323 00                      EXTERR_LOCUS:	db 0		; Extended Error Locus
 46152 00000324 0000                    EXTERR:		dw 0		; Extended Error code
 46153

 46157                                  ; end warning
 46158

 46160                                  
 46161 0000032C 80000000                DMAADD:		dd 80h		; User's disk transfer address (disp/seg)
 46162 00000330 0000                    CurrentPDB:	dw 0		; Current process identifier
 46163 00000332 0000                    ConC_Spsave:	dw 0		; saved SP before ^C
 46164 00000334 0000                    exit_code:	dw 0		; exit code of last proc.
 46165 00000336 00                      CURDRV:		db 0		; Default drive (init A)
 46166 00000337 00                      CNTCFLAG:	db 0		; ^C check in dispatch disabled

 46178 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)
 46179 00000340 0000                    FirstArena:	dw 0		; first free block found
 46180 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found

 46182 00000346 0000                    ENDMEM:		dw 0		; End of memory used in DOSINIT
 46183 00000348 0000                    LASTENT:	dw 0		; Last entry for directory search
 46184 0000034A 00                      FAILERR:	db 0		; NZ if user did FAIL on I 24
 46185 0000034B 00                      ALLOWED:	db 0		; Allowed I 24 answers (see allowed_)
 46186 0000034C 00                      NoSetDir:	db 0		; true -> do not set directory
 46187 0000034D 00                      DidCTRLC:	db 0		; true -> we did a ^C exit
 46188 0000034E 00                      SpaceFlag:	db 0		; true -> embedded spaces are allowed in FC

 46299                                  ;============================================================================
 46300                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 46301                                  ;============================================================================
 46302                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 46303                                  
 46304                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 46305                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 46306                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 46307                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 46308                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 46309                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 46310                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 46311                                  ; **********************************************************
 46312                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 46313                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 46314                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 46315                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 46316                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 46317                                  ; **********************************************************	
 46318                                  
 46319                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 46320                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46321                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 46322                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 46323                                  
 46324                                  ; 	ORG     0
 46325                                  
 46326                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 46327                                  
 46328                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 46329                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 46330 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 46331 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 46332                                  
 46333                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 46334                                  
 46335                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 46336                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 46337 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 46338                                  RENBUF:	
 46339 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 46340                                  
 46341                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 46342                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 46343 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 46344                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 46345 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 46346                                  
 46347                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 46348                                   
 46349                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 46350                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 46351                                  
 46352                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 46353                                  
 46354                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 46355                                  
 46356                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 46357                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 46358                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 46359                                  
 46360                                  NAME1:	
 46361 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 46362                                  NAME2:
 46363 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 46364                                  DESTSTART:
 46365 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 46366                                          ;DB      ((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 46367                                  	;times	5  db	0
 46368 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 46369                                  
 46370                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 46371                                  
 46372 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 46373                                  EXTFCB:	
 46374 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 46375                                  SATTRIB:
 46376 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 46377                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 46378 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 46379                                  FOUNDDEL:
 46380 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 46381                                  FOUND_DEV:
 46382 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 46383                                  FSPLICE:
 46384 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 46385                                  FSHARING:
 46386 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 46387                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 46388 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 46389 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 46390 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 46391                                  THISDRV:
 46392 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 46393                                  CLUSFAC:
 46394 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 46395                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 46396 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 46397                                  INSMODE:

 46803                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>----------------------
 46804                                  
 46805                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 46806                                  
 46807                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46808                                  ;
 46809                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 46810                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 46811                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 46812                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 46813                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 46814                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46815                                  ; Example:
 46816                                  
 46817                                  MAP_CASE:
 46818                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 46819                                  
 46820 00000D49 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 46821 00000D4B 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 46822 00000D4D CB                      	RETF
 46823                                  Map1:
 46824 00000D4E 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 46825 00000D50 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46826 00000D51 53                      	PUSH	BX
 46827 00000D52 BB[030B]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 46828                                  FINISH:
 46829 00000D55 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 46830 00000D56 1F                      	POP	DS
 46831 00000D57 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 46832 00000D58 5B                      	POP	BX
 46833 00000D59 1F                      	POP	DS
 46834                                  L_RET:	
 46835 00000D5A CB                      	RETF
 46836                                  
 46837                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 46838                                  
 46839                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46840                                  
 46841                                  ; The variables for ECS version are moved here for the same data alignments
 46842                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.
 46843

 46845 00000D5B 00                      	db	0	; Interim character flag ( 1= interim)  ;AN000;
 46846                                  ;------- NOTE: NEXT TWO BYTES SOMETIMES USED AS A WORD !! -------------------
 46847                                  DUMMY:	; LABEL   WORD
 46848                                  InterCon:  
 46849 00000D5C 00                      	db	0	; Console in Interim mode ( 1= interim) ;AN000;
 46850                                  SaveCurFlg:
 46851 00000D5D 00                      	db	0	; Print, do not advance cursor flag     ;AN000;

 47127                                  ;
 47128                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 47129                                  ; 
 47130                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 47131                                  ;
 47132                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 47133                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 47134                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 47135                                  ;
 47136                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 47137                                  ;
 47138                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 47139                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 47140                                  ;
 47141                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 47142                                  ;
 47143                                  ;############################################################################
 47144                                  
 47145                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 47146                                  
 47147                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47148                                  
 47149                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47150                                  ;
 47151                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 47152                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 47153                                  ;
 47154                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 47155                                  ;
 47156                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 47157                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 47158                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 47159                                  ;
 47160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47161                                  
 47162                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 47163                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 47164                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 47165                                  ;ELSE
 47166                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 47167                                  ;ENDIF
 47168                                  ;ENDM

 47489                                  %if 0
 47490                                  
 47491                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47492                                  ; 04/11/2022
 47493                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47494                                  
 47495                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47496                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 47497                                  ;
 47498                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 47499                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 47500                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 47501                                  ;
 47502                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 47503                                  ;
 47504                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 47505                                  ;
 47506                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47507                                  
 47508                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 47509                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 47510                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 47511                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 47512                                  
 47513                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47514                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 47515                                  ;
 47516                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 47517                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 47518                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 47519                                  ;
 47520                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47521                                  
 47522                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 47523                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 47524                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 47525                                  
 47526                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022
 47527
