 47584                                  ;
 47585                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 47586                                  ;
 47587                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 47588                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 47589                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 47590                                  ;
 47591                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 47592                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 47593                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 47594                                  ;	   4. else 
 47595                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 47596                                  ;	   6. endif
 47597                                  ;	7. else
 47598                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 47599                                  ;	9. endif
 47600                                  ;
 47601                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47602                                  
 47603                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47604                                  
 47605                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47606                                  
 47607                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47608                                  ;
 47609                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 47610                                  ;
 47611                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47612                                  
 47613                                  ldivov:
 47614                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47615                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47616                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47617                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47618                                  i0patch:
 47619 000010D4 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 47620                                  
 47621 000010D6 E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47622                                  divov_cont:
 47623 000010D9 2EFF2E[AC10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 47624                                  
 47625                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47626                                  ;
 47627                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 47628                                  ;
 47629                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 47630                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 47631                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 47632                                  ; will be restored then.
 47633                                  ;
 47634                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47635                                  
 47636                                  lquit:
 47637                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47638                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47639                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47640                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47641                                  i20patch:
 47642 000010DE EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 47643                                  
 47644 000010E0 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47645                                  quit_cont:
 47646 000010E3 2EFF2E[B010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 47647                                  
 47648                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47649                                  ;
 47650                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 47651                                  ;
 47652                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47653                                  
 47654                                  lcommand:
 47655                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47656                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47657                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47658                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47659                                  i21patch:
 47660 000010E8 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 47661                                  
 47662 000010EA E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47663                                  command_cont:
 47664 000010ED 2EFF2E[B410]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 47665                                  
 47666                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47667                                  ;
 47668                                  ; INT 25 
 47669                                  ;
 47670                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47671                                  
 47672                                  labsdrd:
 47673                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47674                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47675                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47676                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47677                                  i25patch:
 47678 000010F2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 47679                                  
 47680 000010F4 E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47681                                  absdrd_cont:
 47682 000010F7 2EFF2E[B810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 47683                                  
 47684                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47685                                  ;
 47686                                  ; INT 26
 47687                                  ;
 47688                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 47689                                  
 47690                                  labsdwrt:
 47691                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47692                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47693                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47694                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47695                                  i26patch:
 47696 000010FC EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 47697                                  
 47698 000010FE E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47699                                  absdwrt_cont:
 47700 00001101 2EFF2E[BC10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 47701                                  
 47702                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47703                                  ;
 47704                                  ; INT 27
 47705                                  ;
 47706                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 47707                                  
 47708                                  lstay_resident:
 47709                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 47710                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47711                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47712                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47713                                  i27patch:
 47714 00001106 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 47715                                  
 47716 00001108 E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47717                                  sr_cont:
 47718 0000110B 2EFF2E[C010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 47719                                  
 47720                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47721                                  ;
 47722                                  ; INT 2f
 47723                                  ;
 47724                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47725                                  
 47726                                  lint2f:
 47727                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47728                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 47729                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47730                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47731                                  i2fpatch:
 47732 00001110 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 47733                                  
 47734 00001112 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47735                                  int2f_cont:
 47736 00001115 2EFF2E[C410]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 47737                                  
 47738                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47739                                  ;
 47740                                  ; CPM entry
 47741                                  ;
 47742                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47743                                  
 47744                                  lcall_entry:
 47745                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 47746                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 47747                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 47748                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 47749                                  cpmpatch:
 47750 0000111A EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 47751                                  
 47752 0000111C E89200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47753                                  callentry_cont:
 47754 0000111F 2EFF2E[C810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 47755                                  
 47756                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47757                                  
 47758                                  lirett:
 47759 00001124 CF                      	iret
 47760                                  
 47761                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47762                                  ;
 47763                                  ; LowIntXX:
 47764                                  ;
 47765                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 47766                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 47767                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 47768                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 47769                                  ;
 47770                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 47771                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 47772                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 47773                                  ;
 47774                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 47775                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 47776                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 47777                                  ;
 47778                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47779                                  
 47780 00001125 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 47781 00001129 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 47782 0000112D 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 47783                                  
 47784                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 47785                                  LowInt23:
 47786                                  					; save the return address that is on
 47787                                  					; the stack
 47788 00001131 2E8F06[2511]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 47789 00001136 2E8F06[2711]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 47790                                  
 47791 0000113B CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 47792                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 47793                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 47794                                  
 47795 0000113D E87100                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 47796                                  
 47797 00001140 2EFF2E[2511]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 47798                                  
 47799                                  
 47800                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 47801                                  LowInt24:
 47802                                  					; save the return address that is on
 47803                                  					; the stack
 47804 00001145 2E8F06[2911]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 47805 0000114A 2E8F06[2B11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 47806                                  
 47807 0000114F CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 47808                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 47809                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 47810                                  
 47811 00001151 E85D00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47812                                  
 47813 00001154 2EFF2E[2911]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 47814                                  
 47815                                  
 47816                                   
 47817                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 47818                                  LowInt28:
 47819 00001159 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 47820                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 47821                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 47822                                  
 47823 0000115B E85300                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 47824                                  
 47825 0000115E CB                      	retf
 47826                                  
 47827                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47828                                  
 47829                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47830                                  ;
 47831                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 47832                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 47833                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 47834                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 47835                                  ;
 47836                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 47837                                  
 47838                                  disa20_xfer:
 47839 0000115F E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 47840                                  
 47841                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 47842                                  
 47843                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 47844                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 47845                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 47846                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 47847                                  
 47848 00001162 FA                      	cli
 47849 00001163 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 47850                                  
 47851 00001169 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 47852 0000116B 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 47853 0000116D FB                      	sti
 47854                                  
 47855 0000116E 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 47856 0000116F 56                      	push	SI
 47857 00001170 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 47858 00001172 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 47859 00001174 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 47860 00001176 CB                      	retf
 47861                                  
 47862                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47863                                  ;
 47864                                  ; M003:
 47865                                  ;
 47866                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 47867                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 47868                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 47869                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 47870                                  ; more info.	
 47871                                  ;
 47872                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 47873                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 47874                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 47875                                  ;
 47876                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47877                                  
 47878                                  disa20_iret:
 47879 00001177 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 47880 0000117A FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 47881 0000117E 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 47882 00001182 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 47883 00001186 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 47884                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 47885 00001188 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 47886 0000118B A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 47887 0000118E A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 47888 00001191 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 47889 00001194 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 47890                                  
 47891 00001197 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 47892 00001198 5B                      	pop	BX
 47893 00001199 59                      	pop	CX
 47894 0000119A 5A                      	pop	DX
 47895 0000119B 5E                      	pop	SI
 47896 0000119C 5F                      	pop	DI
 47897 0000119D 5D                      	pop	BP
 47898 0000119E 1F                      	pop	DS
 47899 0000119F 07                      	pop	ES
 47900 000011A0 CF                      	iret
 47901                                  
 47902                                  ;**************************************************************************
 47903                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 47904                                  ;
 47905                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 47906                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 47907                                  ;
 47908                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 47909                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 47910                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 47911                                  ;
 47912                                  ;**************************************************************************
 47913                                  
 47914                                  XMMDisableA20:
 47915 000011A1 53                      	push	bx
 47916 000011A2 50                      	push	ax
 47917                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 47918 000011A3 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 47919 000011A5 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 47920 000011AA 58                      	pop	ax
 47921 000011AB 5B                      	pop	bx
 47922 000011AC C3                      	retn
 47923                                  
 47924                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 47925                                  
 47926                                  XMMcontrol:
 47927 000011AD 00000000                	dd	0
 47928                                  
 47929                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47930                                  ;
 47931                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 47932                                  ;
 47933                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 47934                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 47935                                  ;
 47936                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 47937                                  ;
 47938                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 47939                                  ;		
 47940                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 47941                                  ;
 47942                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47943                                  
 47944                                  ; 19/09/2023
 47945                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 47946                                  ;	dw	00080h
 47947                                  ;	dw	00000h
 47948                                  ;
 47949                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 47950                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 47951                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 47952                                  
 47953                                  EnsureA20ON:
 47954 000011B1 9C                      	pushf
 47955 000011B2 1E                      	push    ds
 47956 000011B3 06                      	push	es
 47957 000011B4 51                      	push	cx
 47958 000011B5 56                      	push	si
 47959 000011B6 57                      	push	di
 47960                                  
 47961                                  	; 19/09/2023
 47962                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 47963                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 47964                                  
 47965 000011B7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 47966 000011B9 8EC7                    	mov	es,di
 47967 000011BB 4F                      	dec	di
 47968 000011BC BE9000                  	mov	si,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 47969 000011BF 8EDF                    	mov	ds,di
 47970 000011C1 BF8000                  	mov	di,80h ; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 47971                                  	
 47972 000011C4 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 47973 000011C7 FC                      	cld
 47974 000011C8 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 47975                                  
 47976 000011CA 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 47977                                  EA20_RET:
 47978 000011CC 5F                      	pop	di
 47979 000011CD 5E                      	pop	si
 47980 000011CE 59                      	pop	cx
 47981 000011CF 07                      	pop	es
 47982 000011D0 1F                      	pop	ds
 47983 000011D1 9D                      	popf
 47984 000011D2 C3                      	retn
 47985                                  
 47986                                  EA20_OFF:
 47987                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 47988                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 47989                                  
 47990 000011D3 53                      	push	bx
 47991 000011D4 50                      	push	ax
 47992                                  
 47993 000011D5 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 47994 000011D7 2EA3[D010]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 47995 000011DB 2E8926[D210]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 47996 000011E0 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 47997 000011E2 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 47998 000011E4 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 47999                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 48000                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 48001 000011E7 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 48002 000011E9 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 48003 000011EE 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 48004 000011F0 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 48005                                  
 48006 000011F2 2EA1[D010]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 48007 000011F6 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 48008 000011F8 2E8B26[D210]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 48009                                  
 48010 000011FD 58                      	pop	ax
 48011 000011FE 5B                      	pop	bx
 48012                                  
 48013 000011FF EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 48014                                  
 48015                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 48016 00001201 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 48017 00001203 CD10                    	int	10h
 48018 00001205 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 48019 00001207 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 48020 00001209 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 48021 0000120B B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 48022 0000120D CD10                    	int	10h
 48023                                  XMMcont:
 48024 0000120F B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 48025 00001211 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 48026 00001213 CD10                    	int	10h
 48027                                  	
 48028 00001215 BE[3A13]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 48029 00001218 0E                      	push	cs
 48030 00001219 1F                      	pop	ds
 48031 0000121A FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 48032                                  XMMprnt:
 48033 0000121B AC                      	lodsb
 48034 0000121C 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 48035 0000121E 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 48036 00001220 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 48037 00001222 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 48038 00001225 CD10                    	int	10h
 48039 00001227 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 48040                                  
 48041                                  XMMStall:
 48042 00001229 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 48043 0000122A EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 48044                                  
 48045                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48046                                  
 48047                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48048                                  
 48049                                  ; retrodos4.s ; offset 0Ch in BIOS segment (0070h)
 48050                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 48051                                  
 48052                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 48053                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 48054                                  
 48055                                  OldInstanceJunk:
 48056 0000122C 7000                    	dw	70h	;segment of BIOS
 48057 0000122E 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 48058 00001230 0600                    	dw	6	;6 instance items
 48059                                  
 48060                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:contpos, 2
 48061                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:bcon, 4
 48062                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:carpos,106h
 48063                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:charco, 1
 48064                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:exec_init_sp, 34               ;M032
 48065                                  	;dw	070h,offset BData:altah, 1	 ; altah byte in bios
 48066                                  
 48067 00001232 0000[2200]0200          	dw	0,CONTPOS,2
 48068 00001238 0000[3200]0400          	dw	0,BCON,4
 48069 0000123E 0000[F901]0601          	dw	0,CARPOS,106h
 48070 00001244 0000[0003]0100          	dw	0,CHARCO,1
 48071 0000124A 0000[0510]2200          	dw	0,exec_init_SP,34
 48072 00001250 70000C000100            	dw	70h,ALTAH,1	; altah byte in bios
 48073

 48077                                  %if 0

 48079                                  ; M021-

 48082                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable

 48315                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 48316                                  ;
 48317                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 48318                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.

 48345                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry

 48384                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.

 48447                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 48448                                  ;
 48449                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 48450                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 48451                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 48452                                  ;

 48466                                  ; 17/01/2024
 48467                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 48468                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 48469                                  
 48470                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 48471                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 48472                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 48473                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 48474                                  
 48475                                  ; country and code page information
 48476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48477                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 48478 00001351 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 48479 00001359 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 48479 00001362 53595300           
 48480                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 48481 00001366 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 48482                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 48483                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 48484                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 48485                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 48486                                  ;  endif

 48488                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 48489                                  ;  endif
 48490                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 48491                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 48492                                  ;  endif
 48493                                  ;else
 48494 00001399 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 48495                                  ;endif
 48496                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 48497 0000139B 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 48498                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76

 48500 0000139E [010B]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 48501 000013A0 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 48502 000013A2 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 48503 000013A3 [830B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 48504 000013A5 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 48505 000013A7 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 48506 000013A8 [050C]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 48507 000013AA 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 48508 000013AC 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 48509 000013AD [350C]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table

 48588 00001449 01                              db 1
 48589                                  BiosComBlockPtr:
 48590 0000144A 0000<rep 2h>            	times 2 dw 0
 48591 0000144E 00<rep 5h>              	times 5 db 0
 48592 00001453 0400                    	dw 4
 48593 00001455 [DF13]                  	dw INDOS_FLAG
 48594 00001457 [2F14]                  	dw drive_flags
 48595 00001459 [5D14]                  	dw NLS_YES	; "YN"
 48596 0000145B [6114]                  	dw unknown_zero_dd

 48598 0000145D 59                      	db 'Y'
 48599 0000145E 4E                      NLS_NO:	db 'N'
 48600                                  NLS_yes2:
 48601 0000145F 79                      	db 'y'
 48602                                  NLS_no2:
 48603 00001460 6E                      	db 'n'
 48604                                  
 48605                                  unknown_zero_dd:
 48606 00001461 00000000                	dd 0

 48649                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48650                                  
 48651                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 48652                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 48653                                  ;
 48654                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 48655                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 48656                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 48657                                  ;
 48658                                  ;
 48659                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 48660                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 48661                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 48662                                  
 48663                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 48664                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 48665                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID

 48671                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID

 48673                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 48674                                  
 48675                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 48676                                  ;
 48677                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 48678                                  ;	GETBUF:
 48679                                  ;
 48680                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 48681                                  ;	push	es
 48682                                  ;	push	di
 48683                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 48684                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 48685                                  ;	pop	di
 48686                                  ;	pop	es
 48687                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 48688                                  
 48689                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 48690                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 48691                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 48692                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 48693                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 48694                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 48695                                  	
 48696                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 48697                                  
 48698                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 48699                                  ;
 48700                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 48701                                  ;
 48702                                  ;		push	cx
 48703                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 48704                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 48705                                  ;		jz	????
 48706                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 48707                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 48708                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 48709                                  
 48710                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 48711                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 48712                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 48713                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 48714                                  
 48715                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 48716                                  
 48717                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 48718                                  ;
 48719                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 48720                                  ;
 48721                                  ;
 48722                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 48723                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 48724                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 48725                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 48726                                  ;	inc [indos]
 48727                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 48728                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 48729                                  
 48730                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 48731                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 48732                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 48733                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 48734                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 48735                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 48736                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 48737                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 48738                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 48739                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 48740                                  
 48741                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 48742                                  
 48743                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 48744                                  ;
 48745                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 48746                                  ;
 48747                                  ;
 48748                                  ;
 48749                                  ;	push	ax
 48750                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 48751                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 48752                                  ;	pop	ax
 48753                                  ;	jz	????
 48754                                  
 48755                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 48756                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 48757                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 48758                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 48759                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 48760                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 48761                                  
 48762                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 48763                                  
 48764                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 48765                                  ;
 48766                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 48767                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 48768                                  ;
 48769                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 48770                                  ;
 48771                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 48772                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 48773                                  ;	    POP     DS
 48774                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 48775                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 48776                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 48777                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 48778                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 48779                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 48780                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 48781                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 48782                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 48783                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 48784                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 48785                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 48786                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 48787                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 48788                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 48789                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 48790                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 48791                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 48792                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 48793                                  ;	    POP     DS
 48794                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 48795                                  ;
 48796                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 48797                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 48798                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 48799                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 48800                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 48801                                  ;
 48802                                  ;   CRDROK:
 48803                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 48804                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 48805                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 48806                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 48807                                  
 48808                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 48809                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 48810                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 48811                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 48812                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 48813                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 48814                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 48815                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 48816                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 48817                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 48818                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 48819                                  			db	009H,003H
 48820                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 48821                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 48822                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 48823                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 48824                                  			db	05FH
 48825                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 48826                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 48827                                  
 48828                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 48829                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 48830                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 48831                                  
 48832                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 48833                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 48834                                  ;
 48835                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 48836                                  ;
 48837                                  ;
 48838                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 48839                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 48840                                  ;	    je l1
 48841                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 48842                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 48843                                  ;	    int 10h
 48844                                  ;	    jmp l0
 48845                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 48846                                  
 48847                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 48848                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 48849                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 48850                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 48851                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 48852                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 48853                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 48854                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 48855                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 48856

 48868                                  ;============================================================================
 48869                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 48870                                  ;============================================================================
 48871                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 48872                                  
 48873                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 48874                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 48875                                  ;
 48876                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 48877                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 48878                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 48879                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 48880                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 48881                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 48882                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 48883                                  ; to call out here.
 48884                                  ;
 48885                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 48886                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 48887                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 48888                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 48889                                  ;       
 48890                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 48891                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 48892                                  ;
 48893                                  ;Exported Functions
 48894                                  ;==================
 48895                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 48896                                  
 48897                                  ; DosData Segment
 48898                                  
 48899                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 48900                                  
 48901                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48902                                  
 48903                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 48904                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 48905                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 48906                                  ; 'patch' related.
 48907                                  
 48908                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 48909 00001465 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 48910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48911                                  
 48912                                  MagicPatch:
 48913                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 48914 00001467 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 48915 00001468 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 48916 00001469 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 48917 0000146A 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 48918 0000146B 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 48919 0000146C 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 48920                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 48921                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 48922                                  
 48923                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48924                                  
 48925                                  ;DosData Ends
 48926                                  
 48927                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 48928
